loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mr. Sor S. is a villager in the Krang Touch Village in the Takeo Province. He raises ducks and operates a poultry business. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks for his duck breeding business to earn more income. His wife, Mrs. Yong Sath, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Sor S. is a 45-year-old father of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school, and the remaining is too young to work or study. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Mrs. Ky S. is a farmer in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she breeds pigs and chickens. Since her breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Ky S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens, piglets, and pig feed for her breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

She is a 61-year-old widow with three children: one is a construction worker, another stays at home to do housework and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Tulibasobi H.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Tulibasobi M. from Kyela. She is widow with two children between the ages of 13 and 15.

Tulibasobi has been selling vitenge and rice since 2002. She sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with a wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

Tulibasobi works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She currently earns about 350 USD a month from her business.

Tulibasobi is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase more vitenge and crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to open the same business at another location. Tulibasobi thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more vitenge and crops in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary purchases crates of eggs from poultry farms and sells them to her customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She started this business seven years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. Mary is 52 years old and married with five children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Murotali

texts.ru: Худойназаров Муротали- мужчина 35 лет. Муротали женат отец 4-х детей. Муродали занимается продажей запчастей на рынке Аппон Аштского района. Муродали также работает в пожарном охране. Муродали закупает товары у оптовиков на рынках Гули Сурх города Истаравшана. Кредитуется в нашей организации с 2008 года ему нравятся все наши условия поэтому он решил продолжить с нами сотрудничать.
texts.en:
Murotali H. is a 35 year old man, married and the father of four children. He sells spare auto parts at the Appon Asht district market. He also works in the fire protection service. Murotali buys goods from wholesalers at the Guli Surkh markets in the city of Istaravshan. He has been a client of the organization since 2008 and has liked our loan conditions, so he decided to continue working with us.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare auto parts

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle Francisco Suárez de la Zona de Cota huma de La ciudad de La Paz ; la actividad que ella desarrolla es la venta de comida, tiene una pensión en un local que alquiló casi cerca de su casa y con la ayuda de su hijo el negocio satisface las expectativas de sus clientes y marcha bien.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una nevera y algunas mesas para darle un lugar mas profesional y agradable a su negocio.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2005 y pagó muy bien sus anteriores créditos, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Julia C. lives in her own house with her husband and children in the city of La Paz. She sells food in her small restaurant in a rented business space near her home. With her son’s help, the business is prosperous and satisfies customers.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase a freezer and some tables to make her business look more pleasant and professional.

She has been a member of Impro since 2005, and she has satisfactorily repaid her previous loans, which qualifies her for a new one.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase freezer and tables for small restaurant

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela D. L. V. D. 58 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y una nieta la cual esta totalmente a su cargo. Ángela posee una tienda en la cual se comercializan productos perecederos. Ella solicita un préstamo ya que su mayor deseo es poder aumentar sus ventas y esto lo podrá alcanzar surtiendo más su tienda ya que así obtendría mayor clientela la cual le  permita obtener mayores ganancias. Ella trabaja y se esfuerza a diario ya que desea poder brindarle una vida digna a su pequeña nieta.
texts.en:
Ángela D. L. V. is 58 years old and she lives in the municipality of Ahuachapán with her husband and one of her granddaughters who she has full custody of. Ángela owns a store where she sells groceries. She is requesting a loan since her greatest wish is to increase her sales. The loan will help her to stock her store with a greater variety of items so that she will be able to attract new cliental and increase her earnings. She works hard everyday to give a nice life to her young granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Hà Thị

texts.en:
H. Hà Thị (422970646) is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, H. owns andoperates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Inocente

texts.es: Inocente Marín P. tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos. Tiene 49 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy responsable con su familia. Inicio este negocio hace 4 años por iniciativa propia, con el apoyo de de sus hijos ha logrado salir adelante. Anteriormente laboraba como domestica pero como tenía que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y dedicarles el tiempo necesario. Actualmente es una persona que sabe mucho de su negocio y sus clientes disfrutan en conversar con ella. Le financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, colonias y pinturas de labios. A pesar de poseer muy pocos ingresos tiene sus sueños que son establecer una tienda en su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Inocente P. M. has 2 dependent children and is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics. She is 49 years old and is a very responsible woman with her family. She started this business 4 years ago and with the support of her children she has succeed.

She worked as a maid before, but didn’t have time to take care of her children. She is a person who knows a lot about her business and her customers enjoy talking to her. She is asking for a loan for the purchase of perfumes, creams, colognes and lipsticks. Although her income is low, her dreams are to start a beauty shop at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. sells groceries at Elmina. She has senior high school education. She is single and has two children. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and for the upkeep of her dependents.

Mary has been selling groceries since 2006. Her loan will be used to purchase more groceries to sell in her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell in her shop

loans.name: Fatou Ngom

texts.fr: Fatou Ngom S. est une dame de 59 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de mil et de la transformation de mil pour la vente aussi. Elle aimerait développer son activité  et mieux participer aux dépenses familiales.

loans.use: Commerce et transformation mil

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina O., 50 years old, is a rice farmer from Veruela Agusan Del Sur. She has one child who is 18 years old already. She has had a business since 1990 until now. She keeps doing her best to susutain the family livelihood.

Currently she needs additional capital to fund her 1 hectare farm. She would like to request a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farming necessities and improve her yield.

The income she makes from her farm has been very helpful in paying for school and basic needs in their home.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es un joven soltero de 28 años, muy responsable y algo tímido, actualmente vive en una casa alquilada. Hace 8 meses inició su negocio de venta de abarrotes en un espacio de su vivienda, la cual está muy cerca de una escuela de su localidad, por lo que desde que empezaron las clases sus ventas de golosinas han aumentando. Por tal motivo ha empezado a preparar otros bocadillos y postres como: gelatinas, papas rellenas y chupetes, los cuales ofrece durante el tiempo de recreo de los estudiantes de la escuela vecina. De esta forma, Edgar puede obtener el dinero necesario para pagar el alquiler de la casa y sus gastos personales. Por eso se siente muy contento con su negocio, ya que tener una tienda era uno de sus anhelos desde años atrás y ahora que ya lo tiene lo piensa conservar y ahorrar lo suficiente para comprarse un terreno y construir su propia casa. 
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, él se lleva muy bien con todos los integrantes de su banco comunal y asiste a todas las reuniones de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita la utilizará en la compra de bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y sabores.
texts.en:
Edgar is a single young man who is 28 years old. He is very responsible and a bit shy. He currently lives in a rented house. Eight months ago, he started a grocery business in his home which is very close to a local school. Since classes have started up again, his sales of candies have grown. For this reason, he has started preparing other snacks and desserts such as jello, stuffed potatoes and lollipops which he sells during the school's recess. In this way, Edgar can earn the money he needs to pay his rent and personal expenses. This makes him very happy with his business and it was one of his dreams to have his own store. Now that he has one, he would like to save up to buy land and build his own home. This is his second loan with MFP. He gets along very well with the other members of his village bank and attends all of the group meetings. He will use the loan to buy different brands and flavors of sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 27 years old and married to Nicholas who operates his own business. They have three children.

She manages a farm and sells milk from her livestock at the Seregeya market in Eldoret.

Jane was introduced to KADET by an existing borrower and is hoping to get a loan to buy more animal feed, including salt licks, for her calves. She also intends to use the proceeds to fund her children's education and buy a plot of land for her family.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy  more feed for her livestock

loans.name: Seminia Irayda

texts.en:
Seminia is 26 years old and has been married for 10 years.  She and her husband have two children, ages 8 and 3 years old.  Seminia is a cattle farmer. She has 8 dairy cows that produce raw milk. Seminia turns the milk into soft cheese and yogurt, which she sells every day in the market beginning at 6 a.m. She learned dairy cow farming by helping her mother when she was a young girl. She lives at home with her mother in the Maica Central area of the city of Cochabamba.  

Seminia married very young, so she had to begin working from a young age to support her new family. Because her family has scarce economic resources, they do not yet have their own home. 

With this loan from CIDRE, Seminia will purchase another dairy cow. This will increase her milk production and improve her earnings and, ultimately, improve her family's quality of life. She dreams that some day her children will finish their primary and secondary education and that they can go on to become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Zenaida is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of basic products such as shampoo, nescafe, toothpaste, soap, and dried goods in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esmeraldo

texts.en:
Esmeraldo B. is married, is 60 years old, and has four adult children. A resident of Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, he grows different kinds of vegetables like eggplant and root crops.

In 2006, Esmeraldo joined Paglaum MPC because of its programs and services and is now applying for a loan of Php 10,000 as additional capital to purchase fertilizer for eggplant and root crop production. This will be his 6th loan from PMPC.

Esmeraldo’s future plans include enabling his children to complete their studies and providing for their needs as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and animal manure for his vegetables

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon K. is a villager in the Neasar Kiri village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2.3 hectares of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living. With this farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Mon K. decided to ask for a loan for that purpose. 

Her husband, Mr. Meak Chhorn, helps her with the farming. Mrs. Mon K. is the mother of five children, three of whom are laborers while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha P. is 26 years old and a single mother of two school-aged children, who are still living at home. She was married but she divorced her husband since the children were born. Pha P. started to build a new home many months ago but the construction was suspended due to the lack of money, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL to be used to continue building her new house.

loans.use: To continue building her new house.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Both of her children attend a local secondary school. 

With the help of her husband, Altantuya manages a meat-trading business in her town. She sells a variety of locally raised meats to her many customers. She started her business in 2003 with capital of 500,000 MNT and has built a successful operation over the years. She travels between Erdenet and Ulaanbaatar cities to sell her products. 

Today, her business continues to grow quickly and she has a large base of loyal customers. Her working capital now exceeds 1,070,000 MNT.  Altantuya is a hardworking businesswoman and attributes her success to her good accounting skills. For the future she says, “I hope to soon expand my business.” She is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase meat to sell in her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en: Catherine D.'s main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. Catherine is just starting this business. She is 20 years old, married and has two young children. They are from the village of San Lorenzo. In 2010, Catherine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Catherine is requesting a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Catherine is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Catherine D.". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita L., 49, is from the village of PII, Kiburiao, Quezon Bukidnon. Teresita is a widowed mother of seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Teresita's fourth loan taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mercedes Concepción

texts.es:
Este Sra. Se llama Mercedes Concepción F. Vergara, tiene 61 años de edad, casado, ella se dedica a la confección de todo típo de ropa vestir y ropa de cama, en el negocio le ayuda su hija que ya es mayor de edad y su marido, quien ya está pensionado, ella tiene de trabajar en este negocio Veinte y Dos Años, y lo comenzó cuando se caso.
Cuando era joven ella trabajo de aprendiz de costurera, y fue así como se inicio en este negocio.
Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de Diez créditos, los cuales le han servido en gran medida ya que ha habido momentos en los que le han ofrecido mercadería barata y no ha tenido para la compra de ellos.
Vale la pena mencionar que en los Nueve créditos otorgados esta señora ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones, cancelándolos casi todos antes de tiempo estipulado.
texts.en:
Mercedes Concepción F. V.is 61 years old, married, and dedicates herself to making all types of garments and women’s clothing. Her grown daughter and her husband, who is retired, assist her. She has been in the business for twenty-two years, having started out when she got married. When she was young, she worked as a seamstress’ apprentice, which is how she got into the business. She has had ten loans with our institution, which have helped her greatly as there have been times when she’s been offered supplies at good prices and she didn’t have enough funds for a purchase. It’s worth mentioning that, in the nine loans she’s been granted, this lady has been very responsible in her obligations and paid almost all of them off before the term was up.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciano, tiene 36 años y tiene cuatro hijos de las cuales todavía depende de la socia,  ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Feliciana tiene una pequeña empresa de venta de golosinas en el Terminal Terrestre de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Feliciana pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 6 años que participa en el banco comunal y su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, galletas, caramelos, yogurt y helados. El anhelo de la socia es tener una propia tienda en su domicilio. La socia nos cuenta con mucha pena que su mamá tenia una casa en la ciudad de Zurite pero por la causa de las fuertes precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron en la ciudad, inundaron la casa de su mamá dejándola deshabitada. Actualmente, su mamá esta viviendo en un campamento cerca a la ciudad.  
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Zurite esta situada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 36 years old. She has four children who still depend on her. She is a responsible mother who's always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with her daily efforts provide her children with a better future. Feliciana has a little business selling sweets in the bus station in the city of Urubamba. She's had the business for six years and it's gone very well because of her commitment to her work. Feliciana belongs to the Tercer Milenio village bank, which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She's been a member for six years, and her first loan was for $100, which she invested in her business. Currently, she is requesting the loan to purchase soft frinks, cookies, candies, yogurt, and ice cream. Her dream is to have her own shop in her home. She tells us sadly that her mother had a house in the city of Zurite, but that because of heavy rain in the city, the house was flooded, leaving her homeless. At the moment, her mother is living in an encampment near the city. Feliciana is grateful for the opportunity this offers her and is committed to making her payments in full and on time. Zurite is 45 minutes from the city of Cuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, cookies, candies, yogurt, and ice cream

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en: Xuan T. N. is a 29-year old woman with a husband and three children in elementary school. Her main occupation is raising livestock such as pigs and growing rice. She earns approximately 3,000,500 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month. Xuan has participated in SEDA's lending program since 2009 and has always repaid her loans on time. In the last loan term,  Xuan borrowed 5,152,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND in order to repair her pig-pens and to purchase additional pigs to raise.

loans.use: in order to repair her pig-pens and to buy additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga nacio en Potosi el 15 de diciembre de 1945 su esposo el Sr. Felipe no tienen hijos que esten a su cargo ya que son mayores y tienen su vida independiente, hace 10 años que viven y trabajan en Santo Corazon a 5km de limonsito camino a Cañada 2 y hace 6 años que vienen trabajando com emprender, en la cual siembran maiz. yuca, y papa y luego sus productos lo comercializan en el mercado de el Torno, tambien la Sra. Dominga tiene arboles de citricos, estos productos tambien los vende en el mercado de el Torno, con el dinero del credito compraran semillas para la siembra de papa ya  que es temporada de siembra, y este producto se vende todo el año,  es muy trabajadora junto a su esposo lograron construir su casita pero uno de sus deseos es verla terminada, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Dominga was born in Potosi on December 15th of 1945. She and her husband Felipe do not have children in their care, since their children are grown and live independently. For 10 years they have lived and worked in Santo Corazon, 5 kilometers from Limoncito on the Cañada 2 road, and they have worked with Emprender for 6 years. They cultivate corn, yucca, and potatoes, and later sell their products in the El Torno market. Also, Dominga has citrus trees, and she also sells these products in the El Torno market. With the money from the loan they will buy seeds to plant potatoes, since this is the planting season, and this product is sold all year. She is very hardworking, and with her husband managed to build their small home, but one of their desires is to see it finished. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem, a resident of Multan (famous for its sweetmeats), Pakistan and the wife of R. A., owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 23 years.

A very talented lady, Naseem operates a clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighbors and her relatives as well. She charges them PKR 100-130 for each dress. She uses her income to pay for the utilities.

Her husband is a tailor by profession and runs a tailoring center in the community where he sews specifically gentlemen's clothes. His business earns him a profit of PKR 8,000 per month. They both use their income to improve the living standard of their family.

Naseem is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase an electric sewing machine to sew clothes. His manual machine makes him tired now, and it takes a long time to complete the clothes.

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Lela Group

texts.en:
Betty D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Lela. She is 46 years old, married, and has five children who range from 13 to 21 years old. She was able to attend school only through 12th grade. She cares for two siblings. All of her children attend school.

For a year, she has been selling charcoal and oil in the ELWA Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman. She says customers get attracted to her business because she she sells good oil and charcoal.

She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more charcoal and oil. 
 
Her goal is to grow her business, build a shop and to be able to help other members of her family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and oil.

loans.name: Katty Corina

texts.es:
La Señora Katty N. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en el  sector del Crea en la Ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su bella arquitectura, sus 4 ríos quienes bañan esta hermosa ciudad, las manos hábiles de sus artesanos y su deliciosa gastronomía.

Nuestra socia es de la ciudad de Guayaquil pero vive en Cuenca hace 11 años la cual vino en busca de trabajo y un mejor porvenir para su familia, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 20, 17, 12, 6 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo no esta a su cargo ya que vive con su abuelo en la ciudad de Guayaquil, su segundo hijo le ayuda en la economía de su hogar ya que se dedica a trabajar, sus hijos de 12 y 6 años estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando, su esposo al igual que nuestra socia se dedican a la  de venta de comida trabajando de domingo a domingo sin descansar un solo día, laboran desde las 8 .m. hasta las 3 p.m.

 Es su segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir, lo va  a invertir en la compra de otra carreta (carrito para vender comida) y así crecer en su negocio, va a comprar  ollas y una cocina que le hacen mucha falta, su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Katty N. is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” (Uncovia Rebirth). She lives in the Crea section of the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay Province. Cuenca is known for its writers and artists, its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that bathe this beautiful city, the skillful hands of its artisans, and its delicious cuisine.

Katty is from the city of Guayaquil, but moved to Cuenca eleven years ago in search of work and a better future for her family. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children (ages 20, 17, 12, 6, and 3). The oldest child is no longer under her care because he lives with his grandfather in Guayaquil. Her second child is working and helps with the household finances. The children who are 12 and 6 attend school in the city. Katty does not have her own house and lives in a rental property. Her husband works in the same business as Katty selling food Sunday through Sunday without a day of rest. They work from 8am until 3pm.

This is the second loan she has received through Fundación ESPOIR. She plans to invest the funds in the purchase of another food cart to grow her business. Katty will also buy pots and a stove that she lacks. Her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a stove, pots, and a food cart

loans.name: Lauriana

texts.en:
Lauriana S. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 57 years old. Lauriana is widowed and has seven adult children. Lauriana owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lauriana has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

Lauriana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Lauriana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lauriana is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child, who is not yet in school.  

Fiona has a business of selling food, which she has had for one year. 

To help expand her business, Fiona is requesting a loan of 150,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more food to sell.  Fiona hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to increase her capital.  In the future, Fiona hopes to go back to her studies. 

About BRAC Uganda:  This loan is administered by BRAC Uganda, a registered non-governmental organization (NGO) in Uganda that is also a part of the BRAC international network.  BRAC Uganda attempts to address poverty through a holistic model, offering programs in education, health, water & sanitation, agriculture and micro-finance. BRAC Uganda’s micro-finance program aims to provide the poor with easy, reliable, and efficient access to institutional financial services, and reaches over 150,000 families in Uganda.  For more on BRAC Uganda, please see our partner page at http://www.kiva.org/partners/65, and join our lending team, Friends of BRAC Uganda, at http://www.kiva.org/team/friends_of_brac_uganda

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE MAME DIARRA a été mis sur pied le jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL dont il fait partie. Il est composé de 15 femmes. Outre les liens de parenté qui les lient, les femmes partagent le même air géographique. Le petit commerce est leur activité principale.

Madame Dior D., debout à droite de la photo, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 8 enfants

Elle est vendeuse de beignets. Elle prépare les beignets de ses propres mains avant de le vendre au détail à la gare routière de son quartier. 

Avec son crédit elle va acheter de la farine de blé, de l’huile végétale, du charbon de bois et des condiments pour la préparation et cuisson de ses beignets. 

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa famille en ce qui concerne la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The SOPE MAME DIARRA solidarity group was created on the inauguration day of the Banc Villageois of DVF GUEOUL, to which it belongs. It consists of 15 women. Aside from kinship, the women share the same geographic air. Their main activity is small trade. Mrs. Dior D., standing at the right of the photo, is the group leader. She is divorced and lives with her eight children. She sells beignets, which she makes by hand and then retails at the neighborhood bus station. With her loan, she plans to buy wheat flour, vegetable oil, charcoal and condiments for the preparation and cooking of beignets. Her goal is to support her family and provide her children with food, health care, and schooling.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and condiments to make beignets

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano de 41 años, trabaja en la venta de comida y golosinas, el inicio este negocio con fondos propios, pues como todo padre responsable busca la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Por lo que trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, por lo que siempre están llegando diferentes clientes a buscar diferentes productos él siempre se esmera en ofrecer un buen servicio pues así es que ha tenido una gran cantidad de clientes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima necesaria para su actividad. En el futuro quiere surtir su negocio y así ofertar una gran variedad.
texts.en:
Mariano, age 41, works in food and candy sales. He started this business with his own funds, and as a responsible father he wants a way to generate income for his family. So, he works every day from 7 am to 8 pm. Different customers are always arriving in search of different products, so he always goes to a lot of trouble to offer a good service; because of this, he has had a lot of customers. With this loan he wants to buy basic materials for his work. In the future he wants to increase his stock and thus offer a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gueni

texts.es:
La Señorita Gueni es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”,  ubicado en la provincia de Huancané  y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera, no  tiene  hijos. Gueni estudió   educación superior pero no lo culminó.

La señorita Gueni esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses como grupo mientras tanto y ahora como Banco Comunal,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de Artefactos electrodomésticos. 

En la actualidad la señorita  solicitará un nuevo  crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá  incrementar el capital de su negocio y aumentar la mercadería del negocio. 

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una micro empresa.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la organización de la Institución.
Notese en la foto junto a uno de sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Gueni is a member of the community bank "The Pearls II". It is located in the province of Huancane, Puno. She is 19 years old, she is single, and she has no children. She started college courses but she never completed her diploma. Gueni has been a member of the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for the past 8 months, first as a group member and now as part of the community bank. The first loan she requested of 500 nuevos soles allowed her to supplement her business' working capital, selling household products. She requests a new loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles, funds that will permit her to supplement her business and increase the merchandise she has in stock. Her dream for the future is to have a small business. What she most likes about the community bank is the orderliness and organization of the institution. (Note: she is pictured here together with her siblings).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase household products.

loans.name: Eucalda

texts.es: Eucalda vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió como jugando todo lo que era necesario para la correcta siembra y producción de las tierras donde cultiva principalmente el maíz y también la papa. La venta de maíz le ha resultado muy rentable, ya que le permitía sustentar muy bien a su familia, además de dar educación a sus hijas que era lo que más le interesaba. Siempre ha disfrutado de realizar la actividad agrícola ya que siempre le ha gustado el paisaje de su zona, ha pasado el tiempo y continúa  sembrando maíz. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica también a la crianza de  ganado porcino, para luego comercializarlo en las ferias de la zona por donde vive, de esta manera logra obtener ganancias extras de la agricultura. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar arveja, puesto que sabe que el precio de esta legumbre esta muy alto en el mercado. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abono ya que en esta ocasión va incrementar la cantidad de terrenos sembrados.
texts.en:
Eucalda lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. From a very young age, just like a game, she learned everything about the optimal planting and production of the lands where she now grows mainly corn and potatoes. The sale of corn has proved to be very profitable and supports her family, as well as providing her daughters with an education, which was the most important thing for her. She has always enjoyed farming because she loves the landscape in her area. Time has gone by but she still sows corn. She also raises pigs to sell them at local fairs and get some extra income on top of the one she gets from agriculture. She is a very enterprising woman and in future she plans to sow peas, because their price is high in the current marketplace. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to have financial backing and she has always proved to be very responsible in her payments. She also enjoys being part of her loan group because all members are responsible and supportive. She would like to thank those managing her loan request as it will be very valuable in the development of her business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizers and manure, which will increase the amount of land available for sowing.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Rutaraka Twimukye Group

texts.en: Emmanuel, a 41-year-old living in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda is a father to six children and owns a maize-milling machine that he has operated for 5 years. He dreams of having several machines in different areas to capture a bigger market in future. He wants a loan to buy spare parts for the milling machine.

loans.use: Buying spare parts for maize-milling machine

loans.name: Dulsora

texts.en:
Dulsora B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 64 years old. Dulsora is widowed and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Dulsora owns and operates a specialized retail store.  The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, and soft drinks in the local community. Dulsora has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Dulsora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dulsora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dulsora is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Dulsora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar R. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia.  He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His wife is a nurse but currently unemployed and so she helps with Enhbaatar's business while he works as a carpenter in their town. He has owned his carpentry business since 2007, after living in the countryside as a herder till 2006. 

Within the short time he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. At first, he started to produce small wooden products such as tables, chairs and boxes, etc., and since 2008, has been making and selling a range of furnishings in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and through the "Ger Initiative" project of ADRA International Non-Government Organization. 

He produces not only a variety of furnishings but also a small souvenirs such as dolls, toy vehicles and carriages to sell through the ADRA organization. After years of successful operation, his earnings have enabled him to purchase a plot of land and a fence. Moreover, he was able to start building a new house that will be used as both a workplace and living accommodation. 

Enhbaatar says, " I will have soon my own house and now I plan to buy a new car that will enable me to operate a taxi service and transport my own products." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan  to purchase a new car in order to start a taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new car to use as a taxi and to transport his products

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
This is Aurora O., 64, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Remigio O., and together with their child, they manage the household and the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Aurora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piecemeal rates.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Aurora dreams of being able to improve their business and having a comfortable and happy life for her family forever. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista N. lives in the Kitintale neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. 

Teopista has a food stall. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 7 days a week. Teopista sells her products from home.

Teopista has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes.          Her main business challenges include transportation and ever increasing prices of food. She hopes to start buying food directly from farmers. Teopista lives in a home that she owns. She has electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 30 years old. She's a single mother with one son. She has a green grocery store where she specialises in selling raw bananas. She has been in the business for two years and earns an income of about Kshs. 27,800 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it to buy more bananas from Kisii town which is very well known to produce high quality bananas. She hopes to expand her business and become a leading banana supplier in the area, give her son a quality education, and have a better life in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas and pay for transportation from Kisii to Thika.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Pro Desarrollo” cooperative bank, located in the Pisac district of the province of Calca.

Her name is Ceferina, and she is 57 years old. Ceferina is a widow and has one child. She is requesting the loan to invest in more food products for her food sales business. She makes food in her home and sells the dishes in the Pisac market to the people who come to shop.

She is very happy with the loan granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in food sales business.

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Self Help” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Ya Marie K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and is married to a building contractor.   Together they have six children. Ya Marie has been a businesswoman for nine years, selling sardines, powdered milk, soaps, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy sardines, powdered milk, soaps, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun R. and her husband, Mr. Kheng Klork, live along National Road Number 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have five children.  Roeun sells fruits. Her husband is a construction contractor. Typically when 10% of the construction is finished, his customers will pay him. But he has to pay for workers upfront and does not have the funds to do so.  Therefore, Roeun is requesting a loan for her husband, which will be use to pay his workers.

loans.use: To pay for workers fees

loans.name: Saturnina Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 62 años D. edad y tiene tres hijos, ella viven al ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Zoila nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño taller D. confección D. ropa, ella hace chompas para niños, bebes, damas y caballeros a pedido del cliente y también venD. los domingos en la plaza Túpac Amaru D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo hilos, lana y otras cosas más que se necesitan. 

Zoila pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Zoila, 62, has three children.  She lives in the city of Cusco, Perú.  Zoila tells us that she has a small dressmaking workshop.  She makes sweaters for children, babies, women and men to order and also sells Sundays in Cusco’s Túpac Amaru square.  She’s had the business for several years now and does very well.  This time around she needs a loan to buy materials like thread, wool and other things that are needed.

Zoila is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength & Friendship) communal bank.  While pledging to repay in a timely fashion she also expresses her gratituD. for the opportunity provided by this means.

loans.use: To buy materials like wool, thread and others.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mr. Sokha P. is 35 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Vuthy Kleng, is 31 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1991 and have four children - two sons and two daughters. Two are in school and the other two are still too young. 

Sokha buys cows from other provinces far away from his house and resells them in his village and the nearby villages. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to expand his business by buying additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional cows to resell.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en: Sifa K. is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. Sifa has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past three years. His potential customers are his neighbors. Sifa dreams of expanding and purchasing a tuk tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) to earn more profits in his business. He is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase another motorbike. He decided to join Yehu because of the availability of loans.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is a single man. Alijon has a business selling building materials and household goods in the market of «Sultoni Kobir». He has been in this business for 7 years. He buys goods from wholesale supplier and sells them at the market. His average income is 300 Somoni per a day. He purchases the goods from wholesaler for between 1000 and 5000 Somoni. 

Alijon would like to get a loan of  US$1100 to purchase building materials and household goods to sell. He thanks all lenders who support him, which allows him to expand his business and improve his family’s life.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy building materials and household goods to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena M. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old and married, with 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Rowena runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and instant noodles. Rowena has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rowena joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and snack foods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo S. is a 41-year-old married man living in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur.

Leonilo has run a sari-sari store for 21 years. He also tills land where he grows rice crops. He earns about 30,000 PHP per month from the farm and store.

This loan will be used to purchase dry goods and additional merchandise for his store. Through this, he will be able to offer his customers a greater variety of products. 
 
In the future, Leonilo hopes to have a bigger store and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods and additional merchandise.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 39 years old and married. He has four school-going children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years.  He also farms to boost his income. Benjamin testifies that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has become more independent. In the future, he hopes to expand his shop into wholesale. He has requested a loan of 58,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, and soap.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, and soap

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and lives in West Point. She is married to a contractor at a construction firm. They have six children between the ages of two and twenty, all of whom attend school.
For the past 20 years, Mary has been selling oil in the local market. During the rainy season her sales are low but nevertheless she still makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase 30 gallons of oil for her business. Mary plans to send her children to university and build a house for them in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 30 gallons of oil for her business.

loans.name: Melisa Nelva

texts.es:
Melisa es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 19 años y solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio de papa seca y cereales. Melisa tiene una hija de un año y 11 meses.
El primer préstamo que recibió lo invirtió en cereales y animales en el mercado (que vendió por kilo).  Desde que Melisa y su mamá empezaron con FINCA Perú sus vidas han superado enormemente. Su madre se retiró hace dos años pero convenció a Melisa que ingresara a FINCA Perú.
Su sueño para el negocio son tener su propia casa y darle buena educación y alimentación a su hija.
texts.en:
Melisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Fortaleza” (Strength). She is 19 years old and requesting a loan to invest in her business of selling dried potatoes and grain. Melisa has a daughter who is a year and eleven months old.

This is her first loan and the funds will be invested in grains and animals from the market that are sold by the kilo. After Melisa and her mother joined FINCA Peru, their lives have improved tremendously. Her mother retired two years ago, but she was responsible for convincing Melisa to join FINCA Peru.

Her dreams are to have a house of her own and to feed and educate her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase grains and animals.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has 4 children.  She operates a food station in Abura where she sells food such as fufu, banku, rice balls and others items.  She has had this business for 10 years. Her partner is a cleaner.   Aba uses her income to support her partner take care of their home. Aba will use this loan to purchase food items such as cassavas, plantains and others to cook and sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she plans to build a proper restaurant.

loans.use: buy food items to cook and sell

loans.name: Noupagagnon Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON VI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  TAMBA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide et le pois sucré avec SAFIATOU 1ère à droite position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 0.5 hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Noupagagnon VI group are all married women averaging 35 years of age, with three children, and living mostly in polygamous families in Tamba, a village in the commune of Nantien, Sikasso Prefecture, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and their prior loans have been duly repaid.

They cultivate peanuts [ground nuts] and sweet peas, which is, for example, what Safiatou does (she is the first one standing on the right in the photo). With her loan, she plans to pay labor costs, buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and seeds in order to work a land plot of 0.5 ha [1.2 acres].

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the village and at the Sikasso market to a customer base composed of both men and women.

She plans to earn an average income of 30,000 West African Francs per agricultural season.

This income will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband provide for everyday household expenses. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to cultivate her land better and derive a bigger income from it.

loans.use: to pay the costs of manual labor and buy seeds, fertilizers etc.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has one school-aged child at this time. She buys and sells various products to earn a living. She has been working in the business for three years. Liberty generates a monthly income of PHP 2,000 from this job. 

Liberty has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 at GDMPC to purchase various products such as cloths, bags, laundry soaps, slippers, kitchen wares and more to sell in the local community. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. Liberty hopes to acquire more products to sell in the local community and have a space for the business in town.

loans.use: to purchase various products to sell such as cloths, bags, laundry soaps, slippers, kitchenware and more

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es:
Karla, es empleada, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella trabaja D. lunes a viernes en la alcaldía municipal, tiene más D. un año, trabaja D. lunes a viernes D. 8:00am a 4:30 pm, los sábados D. 8:00am a 12:00md.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para solventar unos gastos personales, pues ha comprado unos materiales D. cocina y los quiere pagar completamente, este préstamo le ayudara a librarse D. otras deudas y tener los materiales y utensilios D. cocina.
Su objetivo es trabajar por sus hijos, con el préstamo espera cancelarlo debidamente y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Karla is employed, and lives with her two children and husband.  She works Monday through Friday for the municipal government, where she has been for more than a year.  She works Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 pm, and Saturday from 8:00am to noon.

She is requesting a loan to pay for some personal expenses, as she has bought some kitchen equipment and wants to pay for them completely.  This loan will help her to get free from her other debts and have the kitchen equipment and utensils.

Her aim is to work for her children.  She expects to pay back the loan promptly and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Liza has a retail shop where she sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Liza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 28 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  He is married and has no children.  He has a business of selling mobile phones and phone accessories, which he has had for 2 years.         

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase mobile phones and phone accessories for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, he hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business. Robert is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is 47 years old and is engaged in sewing clothes and fabric as a source of income. She was blessed with two children. To meet their educational needs requires a lot of sacrifices and hard work.  For this reason, Glory is working hard to earn enough money to provide for the educational needs of her children.

Glory also operates a hog business as an additional source of income. She wants to expand and maximize her businesses by asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy new fabric and to buy feed for her hog. This could increase her net sales and  allow her to save for the future of her beloved children. She hopes they will finish their education and hold degrees someday.  Glory aims for a better living and not to suffer forever from poverty.  That’s why she continues working hard.

loans.use: to buy new fabric to sew, and feed for her hog

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Vivian has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 36-year-old, married man from Gaza. He lives with his wife and four children, three of whom are in school. Currently, Ahmad needs to help his family financially as his children are now in school and their needs have increased. He decided to take this loan to open a supermarket. He hopes that this loan will enable him to buy the necessary things for the supermarket and groceries as well. He hopes that by starting his own business he and his family will be living a better life.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Ourk

texts.en:
Ourk, 48 years old, sells fish with her husband, each earning $5 per day. They have two children, both of whom work in the garment factory, each earning $3 per day. Every month, Ourk spends $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on rental fees, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses.

Ourk would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fish to sell. She wants to expand her career when she can earn a better income and be able to save enough money.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi, 40 years old, is married and has three children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. 

He applied for his second loan from  KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds and also land preparation). 

With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children.

He dreams of being a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, notwithstanding limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer se denomina el grupo de 15 mujeres de Ciudad del Este, ellas con la idea de poder mejorar sus ingresos, se unieron a la fundación, pero se dieron cuenta que esto no solo les serviría para ello, sino también para capacitarse y seguir creciendo. Actualmente están en el séptimo ciclo del programa, y desean poder seguir.
Una de las miembros es la señora Felicia, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras de todo tipo, comenta que a muy tempranas horas de la mañana se levanta para poder tener siempre los productos más frescos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Gracias a su buena atención y a la buena calidad de sus productos ella ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, y dice que aunque su trabajo sea muy sacrificado ella seguirá para darle a su familia todo lo mejor, ya que no quiere que pasen por privaciones.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, repollos, lechuzas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener buenos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is named Renacer (To be Born Again) and has 15 members from the city of Este. They formed the group with the idea of improving their earnings, but they realized that this would not be the only benefit to them, but that they also would be trained and be able to grow. They are in the 7th cycle of the program, and they would like to be able to continue.

Felicia is one of the members. She sells all kinds of vegetables. She says that she gets up very early in the morning in order to be able to always have the freshest products to offer her customers. Thanks to her good attention and the good quality of her products she has been able to move her family forward and she says that although she makes sacrifices because of her work she will continue with it in order to give her family all the best, and she does not want them to be deprived.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy tomatoes, locotos [a member of the capsicum family], onions, cabbages, lettuces, and other items with which she will be able to stock up and to have good products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, locotos, onions, cabbages, lettuce and other items

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: 44-year-old Lorna is a married woman with 5 children. Her oldest child is 24 years old.  Lorna and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband operates their boat and she sells his catch in a small stall at the market. She plans to use her loan to purchase a fishing boat and nets. Lorna hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and nets

loans.name: Liseth Katherine

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a Liseth, tiene 20 años de edad está soltera y vive en la casa de los padres, ella estudia en para licenciada en un Instituto de la localidad. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas  y organizadas.

Ella además de dedicarse a sus estudios también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, además de productos Yanbal y Esika (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad dos o tres días a la semana y en su centro de estudios vende todos los días que tiene clases, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva en este negocio dos años y su mercadería la comprar en Huaquillas.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos y ropa de niños. 

Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y ser profesional.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza y Progreso” (Hope and Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture, and its pre-Columbian art, known nationally and internationally.  It’s also known for its famous straw hats.

Here we meet Liseth.  She’s 20 years old, single, lives with her parents, and is a law student at a local law school.  This is her second cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because her fellow members are very reliable and organized.

Besides studying, she also sells all types of clothing and Yanbal and Esika products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, accessories, and other things).  She sells door to door and takes orders.  She works around her neighborhood two or three days a week, and around her school every day she has class.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  She’s been doing this for two weeks and buys her merchandise in Huaquillas.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, and children’s clothing.

Her dream is complete her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Né en 1978 à Sikasso ville, Monsieur Siaka  est marié et père de 2 enfants.  Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et ses frères à Lafiabougou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso..
Monsieur Siaka n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, s’est vite initié à l’achat et à la vente des articles de quincaillerie. Il dispose d’une  Quincaillerie au grand marché de Sikasso. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’une année. Il a bénéficié deux crédits  qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. Ainsi, il est à son troisième crédit lui permettant d’augmenter son fonds de commerce.
 Avec ce troisième crédit, il compte acheter,  22 cartons baquettes, 15 boîtes de colle, 18 paquets de peinture, 80 mètres de fil, 10 pelles et 10 piques. Il s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants grossistes à Bamako avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des constructeurs de maison (architectes, entrepreneurs, maçons, etc.).
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born in 1978 in Sikasso village, Mr. Siaka is married and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in a big traditional family with his parents and his brothers in Lafiabougou, a suburb of Sikasso. Mr. Siaka did not have the chance to finish school, so he quickly began buying and selling hardware. He has a hardware store at a large market in Sikasso.
