He is well sought-out by his clients because of the quality of his products. To satisfy his growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than a year ago.  He has received two loans which were both properly repaid. This is his third loan which will allow him to increase his business. With the third loan, he plans to buy 22 cardboard tubs, 15 boxes of glue, 18 cans of paint, 80 meters of wire, 10 shovels, and 10 spades. He buys from wholesale traders in Bamako before reselling to his clients - generally composed of home builders (architects, contractors, masons, etc.). With this loan, he plans to make a monthly profit of 275,000 FCFA which will be used for family expenses, paying interest on his loan, and investing in the rest of his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Verna has had a food shop or "sari-sari" for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Verna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Paix Plus Group

texts.en: Evelyne is the leader of a community bank named Paix Plus, which is composed of 11 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. Evelyne is 42 years old, married, and the mother of five children, of whom three go to school. Evelyne sells loaves of bread. She has been in business since 2004, with a beginning capital of US $50. After learning through her friend about Hope’s loan program she decided to join one of its groups in November 2007. Evelyne has already received nine loans from Hope that she repaid correctly. With her next loan she is planning to purchase 250 trays of loaves of bread to increase the inventory of her business in order to generate more profit. Every month her business generates a profit of US $500. Evelyne’s dream is to be a provider of those products in her area. She runs her business in the southwestern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to reinforce her working capital and purchase 250 trays of loaves of bread to resell at a profit

loans.name: Aydah

texts.en:
Aydah is a 42-year-old married woman from Rafah. She is a mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. Aydah started her own project three years ago where she sells and repairs gasoline lamps. People there use it a lot because electricity is not available everyday.

Aydah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more lamps for her store to resell. This will increase her sales and also her income. 
Aydah appears in the photo in her store

loans.use: to buy more lamps for her store to resell.

loans.name: Nonvignon 2 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON 2 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Woto Baï Colette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 46 ans. Woto Baï Colette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Woto Baï Colette est mariée à un couturier du nom de René. Le couple a trois  enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Woto Baï Colette vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Woto Baï Colette vend des produits cosmétiques par la technique de distribution depuis une vingtaine d'année. Woto Baï Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Woto Baï Colette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIGNON 2, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Maria Pastora

texts.es:
María de 49 años de edad, es una mujer optimista, trabajadora y esforzada, es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace cinco años, este negocio la ha sustentado y ha mejorado su condición de vida gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo.
María, se siente agradecida con la financiera MiCrédito y kiva,  actualmente está tramitando su onceavo préstamo con Mi Crédito y el segundo con el programa Kiva, sus préstamos anteriores siempre los ha invertido en la pulpería, en la compra de productos básicos, tales como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, lácteos, enlatados, abarrotes y productos comunes del hogar. 
El dinero recibido del actual financiamiento, lo piensa invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos para ofrecer en su pulpería, asegura que este préstamo mejorará su economía por que estaría invirtiendo en productos solicitados en esta temporada y así obtendrá ganancias extras.
María, desea reestructurar la construcción de su negocio y ampliar su local, luego de pagar el préstamo vigente,  ya que el espacio en el que actualmente desenvuelve sus negocios le es muy pequeño. Afirma que gracias a su dedicación, la ayuda de su esposo y el acompañamiento de Mi Crédito ha logrado salir adelante.

loans.use: Compra de ropa y cosméticos.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Madame M. Bernadette est née vers 1970 à Davié – Tsévié où elle mène son activité de vente de riz préparé. Quatrième enfant des neuf que compte sa famille, ses parents n’avaient pas assez de moyens pour la scolariser. Elle a d’abord servi comme domestique à Lomé. C’est de là qu’elle tient son art culinaire. Revenue dans sa ville natale pour s’occuper de sa maman malade, elle s’est mariée avec un tailleur et mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari, compte tenu de sa situation socio économique, n’a pas de revenus fixes pour couvrir les dépenses du foyer. Ainsi, la plupart des charges du ménage reposent-elles sur Bernadette. Très courageuse et malgré tous ses problèmes, elle a su bien gérer et rembourser promptement son premier crédit de $ 450 obtenus, ce qui démontre sa bonne foi et honnêteté. Elle est pleine de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement

Bernadette sollicite un nouveau crédit de $950 qui va servir à faire d’une part le stockage de céréales et d’autre part à renforcer la vente de riz afin d’éviter des ruptures répétées de stock. Ce qui va lui permettre de d’augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Stockage de céréales et vente de riz

loans.name: Nengsih

texts.en: N. is 36 years old and is married with four children aged 19, 16, 8, and 1. The first three are girls, and the last child is a boy. She sells kerosene, some snacks, and other household goods in a small kiosk. Her husband, Nali, is a fisherman with unfixed income. She can earn $6 per day. She is requesting $50 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Small Kiosk

loans.name: Reine

texts.en:
Born in Aklakou in 1977, where she currently lives, Mrs. Reine T. is married and has two children. A fashion designer by profession, but with no means to open a workshop, she entered the small catering business. Today, she maintains a significant clientele, but her means are not up to meeting their demand.

For this reason she is asking for a loan of $1000 to satisfy this ever-increasing demand. With this loan, she will be able to buy bags of maize, firewood, oil, and other necessities for her restaurant. Thus she will be able to generate more revenue and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Aklakou en 1977 où elle réside actuellement, Madame Reine T. est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Couturière de profession et ne disposant pas de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier, elle s’est lancée dans la mini restauration. Aujourd’hui elle détient une clientèle assez importante mais les moyens dont elle dispose ne sont pas à la hauteur de la demande.

A cet effet elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour satisfaire la demande qui ne cesse de s’augmenter. Avec ce crédit, elle pourra s’acheter des sacs de mais, du bois de chauffe, de l’huile et les nécessaires pour son restaurant. Ainsi elle pourra tirer plus de revenu et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, firewood, oil, and necessities for her restaurant

loans.name: Amon Marie

texts.en: O. Amon Marie is a dynamic 42-year-old woman. She is married and has 5 children. Marie lives with her family in Treichville, a popular and commercial district in the south of Abidjan. Marie wholesales various fruits such as cola nuts in the Treichville open market. Marie, whose children go all to school, is the main resources provider for her family. She is very well organized and rigorous. She has always repaid her loans in good manner. She wants to purchase in bulk a stock of cola nuts from the field in the northern region of Côte d’Ivoire for export to neighbouring  Ghana. This is a good business opportunity for Marie.

loans.use: Amon Marie will use the loan to purchase a stock of cola nuts to export

loans.name: José Magdaleno

texts.es:
José is a married father of two. His wife helps him with the business in her free time. The main reason he started his business was to move the family forward, allowing him to provide an education for his children and pay the bills. He started with a small convenience store about five years ago, but a year later he decided to convert it into a stationery shop and haberdashery because he saw more opportunity at the location for that type of business. Thanks to the store he's been able to cover expenses and he hopes to continue growing the business.

José is requesting a loan of $925, which he will use to purchase supplies to better stock his shop. He plans to repay the loan within six months. He and his family are very grateful for your support in helping improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

José es un hombre casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio en sus tiempos libres, la principal causa por la que puso su negocio fue para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos dándoles educación y también pagar las cuotas de su casa, al inicio empezó con una tiendita de abarrotes hace aproximadamente 5 años atrás, pero al año decidió cambiar el giro del negocio a papelería y mercería, por que vio que por la ubicación de su tienda le era más rentable ese negocio que los abarrotes, ya gracias a su negocio a podido solventar sus gastos y desea continuar creciendo con su negocio.

José esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y tener más surtido su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, él y su familia te agradecen tu apoyo para continuar mejorando su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase haberdashery and stationery supplies

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia A. is 35 years old and is married with 6 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she sells cooked food and provisions.  She has 6 years of experience in the business.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more foodstuff and drinks to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member and promises to repay her loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more cooked food & provisions to sell

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mr. Im Chak, 49, is a father of three children and lives with his wife in Bathambnong province, Cambodia.  He works as a construction foreman, earning around $4/day in revenue, while his wife stays at home cooking food for her household. Additionally, one of his children works as a construction worker and the other two are enrolled in school.  

Mr. Im Chak plans to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for one of his children to operate a motor-taxi whenever he is not occupied with his schooling.  Mr. Im Chak believes this will raise his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of his children to operate a motor-taxi so that it enables him to help increase his familý's income generation.

loans.name: Zal

texts.en:
Zal H. owns and operates a shoe repair shop in the northeasterly town of Khachmaz. He is married and has seven children.

Zal has been working as a cobbler for 15 years. He has already repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for additional funding of $1,200 so that he can purchase items such as: leather, tools, and mainly a new work bench.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and material for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is a 32 year old married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 12. Ashura is a tailor, a business she started in 2005. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $30.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Adjelé

texts.fr:
Born October 12, 1956 in Lomé, Madame Adjelé A. is married and the mother of seven children. Currently, she only takes care of three these, one who is now in University and two others who attend college. She has been a vender of pearls in the great market of Lomé since 1976. Her customers come from Benin, Nigeria and Ghana. With her business, Mrs. A. has been able to construct her own home. Continually presented with competition by others who enter into the pearl trade, she needs to find ways to remain competitive. This is difficult with her limited stock. In order to improve this, she is asking for a loan of 500,000 FCFA in order to purchase one container of pearls. With her new stock, she will be able to improve her sales.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née le 12 octobre 1956 à Lomé, Madame A. Adjelé est mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants. Présentement, elle assure la charge de trois (3) enfants, un à l’université de Lomé et les deux autres au collège. Elle est revendeuse de perles au grand marché de Lomé depuis 1976. Ses clients potentiels viennent du Bénin, du Nigeria et du Ghana. Avec ce commerce, Madame A. Adjelé a fait une énorme réalisation qu’est la construction de sa maison. Compte tenu de la multiplication du nombre de personnes qui entrent dans l’exercice de ce commerce, elle n’arrive pas à faire des recettes qu’elle faisait par le passé ; ceci à cause de la limite de son stock. Pour reconquérir ses clients, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000 FCFA pour acquérir un (1) carton de perles. Ainsi avec le nouveau stock, elle pourra améliorer ses recettes.

loans.use: To purchase pearls.

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth O. is 54 years old, married, with 6 children. She sells provisions and food. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2003. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and food for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for a small cafeteria

loans.name: Mirando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Looking to the Future community bank is composed of different types of income generating activities. The majority of the women are self-employed and it has been a diligent group up to the close of the previous cycle. Loans were disbursed again and it is hoped that they will have the same success. They spoke a lot about the advantages of on time repayment and there is the commitment to doing it.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

MIRANDO AL FUTURO, Banca Comunal conformado con diferentes tipos D. actividades, que generan su propio ingreso, la mayoría D. las señoras trabajan por cuenta propia, es un grupo con buen comportamiento hasta el cierre del ciclo anterior, se desembolsó nuevamente, se espera el mismo cumplimiento con quienes se habló bastante D. las ventajas por ser cumplidas hay compromiso D. hacerlo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jazmines-Uno Group

texts.es:
The community bank JASMINES-UNO is composed of 13 female members that are thankful for the help that the institution has provided. They have got together again in order to be able to work. Due to a bad experience in the previous cycle, in the current cycle the number of members has been reduced, assuring that in the next cycle the number of members will be increased. They are currently in their fourth cycle. The majority of the members invest their money in their businesses that are located in the German Moreno market in the city of Montero, such as Concepción who invested her loan in her clothing store or Sonia who, with a loan from AGROCAPITAL, started her business, which is a grocery store in her home in the Pampa la Madre neighborhood in Montero and proudly wants everyone to know that thanks to the institution she was able to start her business which is prosperous and helps her to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco comunal JASMINES-UNO compuesta por 13 socias agradecidas por el apoyo económico que brinda la institución es que se reorganizaron nuevamente para poder trabajar, ya que una mala experiencia en el anterior ciclo hizo que este actual ciclo disminuye en número D. integrantes , asegurando que el posterior ciclo aumentaran el numero D. socias, actualmente están en el 4 ciclo, la mayoría D. las socias invierte su dinero en sus negocios pues tienen sus ventas en el mercado German Moreno D. la ciudad D. Montero, como el caso D. la sra. Concepción que invirtió el préstamo en su venta D. ropa o el caso D. la Sra. Sonia que con el préstamo D. AGROCAPITAL inicio su negocio, una venta D. abarrotes en su domicilio en la zona D. la Pampa la Madre en Montero, que orgullosa hace conocer a todos que gracias a la institución pudo comenzar con su negocio que es prospero y le ayuda para mantener sus hijos.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: Ngone N. est née le 01 janvier 1954 à Bambey.Elle habite au quartier DVF.Elle s'active dans le commerce d'épices depuis plus d'un an.elle a sollicité ce pret pour renforcer son Activité.
texts.en:
Ngone N. was born on January 1, 1954 in Bambey. She lives in the DVF district. She has been working in the trade of spices for more than a year. She requested this loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of Spices

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou D. est âgé de 31 ans, célibataire et père   d’un (1) enfant. Il vit dans le quartier Darsalam de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali), dans une famille traditionnelle avec son enfant, ses frères et soeurs, son père, sa mère et les autres parents.
Après plusieurs activités économiques sans succès(bricolage de  telephones portables , de téléviseurs, de radios, etc pendant son séjour en république de Gambie). Ensuite, il rentre au pays natal pour se spécialiser dans la vente d’accessoires de téléphones portables (batteries, façades, chargeurs, cables USB  etc) depuis  maintenant  5 ans.
Située en face de la nouvelle gare routière de Ségou, sa boutique est au bord de  l’une des artères principales les plus frequentée de la ville. Dans le souci d’agrandir la taille de son activité afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus exigeante, il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 167 façades, 63 batteries, 55 chargeurs, 100 microphones pour téléphones portables. Il  s’approvisionne généralement  à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et quelques fois en république du Togo (en Afrique de l’Ouest)  et  vend ses articles au comptant en détail ou  à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes de tous les âges.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt, le loyer du magasin et investir le reste dans les affaires.. Dans l’avenir, il compte devenir un commerçant import-export entre la république du Mali et le Royaume d’Arabie Saoudite.
texts.en:
Monsieur Amadou D. is 31 years old, single, and father of one child. He lives in the Darsalam district of a town called Ségou (in Administrative Region IV of the Republic of Mali), in a traditional family environment with his child, his brothers and sisters, his parents and other relatives.

He had several failed attempts at business (repairing mobile phones, televisions, radios etc.) during his stay in the Republic of The Gambia. Then, five years ago, he returned to his native country to specialize in selling mobile phone accessories (batteries, covers, chargers, USB cables etc.).

His shop, located opposite the new bus station in Ségou, is on one of the town’s busiest main roads. With a desire to grow his business in order to satisfy his ever more demanding clientele, he has decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program, with whom he is now applying for his first personal loan.

He intends to use this loan to buy 167 covers, 63 batteries, 55 chargers and 100 microphones for mobile telephones. He usually stocks up in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) or sometimes in the Togolese Republic (in West Africa) and sells the products for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of men and women of all ages.

He hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA ($115 USD), which he will use to pay off the loan interest and the rent for the shop. He will invest the remainder in his business. In the future, he hopes to become an import-export trader between the Republic of Mali and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy covers, batteries and chargers for mobile phones

loans.name: La Buena Fe Group

texts.en: "La Buena Fe" is a group of 10 entrepreneurs, who began participating in the Esperanza microcredit program in 2006.  This will be the fifth group loan for "La Buena Fe."  Margarita  is the chosen group representative in part due to her hard work ethic. She is also the mother of 4 children. Margarita will use her microloan to continue her small business (called "Modesta Margarita") selling beauty products and running a very small beauty salon. She hopes to one day have a larger beauty salon, generating greater income. Her main focus in starting her own business is her 4 children. She says that her dream is for her children to receive all the education they need to have better lives and to be able to enjoy life.  Other members of the group are also using their loans to finance other small stores-selling clothes, food, and other goods.

loans.use: Buying and selling beauty products

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora ALEJANDRINA pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS VIOLETAS II,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Rioja y distrito Nueva Cajamarca. Se dedica a la venta de frutas . Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de la misma localidad. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversas frutas de la  región como naranjas, mandarinas, granadillas, taperiva, coconas en cientos, plátanos y guineos en racimos, paltas, papayas y huevos en  jabas, de esa manera podrá tener abastecido su puesto y satisfacer la exigencia de sus clientes. 

Alejandrina tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 04 hijos, uno de ellos ya es independiente y ahora vive con sus 03 hijos y su esposo que se dedica a trabajos eventuales de construcción. Su meta es poner otro negocio como la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Violetas II.” She lives in the San Martín region, Rioja province, Nueva Cajamarca district. She sells fruit. Her business is located in the market of her community. With this loan for S/. 1,500.00, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy diverse fruits of the region such as oranges, mandarin oranges, passion fruit, coconuts, bunches of bananas and plantains, avocados, papayas, eggs and in this way she will be able to supply her fruit stand and satisfy her customer’s demands. Alejandrina is 48 years old, mother of 4 children, one of whom is now independent and now she lives with her 3 children and spouse who is a temporary construction employee. Her goals is to open another business such as selling clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Kisasa B Group

texts.en:
Rebeca has owned a small charcoal store and sold vegetables in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for twenty years. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory to grow her business. She would then be able to pay school fees for her children and provide more food for her family.

Rebeca is 38 years old and married with three children, who are between the ages of 4 and 14. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Jema, Neema, Rehema, and Pili. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Njala Agriculture Research Group

texts.en:
These are staff of NARC – Njala Agricultural Research Center. There are eleven in their unit, and they are field workers. NARC was established by the government over twenty years ago. Then, it was called Institute of Agriculture Research. As the name suggests, NARC’s primary job is to carryout research for the improvement of planting materials. They teach farmers (the majority of whom are illiterate) new farming techniques and the use of new technologies and farming systems. They also teach people how to process food crops for consumption. In addition to these, they also plant and provide planting materials to farmers throughout the country. The major challenge they face in their work is the lack of willingness on the part of the farmers to come for training. Some of the farmers prefer doing their work in the old and primitive way.

This is the first time NARC (this Unit) is getting a loan from SMT. Others from NARC already got a loan from SMT months ago and successes stories of those loans have inspired this unit to also come for a loan. Fatmata B. T. (left) is the leader of this group. Fatmata is twenty-eight years of age. She is single with two children. One is in class one and the other is not of school age. She was born in Yoni, Tonkolili district, northern Sierra Leone. With her Le 1,000,000 loan, she will invest in business. She has been in the gara lapper (locally dyed cloth) business for the past two years now. (In front of them are a number of yams.)

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Maly's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Maly T. is a group leader of six members who all live in Thlouk Vien village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Thuong Roth, is a laborer. Mrs. Maly T. is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study yet.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Such loans allows borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
She is a single parent, and works hard for her only child who is in the 4th year of high school. She’s been eager to make her existing business a bigger one. She is Mrs. Maria I., 42 years old, who resides at Pasil Irasan, Roxas Zamboanga Del Norte.

Anybody who knows her will be captivated to learn how she started her business. With only US$4 in capital and assorted grocery items to sell, she was able to generate an income and have a well-managed sari-sari store.  Now she wants to keep a part of her income for her child’s future, so she applied for membership at Paglaum MPC on January 28, 2009. She liked the credit and savings services of the Cooperative and applied for a loan of 5,000 Php (about US$125) to increase the inventory of her store. Her labor today is all for the bright future of her child.

loans.use: Purchase of additional inventory of grocery items

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. owns a small store. She is 48 years old and has 4 children. She sells a variety of goods in her village and earns a reasonable profit from her business. Her customers come from the same village. Most of them are her neighbors, friends, and passersby who are whiling away the time waiting for the next ride. In addition to her store, she also has a small rice farm. Her husband, Calixto T., is supportive of her and her business.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will help her to attract more customers and to earn more income for her family. She will also use the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and run their own businesses. CEVI gives their clients credit assistance to run their businesses. They also provide training for the clients and insurance coverage to help them expand their small businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane O. is the 37-year-old mother of five children and three orphaned children. She is also a widow whose husband passed away in February of 1996.

Jane sells secondhand clothes at the Nyamasaria market in addition to cloth when she can afford it. She says it is difficult to pay school fees for both her children and the children of other family members who have passed away that she now cares for.

Jane is asking for 30,000 KSH which will, in part, go to expand her business and, in part. be used to pay school fees.

Jane recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To increase the clothing stock of her business and to pay school fees

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en: Rashidatu is 32 years old and married with two children. Rashidatu sells crates of drinks. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Турабоева Насиба-1986 года рождения, замужем, имеет одного ребёнка.Её муж Боймуродов Маруф занимается куплей и продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Её муж помогает ей  с куплей-продажей скота, потому что хочет расширить  семейный  бизнес пока она сидит  с их маленьким сыном. За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Born in 1986, Nasiba T. is married and has one child. Her husband, Maruf Boymurodov, is involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market. Nasiba feeds cattle at home. Her husband helps her with the livestock sales because he wants to expand the family business while Nasiba is at home with their young son. They want to use this loan to increase the livestock headcount and make a bigger profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel H. C. es una joven de 20 años de edad. Vive con sus padres y un hermano, en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Miguel trabaja en una constructora y además estudia en el colegio. Dice que ambos lugares están muy lejos de su casa y que se le dificulta la manera de llegar hasta ellos, ya que los caminos no están en muy buen estado y además hay muy poco transporte público. 

Por lo cual Miguel ha decidido comprar una moto para poder transportarse mejor y así agilizar  la forma en la que viaja y poder ahorrar y aprovechar más  el tiempo. Por lo tanto requiere un préstamo de ¢400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para comprar la moto y así poder tener un vehículo propio que le permita seguir adelante  y facilitarle su modo de viajar.

Miguel forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo pero Miguel  destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Miguel H. C. is a young 20-year-old man. He lives with his parent and a brother in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is community located about 150km south of the Province of San José, the capital of Costa Rica; it’s 850 meters above sea level. There they cultivate vegetables, and coffee, and also carry out other activities such as raising cattle and pigs to fatten. There also exist some organic agriculture projects, and hydroponics vegetable gardens. In addition to agriculture in the community you can also find mechanics’ garages, a supermarket, small restaurants (known as sodas), and a furniture store. Miguel works for a construction company and is also in school. He says that both places are very far from his house and it is difficult for him to get to them given that the roads are not in very good condition and there is also poor public transportation. Because of this Miguel has decided to purchase a motorcycle to be able to ease the way he travels and to be able to save time and make the most of it. For this he needs a loan of 400,000 CRC to purchase the motorcycle and in that way have his own vehicle that will allow him to continue moving forward and will facilitate his way of travel. Miguel is part of the Bancruce Communal Finance Institution, one the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, however, Miguel states that thanks to this kind of organization that serve as a means of facilitating loans he can dedicate more of time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es: Rosa Ines R. de 56 años de edad vive junto a su esposo, su hija y dos nietos en Ahuachapán. Ella posee un comedor en el cual hace desayunos y almuerzos de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana ella va a las canchas de football para vender agua y jugos. Rosa es una mujer que goza de muy buenas referencias y de clientes leales ya que hace muy buena comida. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de su comida.
texts.en:
Rosa Ines R. is 56. She lives with her husband, her daughter, and two grandchildren in Ahuachapán. She has a restaurant where she makes breakfasts and lunches on Mondays through Fridays. On the week ends she goes to the soccer fields to sell water and juice. Rosa is a woman who enjoys very good references and has loyal customers because she makes very good food. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy raw material to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make her food

loans.name: Armada Boliviana Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal “Los Andes” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Armada Boliviana”, con 11 integrantes, su presidenta es Sabina Q., quien explica que el grupo se formo en la zona 23 de Febrero, todas viven cerca un colegio del mismo nombre de la asociación.
Feliza Q. es una de las integrantes de esta Asociación, tiene el negocio de venta de pito (cebada molida) que se prepara en pequeñas bolsas y reparte a tiendas de barrio, este producto generalmente lo consumen los niños. Al igual que Feliza sus compañeras tienen negocios pequeños como la venta de regalos, queso, comida, verduras, papa frita, refresco, torta y material escolar, y necesitan el préstamo para incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
In the "Los Andes" Community Center you will find the eleven member "Armada Boliviana" Communal Association. Its president is Sabina Q., who explains that the group formed in the 23 de Febrero neighborhood and that all of its members live near a school bearing the same name as the association. Feliza Q., a member of this Association, has a business selling "pito" (ground barley), which she prepares in small bags and delivers to neighborhood shops. Her product is generally consumed by children. Just like Feliza, the other group members have small businesses where they sell gifts, cheese, meals, vegetables, french fries, sodas, cakes, and school supplies, and they all need this loan in order to increase their inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of Inventory

loans.name: Lal Azucenas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo las Azucenas está conformado por Nubia del Socorro García López, Luz Marina C. M. y Eduardo Espinoza. Ellos son originaros de una zona rural de Nindirí denominada los Altos.

La coordinadora del grupo es Nubia  del Socorro García López de 49 años de edad quien  hace seis años que trabaja haciendo nacatamales, tortilla y vendiendo en un colegio.  García comenzó  con su propio capital pero su negocio necesita de mayor inversión. 

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Luz Marina C. M. de 34 años quien es ama de casa y vende cosméticos y ropa y  Eduardo Espinoza de 24 años de edad quien vende calzados.

El grupo las Azucenas  ya  han tenido préstamo con adim con los cuales lograron incrementar su materia prima y sus clientes. Pero ellos necesitan de una mayor inversión por el alto costo de los productos, para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería y así poder seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Azucenas” group consists of Nubia del Socorro García López, Luz Marina C. M. y Eduardo Espinoza. They are original from a rural area of Nindirí called “Altos.” The coordinator of the group is 49 year old Nubia del Socorro García López, who has been making nacatamales (a traditional Nicaraguan dish), tortilla and selling them at a school for 6 years. She began with her own money but her business needs an inversion of capital. The other members of the group are 34 year old Luz Marina C. M. who is a housewife and sells cosmetics and clothing and 24 year old Eduardo Espinoza who sells shoes. The Azucenas group has had a loan with ADIM with which they were able to increase their materials and clientele. But they need a larger inversion because of the high cost of their products, in order to acquire a greater quantity of merchandise and in this way be able to continue working and improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make nacatamales and tortillas such as corn, pork, rice, potato, onion and chile

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 27 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Mohamad has owned an Internet cafe. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase UPS and electrical wires. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.
Mohamad is special in his work because he owns new materials and knows how to suits his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mohamad first started his business, he had financial issues. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as his self-confidence in opening his work. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase UPS and electrical wires.

loans.name: Bokoli Plus Group

texts.fr:
Hélène N. 56 ans, est dirigeante du groupe dénommé “Bokoli Plus”. Cette banque communautaire est solidairement unie pour recevoir des crédits auprès de l’Institution de Microfinance Hope RDC en sigle IMF HOPE RDC. Elle est constituée de 25 membres.
Hélène gère son propre dépôt des sacs maїs et de manioc qu’elle vend il y a plusieurs années. Elle a acquit une expérience solide dans ce domaine et elle est bien connue dans son milieu à cause de la qualité de ses marchandises. C’est grâce à la confiance qu’elle bénéficie de sa clientèle que son affaire prospère. Elle est cliente fidèle qui a obtenu 7 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a retournés correctement. Le prochain crédit de Kiva à travers l’IMF HOPE RDC lui servira à acheter 10 sacs de maїs et 3 sacs de manioc à revendre. Actuellement, son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $10 par jour. Son ambition à court terme est d’agrandir la capacité de son dépôt afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et d’accroitre le revenu. Son affaire se situe dans la partie montagneuse à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Hélène est veuve et mère de 8 enfants âgés de 20 à 41 ans. Trois d’entre eux sont étudiants.
texts.en:
Hélène N., age 56, is the manager of a group named “Bokoli Plus”.  This community bank is united in solidarity for receiving loans from the micro-finance institution Hope RDC, having the acronym IMF HOPE RDC.  The group is composed of 25 members.  Hélène manages her own warehouse for sacks of corn and cassava that she has been selling for several years.  She has acquired solid experience in this domain, and she is well-known in her area because of the quality of her merchandise.  Thanks to customer trust from which she benefits, her business is prospering.  She is a loyal client who has obtained seven different loans from IMF HOPE RDC and who repaid them properly.  Her next Kiva loan through IMF HOPE RDC will be used to purchase ten sacks of corn and three sacks of cassava for resale.  Right now, her business generates a profit of $10 a day for her.  Her ambition in the near-term is to expand the capacity of her warehouse in order to respond to the demands of her customers and to grow her revenues.  Her business is located in the mountainous area to the west of the city of Kinshasa.  Hélène is a widow and the mother of eight children, ages 20 to 41 years old.  Three of them are students. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of corn and 3 sacks of cassava

loans.name: Esperideon

texts.en:
Esperideon M. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. He is 53-years-old. Esperideon is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Esperideon owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Esperideon has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Esperideon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperideon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional animals. Esperideon is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esperideon from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José R. V. tiene la edad de 30 años,  este señor tiene 2 hijos que todavía estudian. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi. El dio inicio hace 7 años, y poco a poco ha logro comprar su propio tricitaxi, para ofrecerles a sus clientes un buen servicio. Sus sueños son de mantener activo su negocio y de darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que esta es una de las prioridades que él tiene debido a que sus hijos están creciendo y necesita ofrecerle un espacio que sea propiedad de ellos. Ahora solicita la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para proporcionarle reparación mantenimiento a su medio de transporte.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena B. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Lorena is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lorena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Lorena has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies and reinvest in her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El grupo “Primavera” esta representada por la señora Norah y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a al venta D. comida, pacumutu,  abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos, chicharrones, verduras, venta D. mantas y mandiles y también a la costura y confección D. prendas D. vestir.  Dentro del ámbito comercial y D. servicios el nivel competitivo es alto en especial para los socios que tienen poca mercadería  y no pueden competir con las grandes tiendas  que pueden abaratar sus costos y seguir en la competencia, pero las socias tienen mucha experiencia y ganas D. trabajar con el incentivo D. sacar adelante a sus familias que es el impulso para salir adelante. El destino del préstamo es para incrementar su mercadería así como la compra D. insumos y materiales que ayuden a obtener un mejor capital D. trabajo para hacer frente a la competencia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo por lo que no tienen mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero tienen muchos deseos D. crecer y este deseo les impulsa a seguir adelante para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The Primavera (“Spring”) Group is led by Sra. Norah and consists of 12 members who are engaged in various retail business selling food, skewered meats, groceries, cosmetics, fried pork rinds, vegetables, blankets, aprons, and handmaD. apparel. The level of competition is high within the business environment, but the members are experienced and willing to work hard because they want to succeed for the sake of their families' welfare. Their loans will be used to acquire merchandise to increase their inventory as well as purchase materials and supplies that will help them stay ahead of the competition.

The group is starting its first loan cycle, so they have little experience working as part of a solidarity group. However, they are eager to grow and desire to proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Chultemdorj

texts.en:
H. Chultemdorj is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband is a plumber, her eldest child currently serves in the Mongolian military, and her youngest child is a college student. 

Chultemdorj operates a small clothing production business in her town. She started her business in 2006 by renting a stall at a local trading center to sell her clothes. She has managed her business quite successfully over the years and plans to expand in the near future. She hopes to soon purchase more sophisticated sewing machines that will allow her to increase the quality of her products. Uranchimeg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase fabrics and materials to make new clothes for her business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

 To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

 To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials to make new clothes

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel H. is from the village of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 34 years old, is married, and has one adult and three school-aged children. Maribel owns and operates a general store where she sells both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In May 2009, Maribel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase additional inventory. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia S. is from the village of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 35 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Alicia raises pigs for sale. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $68 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Alicia joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Edelburga

texts.en: Edelburga L. is from the village of Zone3, Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 50 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Edelburga owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Edelburga joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Edelburga is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 3, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Lery's Group

texts.en:
Lery R. is 35 years old and from the village of Lapogan. She is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lery R..
Lery is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.
In 2009, Lery joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lery is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Mrs. Rorn N. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Lieb village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who has 1.50 hectares to grow rice. She has a problem because she does not have enough oxen to support her farm. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to support her farm. Her husband, Mr. Chantha Chea, is a teacher in the local school where he makes a small salary to support his family. He is also a palm juice collector. This couple has three children who all are students in the public school.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Siempre Amigas” esta representado por el señora José Antonio y conformado por 11 miembros 9 mujeres y tres varones muy trabajadores y responsables. El señor José Antonio se dedica a su pequeño taller D. sastrería ubicado en el mercado D. la ciudad D. El Alto el es padre D. familia D. tres varones dos en edad escolar y uno en la universidad, su esposa se dedica a la venta D. comida y refrescos en la parada del trufi 36 juntos sustentan a su familia con el único anhelo D. sacar adelante a sus hijos dándoles una mejor calidad D. vida, el financiamiento es para la compra D. material D. trabajo debido a una obra granD. que tienen el señor José Antonio y necesita adquirir telas para la entrega D. uniformes.  Los demás socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la costura D. ropa deportiva, venta D. aceite, venta D. aguayos, venta D. ropa, venta D. plásticos venta D. comida y al transporte D. pasajeros. Los socios confían en sus habilidades, y también en el carisma que han adquirido para poder vender sus productos y ofrecer calidad D. productos al mercado por lo que la competencia no tiene mucha importancia cuando se tienen ganas D. trabajar. El crédito obtenido es para el aumento D. capital, compra D. más mercadería, insumos, materia prima, algunos casos compra y refacción D. maquinaria. El banco comunal esta trabajando ya en su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y ganas D. salir adelante creciendo cada dia más por el beneficio D. sus hogares. Aclara que algunos socios se encuentran en la fotografia con sus esposas.
texts.en:
The group “Siempre Amigas” [“Friends Always”] is represented by José Antonio and is maD. up of 11 members—9 women and three women who are very hardworking and responsible. José Antonio works in his small tailoring shop, located in the market of the city of El Alto. He is the father of three boys, two of school age and one in the university. His wife sells food and soft drinks at the stop for the minibus 36. Together they support their family. Their only desire is to help their children get ahead in life and give them a better quality of life. The loan is to buy materials for work because José Antonio has a big order and he needs to buy fabric to make uniforms. The other members work in different kinds of businesses, such as sewing sports clothing, selling oil, selling aguayos [type of traditional cloth], selling clothing, selling plastics, and transporting passengers. The members trust in their abilities and in the charisma they have developed in order to sell their products. They offer quality products to the market, which is why competition isn’t much of a problem, because they have a true desire to work. The loans are for increasing their capital, buying merchandise, ingredients, raw materials, and in some cases, parts for machinery. The communal bank is already in its fourth loan cycle, demonstrating responsibility and a true desire to get ahead, growing each day for the benefit of their households. To clarify, some of the members in the photo are pictured with their spouses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana del Socorro H. se dedica a laborar como maestra de primaria en un pequeño colegio. Ella es casada y con un hijo de un añito al que cuida y vela por su bienestar.

Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y de esta manera brindar mayor seguridad tanto a su hijo como a su familia. Ella espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así levar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Juana del Socorro H. H. is a primary school teacher at Marcos Dessys School in Chinandega. She is married, lives in the Roberto González neighborhood, and has a one-year-old son. Juana is requesting a loan to make repairs to her home, since it is not currently secure and robbers could enter to steal her belongings..

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, bricks, and zinc tiles

loans.name: Duoc

texts.en:
Duoc T. N. is 39 years old and is married with three children. She sells sea fish in the market. In this line of work, she earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month. 

Duoc has participated in SEDA's microfinancing program since 2003. In the last term, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her fish-selling business

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 20 años, actualmente vive con su pareja y su pequeña hija. Tienen una casa propia, ubicada en la selva cuzqueña. 

Joven soñadora y trabajadora recuerda que antes de tener su tienda ofrecía sus productos tocando puertas. De esa manera sus ventas crecían al igual que sus ingresos, con el tiempo obtuvo una lista de clientes fijos, eso le dio ventaja para instalar su bodega y ofrecer a todo público variados productos a precios competitivos. 
Usualmente trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus padres y su horario de trabajo empieza a las 5:00 AM y termina a las 9:00PM. En lo sucesivo, desea ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a su grupo comunal por el apoyo que le brindan. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de más productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Esther is 20 years old and lives her partner and their young daughter. They have their own home located in the Cusco rainforest. Esther is a young dreamer who is hard working, and she recalls that before she had her store she sold her products door to door. In this way she grew her sales along with her income, and in time she gained an established clientele, which enabled her to set up her store and offer her varied products to the entire public at competitive prices. She usually works with her partner, but on occasion her parents help out. Her work schedule starts at 5 a.m. and ends at 9 p.m. In the future, she wishes to expand her store with the goal of continuing to satisfy her customers. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to fulfill her payment obligations. Furthermore, she is grateful for her community bank and the support it provides. With the money she is requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of more products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products to stock her store

loans.name: Margarita Amanda

texts.es: La Señora Margarita es cliente nueva, ella y su hermana Silviana se dedican a la comercializacion de libros en distintas zonas de la ciudad de La Paz, el modo en la que ellas realizan su trabajo es comprando los libros por lotes y los distribuyen por unidades en las oficinas y otros lugares a credito.  ella vive en casa de sus padres  con sus hermanos , es una persona joven con ganas de superacion.  el destino del credito esta destinado a la compra de un lote de libros que le estan solicitando y como trabaja a credito necesita un doble capital para poder seguir trabajando es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Margarita is a new client. She and her sister Silviana sell books in different areas within the city of La Paz. They go about performing their job by acquiring books by the batch and distributing them in specified units to offices and other places on credit. Margarita lives at her parents’ house with her siblings. She is a young woman who desires to succeed.

Margarita needs to double her operating capital so that she can continue working. Her loan will be used to buy a batch of books so that she can fulfill her orders. She is a responsible and hardworking woman. Margarita is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a batch of books to sell

loans.name: Ma. Daty

texts.en: Ma. Daty A. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Dungo-an, Manjuyod, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a general store and through her fish-vending business. Ma. Daty's husband, Renaldo, is 46 years old and engages in a business buying and selling livestock. They have two children who are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Ma. Daty joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by running a general store and engaging in a fish-vending business. Ma. Daty is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 27,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 27,000 for her 18th loan which she intends to use on her general store and fish-vending businesses. Ma. Daty is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store and fish-vending businesses

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. bakes bread to sell in Abura. Hannah has not received any formal education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an electrician. Hannah has been baking for a year now. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to bake, so she can supply those who need larger quantities for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Рахмонов Чамшед проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Чамшед занимается торговлей на рынке "Саховат". Он продает фрукты и овощи. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Jamshed R. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 46 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Jamshed works in the Sakhovat market. He sells fruit and vegetables. He has been doing this work for ten years. He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Olpher

texts.en:
Olpher is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya where she has been farming for 18 years. Her farm produces maize, beans, vegetables, eggs, tea, bananas and milk which she sells to the local market. Her major challenges have been lack of enough money to buy chicken feed, pests and diseases which affect her poultry and the poor weather patterns that affects her produce.

Olpher has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.50,000 to expand her poultry project by purchasing 300 chicks from Kenchick Company. She says the extra income from this loan will enable her to educate her children and feed them well.

Olpher is 38 years old, married and blessed with 5 children between the ages of 8 and 25. Four of her children are attending school. In future, she plans to open a big retail shop in Ogembo town and be the biggest supplier of eggs in the town and other communities as well.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 30 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Orfelinda de 17 años y su querida hija María de 5 meses, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de cultivo han sido en la vida de Luis, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde tiene sembrados café y plátano, los cuales una vez cosechados llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y aún continúa disfrutando de la siembra, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que el crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luis, age 30, is a very loving and hard-working father. He lives in his own house, together with his wife Orfelinda, age 17, and his beloved daughter María, 5 months. He would like to provide both of them with a better quality of life. Throughout Luis' life, he has had to work in the fields to survive. Since he was very young, his parents taught him how to work on the farm, and for this reason he decided to continue in the family profession. He now has his own fields, where he grows coffee and bananas. Once his crops are harvested, he takes them to sell at the market in the city of La Merced. He has done this work for 10 years, and he continues to enjoy planting, since he knows that his family's well-being depends on his work. What he considers most difficult is protecting his crops from abrupt changes in the weather, since these greatly affect his productivity. In the future, he hopes to continue working hard and improving his crops. This is his third loan with MFP, and he knows that it will be very beneficial for the development of his farm. Within his communal bank, he is known as a very responsible member, and thus he is highly respected. With the two thousand Peruvian new soles he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more fertilizer

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline G. is 41 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Karoline has 4 years of experience in this business.  Karoline needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 210 talas or US $88 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Karoline joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Karoline's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: José

texts.es: José G. C. de 61 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Santa Rosa de Lima, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de La Unión. José G. es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora quien sueña con ver su casa en mejores condiciones. Él trabaja junto a su esposa en el mercado Central del municipio de La Unión, en donde comercializan frutas y verduras, este negocio lo poseen desde hace dos años atrás, y es gracias al cual cuentan con todo lo necesario en su hogar, el cual es alquilada por el momento. Tanto José como su esposa son dos personas muy responsables, las cuales sueñan con tener un hogar seguro en el cual vivir confiados. Es por esta razón que José solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para seguir construyendo su casa, y de esta forma comprar todo el material necesario como: cemento, ladrillos, acero, techo y otros más para la construcción de su casa y de esta forma poseer una casa propia en la cual habitar.
texts.en:
Jose G. C. is 61 years old and he lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa de Lima; it is located in the department of La Union. Jose G. is a very humble and hard working person that dreams of having a home in a good state of repair. He works together with his wife in the central market of the municipality in La Union. They sell fruits and vegetables, a business they have had for the past 2 years. It is thanks to this business that they are able to provide for all of the household needs. The home they live in is rented. Jose and his wife are very responsible people and they dream of having a safe home where to live comfortably. For this reason Jose requests a loan, so that they may continue building their own home. With this loan he will be able to purchase all the necessary material, such as: cement, bricks, iron rods, roofing, etc. He will use these materials to finish building their home and have their own home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build his own home.

location.town: Santa Rosa de Lima, departamento de La Unión

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
Avelino F. es un Sr. de 52 años de edad, oriundo de Roque González está casado hace más de 32 años con la Sra. Petrona de 51 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos juntos, 2 en edad escolar y 3 hijos que  ya mayores de edad y gracias a sus padres ya son profesionales.
Hace 20 años empezó con una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, donde la Sra. atendía mientras él se dedicaba a comprar animales para faena y luego vender la carne en la despensa. 
Actualmente se encuentran trabajando toda familia junta en la despensa, ya que es el centro de compras más importante y concurrido de la ciudad.
Ahora desea comprar más mercaderías como ser: bebidas y artículos de primera necesidad como:   Harina, yerba, fideos y arroz en cantidades, de modo a abaratar los precios de costo y así obtener mayores ingresos con las ventas.
texts.en:
Avelino F. is a 52 year-old man, born in Roque Gonzales. He has been married for 32 years to Petrona, age 51. They have 5 children together, 2 of whom are school aged, and 3 of whom are grown and are professionals, thanks to their parents. 20 years ago, he started with a small store in his home. His wife tended to the store while he worked on buying animals to do farm work, which they would later sell for meat in the store. The whole family works together in the store now, as it is the most important and highly-trafficked store in the city. He now wants to buy more merchandise such as drinks and basic staples such as flour, yerba, noodles and rice in bulk in order to get lower prices and thus obtain better earnings from the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the acquisition of wholesale merchandise, such as: cloth, drinks, packaged foods, vegetables, cleaning products, hardware, etc.

loans.name: Veronica Ekua Egyeiwa

texts.en: Veronica Ekua Egyeiwa O. sells hair creams and other hair products at Elmina. Ekua has junior high educational background. She is married to a farmer. She helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more creams and other hair products for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more creams and other hair products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more blouses and hand bags.

loans.name: Kanyerere Ii Kyamwasha Bakyara Basheija Group

texts.en: N. Aidah, age 50, belongs to Kanyerere II Kyamwasha Bakyara Basheija Group - Ntungamo. She has been at the helm of her tailoring business for 18 years, before which she worked as a farmer. Aida is a widow with four children. Being a widow has not in any way dampened her determination as she has continuously worked hard to provide for her family without the support of her husband. She tells us that in order to get established in this business, she had to get apprentice training from a tailoring school first. Prior to that, her mind was fully focused on farming. Her tailoring business generates 30,000 shillings weekly. With this loan she says she is going to buy more pieces of fabric with which to to sew more clothes to offer for sale.
