loans.use: To buy more pieces of fabric with which to to sew more clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Mrs. Arnel M. is from Barangay of Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and married to Rodulfo M.. They are blessed with 3 children of whom  two are now of school age and the other one is still an infant. To make a living, Arnel is presently engaged in a shrimp and crabs business. She’s been engaged in this kind of buying and selling business for 5 years. 

Just this year, Arnel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnel as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a loan amount of P15,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php40,000.00 as her 2nd loan which will be used for additional capital for her shrimp and crab buying and selling business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, loan repayments,the childrens' education and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for shrimp and crab business

loans.name: Dorgham

texts.en:
The borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old.

Dorgham has experience in the grains and seeds’ trade. He works in the field and managed to develop a good reputation in his area.

He is requesting an $1800 loan to buy a new tilling machine for the field. His aim is to enhance his work efficiency and expand to secure a proper income.

loans.use: To buy a new tilling machine for the field

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert K., aged 52, years sells timber at Githurai 45 and also has a carpentry shop at the same place. He is married with four children. He has been running this business for a period of 20 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 15,000.

He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office. This loan of Kshs 50000 is Robert’s first loan with KADET and he intends to increase the stock of timber in his yard for resale. If the loan boosts the business, Robert will increase his stocks again to grow his business.

Roberts hopes to expand his business to enable himself to comfortably pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Buy more timber for sale.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teofila; ella tiene 67 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en la municipalidad de Santiago, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo uso personal y para mantenimiento de su casa.            
                                           
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the “ÑAUPASUNCHIS” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Teofila is 67 years old, married and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her work for the City of Santiago.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  Teofila would like to own a grocery store.  She is requesting this loan for personal use and to maintain her home.

Teofila is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: For personal use and to maintain her home

loans.name: Kamran

texts.ru:
Kamran Amirovu rodilsya v 1950 qodu . On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Kamran yavlyayestya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione. Kamran uje 13 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Kamrana v perviy raz on bral 1200 $ i za eto on blagodarel Kive i lenderam.
On s toqo vremeni pomenyal svoyu mashinu i seychas Kamran nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki mashini.
texts.en:
Kamran A. was born in 1950. He is married and has four children. Kamran is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from the Fuzuli Region now liging in the Absheron Region. For the last 13 years, Kamran has been working as a taxi driver. This is Kamran’s second loan. The first time he took out 1200 USD. He is greateful to Kiva and to the lenders. 

Since then he has changed his car, and now he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: Purchasing auto spare parts

loans.name: Munno Mubyonna Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Alice N. is a 38-year-old happily married mother of 3 happy-go-lucky kids who are all in school.  For the last 4 years, she has been operating a business selling food, principally bananas, at the local food market in Mulawa-Mukono.  Alice says that she was inspired by a close friend to try a hand in this business, which generates for her 100,000 shillings weekly. Previously, Alice was running a grocery store. Her future plan is to expand her banana sales business to markets in other districts where people's consumption rates of bananas are high. 

Alice belongs to Munno Mubyonna Development group-Mukono.  She says that with this loan, she is going to purchase more bananas to resell. She says this will the first step in her quest to expand and consolidate her sales revenue base, which at length will lead to business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas

loans.name: Glenrose

texts.en:
Glenrose T. is from the village of Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old. Glenrose is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Glenrose owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Glenrose has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Glenrose joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenrose is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Glenrose from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and married to K. who also contributes to the family income. She has five children aged between 28 and 13 years old. She operates a retail shop in Mwingi town.She has been in this business for the last four years with an income of KES. 15,000 per month. 

She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. She intends to buy more stock of cooking fat, tooth paste, etc. for sale. She hopes to buy a piece of land for  livestock keeping and also give her children quality education.

loans.use: to buy stock of cooking fat, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Yoweri

texts.en: Yoweri is a thirty-three year-old married man with one child.  He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running an electronics shop where he repairs computers and phones, and he has been in business for four years. He has a challenge of power shortages. His dream is to set up a vocational school for electronic repairs and selling computers and phones. Yower intends to use the loan to buy computers and phones.

loans.use: Buying computers and phones

loans.name: Saiyohat

texts.en:
Saiyohat is married with four children. She has a small kiosk at the market in Istaravshan and sells fabrics used to make women’s national dresses. Saiyohat has been in this business for 22 years. She is very nice to customers and treats them well. Her clients enjoy buying things from her and come back often. Saiyohat's business has become a stable source of income for her family. Saiyohat would like to get a loan of 3,000 USD to increase the assortment of goods she sells. She would spend the additional income to improve her family's living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Wencelada

texts.es:
La señora Wencelada, D. 52 años D. edad, sin hijos, cuenta con una despensa bien surtida donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad, además cría y engorda cerdos para su posterior comercialización.
Ella cuenta con el apoyo D. su actual pareja que se encarga D. transportar las mercaderías pesadas como ser afrecho, maíz y otros.
AcuD. a  Fundación Paraguaya para  acceder a una pequeña ayuda crediticia que destinará a la compra D. artículos D. primera necesidad para su negocio como ser harina, azúcar, lácteos, panificados, carnes, etc. y maíz a granel para su cría D. cerdos.
La misma agradeció la ayuda a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad D. solicitar el crédito porque gracias a ello podría seguir creciendo en su actividad y mejorando su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Señora Wencelada is 52 years old and doesn't have any children.  She has a well-stocked store where she sells basic necessities.  She also raises and fattens pigs that then go to market.  She has the support of her current partner who is responsible for transporting the heavy merchandise like bran, corn and other things.  She approached Fundación Paraguaya to request a small loan that she will use to purchase basic necessities for her store such as flour, sugar, dairy products, baked goods, meats, etc., as well as corn in bulk to feed her pigs.  

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity to request credit because thanks to the loan she will be able to continue growing her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, dairy products, baked goods and meat as well as corn in bulk to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay the cost of manual labor for rice farming

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La ciudad D. Urubamba es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad D. lugares hermosos y una rica variedad D. platos típicos D. la región. (El gobierno del Perú declaró oficialmente como Patrimonio Cultural D. la Nación a los "saberes, usos y tecnologías tradicionales asociados al cultivo D. maíz en el Valle Sagrado D. los Incas".)

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leonarda que nació en la ciudad D. Urubamba (Cusco, Perú), tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada y fruto D. esta relación tienen cuatro hijos. 

Ella tiene una tienda D. comestibles en su casa, allí venden todo tipo D. productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, además D. estos productos también venden verduras y útiles escolares, los productos las compras en la ciudad del Cusco ya que allá le salen más baratos, ciertos productos los recibe en su local. Ella también tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio donD. venD. la rica chicha D. jora. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos D. primera necesidad. Otra parte del dinero lo empleara para comprar maíz para elaborar jora. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.
texts.en:
The city of Urubamba is known for its beautiful sceneries which are very frequently visited by national and international tourists. There is a diversity of beautiful locales and a rich selection of traditional foods in the region. (The government of Peru officially declared the "knowledge, uses, and traditional technologies associated with the cultivation of corn in Valle Sagrado D. los Incas" a National Heritage.)

Here we meet Leonarda. She was born in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). She is 53 years old, married, and her four children are the fruit of this relationship.

She has a grocery store in her house and she sells all types of products, including rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, and other items. She also sells vegetables and school supplies. She buys these products in the city of Cusco because there she finds them at a lower price. Certain products are delivered to her store. She also has a small bar in her house where she serves delicious chicha D. jora (traditional corn drink).

This loan will be used to stock her store. She will purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, canned goods and other basic needs products. A part of her loan will also be used to purchase corn to make jora drinks. She has been in her communal bank for several years and she enjoys partaking for the collegiality of the group.

loans.use: to supply her store with rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, canned goods and other basic needs products.

loans.name: Genoviv

texts.en:
Genoviv is a 39-year-old married woman living in Dodan, Peñablanca, Cagayan. Genoviv has two children. Genoviv's spouse works as a tricycle driver. 
Genoviv has been in the business of hog raising for one year and earns approximately PHP 3,000 monthly. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase building materials such as blocks, cement and sand to improve her pigpen. In the future, Genoviv would like to enhance her hog raising business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as blocks, cement and sand to improve her pigpen.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Dos Group

texts.es: Banco de emprendimiento nuevo  que se encuentra en su 1er ciclo,  integrado por 8 personas las cuales todos viven en la zona de la guardia  pero en distintos barrios, la Presidenta es Karen de 23 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de la Guardia por el barrio  hace ya 10 años, Su negocio es costurera  en la feria barrio lindo hace 5,  su estado civil soltera, por el momento se encuentra estudiando todavía no esta en sus planes de tener hijo, ya que con el trabajo y el estudio no puede, ella saco el crédito para la compra de tela y de una maquina que le están vendiendo en oferta. Los clientes están agradecidos con la entidad por confiar en ellos y apoyarlos cuando mas lo necesitan, están bastante conforme y alegres ya que justo era el día de la madre cuando se les desembolso y lo estaban necesitando.
texts.en:
This is a new community bank which is in its first loan cycle.  The group has eight members who all live in La Guardia district but in different neighborhoods.  The bank's president is 23 year-old Karen who has lived in the community of La Guardia for 10 years.  She is a seamstress and works in the Barrio Lindo market.  She has been in this business for five years.  Karen is single and she is studying at the moment.  She still has no plans to have children since she knows that she couldn't manage with her work and her studies.

Karen took out this loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine that she is being offered at a good price.  These clients are grateful to our institution for trusting in them and supporting them when they most need it.  They are happy and cheerful since it was Mother's Day when they received their loan and they needed it.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine that she is being offered at a good price

loans.name: Alvaro José

texts.es: El señor Alvaro, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a sus hijos y esposa , la cual labora en una casa privada , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que su sueldo  no le ajusta para comprar de una sola vez todos los materiales de construcción , ya que agradece Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva el apoyo que le brinda a personas de bajos recursos ya que por medio de sus posibilidades   van pagando cuotas bajas , hasta lograr su cancelación
texts.en:
Sr. Alvaro is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. He lives with his children and his wife, who works for a private household as a way of helping with the expenses. The plans for his family include improving their living conditions. His major challenge is not having enough money from his salary to make a one-time purchase of all of the construction materials for his home.

He is grateful to AFODENIC for providing Kiva funds to low-income people because the program allows them to repay in small installments until they are able to fully pay back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is a married man with five children, three boys and two girls. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, he has operated a video show business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of repairing machines which break down in his business. Rodgers dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 he wants to purchase a computer and a laminating machine. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a laminating machine.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 58-year-old married woman with 6 children. The oldest child is 38 years old and the youngest is 21.

Teresita earns a living through farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month (~$250) from farming. She works hard to support her family and send her younger children to school.

She has requested this loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides. Teresita hopes for her business to be a way to uplift her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides.

loans.name: Paco Angel

texts.en:
Angel lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants. But you'd never guess the size of the city from the tranquil pace of life in the city. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge markets, and its trade in livestock – the largest in the country.

Angel is 34 years old. He lives with his two children, aged five and 11 years old, who are both in school. Angel's life has been somewhat of a struggle, particularly when his parents both fell ill. He spends all of his free time with his children.

Angel has a candy shop where he sells chocolates, candies, posters and some jewelry. He works 11 hours a day without help from anyone. His biggest challenge in his work is making sales. He started this work after learning from his relatives.

This is Angel's second loan with Fundación Alternativa and his first loan with Kiva. Angel will use the loan to buy new kinds of inventory for the stall. 

Angel's dreams for the future are to see his two children grow up to be professionals and to marry.

loans.use: to buy chocolates, candies and other goods for a candy shop.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is married with two children. She is 40 years old and lives in Tipolo, Plaridel. She sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for less than one year. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients used for making the snacks she sells. Glenda has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, she hopes to have more income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, and other ingredients used for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a 35-year-old, industrious mother who has a business fattening hogs. She has been blessed with five children. In order to provide for their needs, she works hard. She has been raising hogs for 10 years, and she earns 4,000 PHP every selling season.

She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins (vetracin) for her hogs. She hopes to raise healthy hogs in order to increase her net income.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins (vetracin) for her hogs

loans.name: Myrnalyn

texts.en:
Myrnalyn is 31 years old, an industrious mother who works in a hog-fattening business. She was blessed with three children to educate, so she works hard to earn a higher profit. She has been doing this work for two years and earns P3,000 every selling season.


She is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes to make the hogs healthy to boost her net income at selling time. This will help to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El señor Dionicio  nacido en la localidad de Santa Rosa  Chuquisaca vive con la Sra. Margarita, quien es ama de casa ya que tienen cinco hijos, y la Sra. Margarita se encarga de todos, cuentan con domicilio propio y se encuentra ubicada en el barrio 27 de mayo, viven en la zona hace 20 años. El sr. Dionicio tiene como actividad principal  moto taxista hace 10 años ya que se dedica a esta labor,  cuando no trabaja con su moto se dedica a la actividad de  albañil. El destino del préstamo es para comprar otra moto ya que la que tiene ya esta presentando algunas fallas no permitiendo que brinde un buen servicio a sus clientes. Se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Dionicio was born in the town of Santa Rosa Chuquisaca. He lives with his wife Margarita who manages the household and cares for their five children. They live in a house in the May 27th neighborhood where they have lived for 20 years. Dionicio's principal occupation is as a mototaxi driver. He has worked as a taxi driver for ten years, but when he is not working as a driver he finds work as a mason. The loan will be used to purchase a new motorcycle because his current motorcycle is in need of repairs and he can no longer provide a good service to his clients. He is thankful for the support he has received from this institution.

loans.use: COMPRA DE UNA MOTOCICLETA

loans.name: Kdoep

texts.en:
Kdoep (pictured above), 45, is a fisherman. His wife, Srey, is 41 years old and stays at home doing housework. They have been married since 1985 and have six children - one son and five daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers, two assist their parents in a farming business and another one is in school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Kdoep is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich, aged 41 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. Her husband is a fisherman who earns $4.86 per day. The couple have four children; two are studying, and two are working, each earning $4 per day. Every month, Pich has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, and $22 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a plot of land to enlarge her house. She wants to take out a new loan to repair her house after finishing this loan.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to enlarge her house

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 37 years old. He has owned a hardware store for more than six years. He has four children who are aged between one and 17. He wants the loan to increase his inventory and expand his business. His wife is a businesswoman selling clothes. The profits from the business will be used to expand and renovate his house. He wishes to have his own business venue in the future.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo tiene 33 años, está casado con Petrona de 35 años, el es macatero (vendedor ambulante) hace más de diez años,  y su señora es modista, y con su trabajo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa.
Gustavo muy joven se fue en la Argentina donde estuvo trabajando como albañil y en donde conoció a su señora, luego de que tuvo capital suficiente volvió a su país, emprendiendo el negocio de la venta, actividad que la mayoría sus vecinos desarrolla. Hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada  por la buena calidad de sus productos y la facilidad de pagos que ofrece.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías sabanas, mosquiteros, frazadas, los cuales son los productos que el vende. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 33 years old and is married to Petrona, who is 35.  He has worked as a traveling salesman for more than ten years, and his wife is a dressmaker whose work helps with the household expenses. 

When Gustavo was young, he moved to Argentina, where he worked as a bricklayer and met his wife.  After he earned enough money, he returned to Paraguay and began his sales business.  Most of his neighbors do the same work.  Currently, he has a customer base thanks to the good quality of his products and the ease of his payment plans.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as sheets, mosquito nets, and blankets, which are the products that he sells.  He is thankful to the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity they are giving him.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, mosquito nets, and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 56 years old and widowed with 4 children.

Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Elisa has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Elisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 39 years old and is a married woman with five children, ages 8 to 19.

Victoria started her farming business five years ago. She tills her land to grow rice crops to sell. Victoria does her best to support her husband in providing for their needs and sending their children to school. 

Victoria has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. Victoria hopes for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari is 38 years old.  He is single and lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, he has operated a business in the jua kali sector (metal and woodworking sector), welding and selling to garage operators. The primary challenge he faces in his business is seasonality. His dream is to expand and become self reliant in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 KES he plans to purchase a welding machine for his business. He decided to join Yehu in order to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine for his business.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Forty-nine years old, married to Leah, and the father of three children, Leonard has been in the carpentry business for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 35,000. Having borrowed and repaid five previous loans from KADET LTD., he is now requesting his sixth loan for Kes 10,000 to buy more workshop tools, timber, nails and wood paints.

loans.use: to buy more workshop tools, timber, nails, and wood paints.

loans.name: Asomep Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ASOMEP est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Le représentant du groupe, nommée  Alexandre Vihanou (Celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgé de 38 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Alexandre Vihanou est mariée a une coiffeuse du nom de Rosaline. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Alexandre Vihanou vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Alexandre Vihanou exerce le métier de meunier depuis huit ans à son domicile. De façon complémentaire, fait l'élevage de porcs, qu'il vend ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Alexandre Vihanou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Alexandre Vihanou ensemble avec les membres du groupe ASOMEP sollicite pour la septième  fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé

loans.use: Acheter des pièces de rechange.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Christine is representing her group of seven farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Christine's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to buy more land to cultivate.

Christine and her group will receive a total of six solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Yves Junior

texts.fr: Yves, 40 ans, est marié. Il n’a pas d’enfant. Ne pouvant pas se trouver un emploi, il a décidé de mettre sur pied une petite activité de revente de vêtements. Il revend des habits pour homme et pour femme. L’activité se révèle très prospère. Il veut profiter au maximum de cette opportunité. Il demande ce prêt pour acheter un stock de t-shirts et de jeans.

loans.use: acheter un stock de t-shirts et de jeans

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
You can see in the picure the man, who is very optimistic about he future of his business. 
This man is 29, single. He is hard worker. He tsarted  to busy with this business 7 years ago. He is  Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the war-affected region of  Azerbaijan Zangilan. He settled in Salyan region Yenikand village. 
Zaur requests this loan to buil the barber\'s shop. He wans to bring about his desire.

loans.use: To built the barber\'s shop

loans.name: Icah

texts.en: I. is a 43-year-old mother with two children aged 18 and 14. She has a small shop selling household goods. She initiated her business by using money from her child. Her husband passed away 6 years ago. She used to borrow from a loan shark, but it put her in deep difficulties. Since joining MBK as a member, she feels glad because the MBK rules are more suitable for her. In the morning, she sells coconut milk rice; in the afternoon, she sells various fried snacks. She wants to have the $50 loan to keep her shop sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Small Restaurant

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.en:
Married and mother of three children, 36-year-old Ms K. Akouvi specializes in the production of manioc flour, “Gari", which is the basic food in her community. Famous for the quality of her products, Ms K. has succeeded in having a very important part of the local Gari’s consumer market and is often solicited outside of her community. The demand is continually growing but unfortunately she is not able to satisfy it because of lack of funds. Today, she is more determined to face the challenge and expand her reputation in the zone. She is requesting a $750 loan to buy a crop of manioc, which will help her to make flour especially at this time of the beginning of rain season where the prices are very low. This project will give her financial independence and allow her affirm her position in her community.

Translated from [French] by [Bijou Kuzimbu], Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Mme K. Akouvi est âgée de 36 ans et spécialisée dans la fabrication de la farine de manioc « Gari » base de l’alimentation dans son milieu. Réputée pour la qualité de sa production, Mme K. a réussi à se tailler une part très importante du marché de consommation locale du Gari et est souvent sollicitée en dehors de sa zone. Une demande sans cesse croissante qu’elle n’arrive malheureusement pas à satisfaire faute de fonds de commerce. Aujourd’hui, elle est plus que déterminée à relever ce défi en accentuant sa notoriété dans la zone. Elle sollicite pour cela un crédit de $750 pour acheter une récolte de manioc, qui doit lui servir à fabriquer la farine surtout ce moment de début de pluies où les prix sont très bas. Ce projet va lui conférer une autonomie financière et lui permettra de s’affirmer dans son milieu.

loans.use:
Purchase of manioc for flour production
(Acheter du manioc pour la fabrication de la farine)

loans.name: Chouy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chouy K. is 30 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She is a vendor selling grilled chicken near Kulen Mountain, where a number of tourists pass by. She generally earns up to $5 each day, while her husband makes approximately $ 5/day in revenue from working as a merchant buying and selling woods.

Mrs. Chouy K. would like to add more supplies to her inventory, but she faces a financial constrain. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to help her.

loans.use: To add more supplies for her inventory.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en: Isha sells food supplies in the market in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  She learned her business from her mother and was doing the same business before the civil war in Sierra Leone.  Isha is married with five children. With her husband’s meager salary as a driver, she plays a major role in providing for the family needs.  Isha said, she was able to pay her installment on time because she saves $1.25 daily with a Rotating and Savings club for the purpose. Her previous loan enabled her to purchase rice and sugar on wholesale.  Isha would like to diversify her business and is therefore requesting a loan of $250 to purchase cooking oil, and onions on wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Donka

texts.en: Donka B. lives with her boyfriend in the village of Medkovetz. She has two children. Her boyfriend works as a railroad worker. After meeting the MIKROFOND staff, Donka decided to start a farming business. She is requesting $750, which she will use to purchase a cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng O., 54, is a mother of eight children and is a widow.  She works running a stand at a market selling a wide variety of grocery products, earning about $3 a day in revenue.  One of her children works as a taxi driver, three are unemployed and the others are enrolled in school.  Mrs. Leng O. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory to offer more varieties of grocery products to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Rukia's Kinondoni Group

texts.en:
Rukia is 30 years old. She is married with three children, ages 14, 10 and 1. She has a business selling clothing, which she started in 2006. She works daily from 7am to 6pm and makes a monthly profit of about $90 from this business.

Rukia hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will share this loan with Salama, who also sells clothing in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Calixto

texts.en:
Calixto O. is a traveling salesman. He bakes various goodies made of corn and sells them on the streets, at soccer games, in parks and to parties. As a way to provide income for his wife and three children he is looking to expand his business and buy a cart.

With a cart, Calixto will be able to carry around more goodies, especially his most popular item, Pororó. With more to sell and a way in which to transport his goods farther, his income will rise.

loans.use: To buy a little cart to sell his baked goods.

loans.name: Kulwa

texts.en:
Kulwa is a 33 year old married woman with two children, ages 12 and 8. Kulwa is a cloth seller, a business she started in 1999. Every day she works from 5 A.M. to 4 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $ 330.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Señora Manuela belongs to the communal bank of Carmen Cabrejos located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 46 years old with 2 children. Her husband is a professor. With the first loan Manuela received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small convenience store.

She continues in this business. She begans her day at 7:00 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her family and she then services her store until 8:00 in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, eggs and milk

Manuela is very happy because she's able to provide for her children thanks to her job and she feels realized as a woman because she can take care of herself. She's very thankful for all the support Manuela Ramos has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Manuela pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Malecón Hoyada Mz 116 Lt 15, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es profesor. Manuela con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la atención de su bodega hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de huevos, 1 caja de leche, etc. Manuela esta muy satisfecha, por que esta viendo a sus hijos crecer con el apoyo que gracias a su trabajo ha logrado y también se siente realizada como mujer por que aprendió a trabajar y salir adelante y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her convenience store

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
Lady is 34 years old and she sells shoes in the market "De Los Pozos" in the Antonio Vaca Diez locale. She currently doesn't hold much merchandise for which she requires this loan.

Lady lives near Saguapac in her father-in-law's house. She has two children who are currently in school, and her common law husband is currently working in Spain.

Lady works as a shoe salesperson and has been doing so for about 10 years alongside her mother. It was her mother who taught her how to manage the business since she was young.

There is a great deal of competition in the field of shoe sales especially because there are 20 others holding down the same business. But her personal demeanor and her attention to detail and fine customer services have always brought Lady the demand she needs for her products.

With the loan she is requesting she will purchase merchandise because she doesn't have much left and as the prices of her products vary depending on the style.

Lady has had a good credit history and this is the second time she has been financed through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Lady de 34 años de edad, se dedica a vender zapatos rn el mercado de los pozos en la Antonio Vaca Diez, actualmente no tiene mucha mercadería por lo cual requiere de este crédito. Lady vive por Saguapac en la casa de su suegro, tiene dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes su concuvino no figura se encuentra trabajando en España. Lady trabaja como comerciante de zapatos desde hace más de diez años atrás y su mamá vende junto a ella, quién enseño a su hija todo sobre el negocio desde joven. Existe competencia en la venta de zapatos ya que donde ella vende hay unas 20 personas más con el mismo negocio, pero su amabilidad y su peculiar atención a los clientes hacen que Lady tenga siempre demanda por sus prodcutos. Con la presente solicitud Lasy comprará mercadería porque ya no tenía mucho y en cuanto a los precios de estos artículos varian dependiendo el modelo (masculino o femenino). Lady tiene bueno antecedentes crediticio y esta es la segunda vez que es financiada por Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar S. lives in Khujand, Tajikastan. She is married and has 4 children. MicroInvest has been working closely with Mrs. S. since 2004. She has not any problems with previous loans repayments. Mrs. S. sells shoes, children’s wear and sportswear. She works directly with suppliers so she can offer prices that are lower than the usual bazaar prices. She is very polite and has a lot of customers. She also has a background as a schoolteacher.

Now Mrs. S. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $350 US for 6 months to import some new seasonal wares.

loans.use: To import some new seasonal wares

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mr. Sitha S., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sokvanna Phauk, 34, who live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are enrolled in a local school.

Mr. Sitha has been a hairdresser for eighteen years. He operates his shop in Kor Ky market, while his wife has been selling grocery items for two years. She buys her products from Kor Ky market for resale at her shop in front of the house. The couple is living with their parents and now they are in the process of building their own house but lack some money. So Sitha is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to add to his own money to build their new house.

loans.use: To add to his own money to build a new house

loans.name: Elizabeth Sonia

texts.es:
Elizabeth is 47, lives with her husband and children. She’s had a small general store in her house for 20 years, motivated by the economic needs in her family and knowing that she was an important part that contributed to support it. Every day all day, she offers products for sale, such as basic need groceries.

Elizabeth enjoys her work and is eager to get ahead, she doesn’t find it difficult, only time consuming. Her children’s quality of life is the main reason for her hard work. She requests a loan to include school supplies in her store and more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Tiene una pequeña tienda que instaló en su casa hace más de 20 años, movida por la necesidad económica que existía en su familia, al ser parte importante en el sostenimiento de su familia.Ella ofrece diariamente, durante todo el día, productos de pan llevar; como abarrotes, los cuales son tan necesarios en la mesa de cada hogar.

Elizabeth disfruta de su trabajo y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, no considera ninguna dificultad en su trabajo, salvo que ocupa la mayor parte de su tiempo. El motivo de su esfuerzo es ver a sus hijos cada con una mejor calidad de vida. Solicita este préstamo para implementar su tienda con útiles escolares y mayor cantidad de mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
For the past eleven years, Hannah A. has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is a fifty year-old woman, married with three children who at school.

Hannah is busy trader who sells yams and fish on top of a table in the local market. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital. She therefore wants this loan to buy more tubers of yams and fresh fish to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children's education.

She belongs to the trust group called Dorcas Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling the repayment.

loans.use: To buy yam and dried fish in bulk.

loans.name: Sokum

texts.en:
Sokhum U., 35, and her husband, Kimheng Nhong, 38, live in a small village across the Mekong River, which is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two children, a son and a daughter. The children study in local school.
Sokhum has been a silk weaver since 1990. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes the products to sell in Phnom Penh.  Kimheng is both a rice farmer and a silk weaver.

Sokhum is requesting a loan of $ 300 to purchase wood materials to help repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials to repair house.

loans.name: Daniela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Danelia del Carmen Rodríguez tiene la edad de 57 años habita en Ticuantepe junto a su esposo, este  señor trabaja como guarda de seguridad en el Instituto publico de Ticuantepe para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa. La señora Rodríguez  tiene un kiosco en el mismo instituto y hace almuerzos a los docente, tiene 20 años trabajando en su negocio pero todavía no ha cumplido su sueños de ver terminada su casa, por lo cual solicito un monto de C$ 8,000.00 córdobas para comprar materiales y poder cumplir su gran sueño .Esta señora tiene hijos pero ya todos están casado y le ayudan económicamente.nn
texts.en:
Mrs. Danelia del Carmen R. is 57 years old and lives with her husband in Ticuantepe. Her husband works as security guard at the Public Institute of Ticuantepe to help her with household expenses. Mrs. R. has a grocery store in the same institute and prepares lunches for the teachers, she has 20 years working on her business but she hasn’t been able to fulfill her dream of finishing the construction of her home. This is why she is requesting a loan of C$8,000.oo Cordobas to buy material and fulfill her dream. Mrs. R. has children, but they are all grown up and married and help her financially.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone and cement to build walls

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of clothes and footwear for resale

loans.name: Alia M. Malik Group

texts.en:
Alia baji is a 25-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 5 years. She belongs to a poor family. She couldn’t attend school because her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses due to their low income. Her husband name is M. M. and he has a quilt-selling business. He does this work with his brother.

Alia baji’s mother taught her the art of sewing clothes before her marriage. This art has helped her after marriage: she started helping her husband in making warm quilts. She is applying for a loan to buy material (cloth, cotton, and thread) to expand her husband’s business.

She is the group leader for a few more women from her locality. Mukhtaran baji and Gulshan baji and Nazia baji each want a loan to buy quilts to re-sell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe-making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for making warm quilts

loans.name: Familia Unida Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal " FAMILIA UNIDA" esta representada por la señora Maritsabel y  conformado por 12 socios de los cuales un socio es varón el mismo que se dedica a la elaboración de jingles y spot publicitarios, además de que este banco comunal esta en su segundo ciclo cumplido con responsabilidad y cumpliendo con los pagos a tiempo. El grupo es muy unido ya que están trabajando por mucho tiempo juntos. Ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades como a la venta y comercialización de cerveza, venta de ropa intima, venta de telas, venta de ropa, venta de refrescos, venta de flores, venta de salchipapas venta de coca reglamentada. El destino del crédito es para el incremento de materiales e insumos para mejorar la calidad de sus productos así como para la reparación de sus herramientas de trabajo. las socias por lo que se menciono anteriormente tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Familia Unida" ("United Family") is represented by Maritzabel and consists of 12 partners, of whom one is male. He works writing jingles and advertising spots. This communal bank is in its second loan cycle, completing it with responsibility and timely payments. The group is very united, as they spend much of their time working together. They work in various sectors, selling and marketing beer; selling intimate apparel, fabrics, clothing, soft drinks, flowers, salchipapas (hot dogs with french fries), and regulated coca. This loan will allow them to buy more materials and inputs to increase the quality of their products as well as repair their working tools. The partners mentioned above have experience working in solidarity groups.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Hamzadin

texts.en:
Hamzadin H. is a young man with lots of experience, though he is uneducated. He works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, working with his family during this time. He has some land, but he would love to have more. To buy more land, he needs extra money. Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani with a term of 26 months to buy new land and start growing. He is a professional man and, in the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask Hamzadin to help with their problems. 
Hamzadin is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his first loan and it is really great, especially for agriculture workers. He wants to continue his partnership and encourage other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: Buying more land and seeds for growing

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir is 48 years old. He lives in the Guba region, in the Zerdabi village. He has been in the cattle breeding business for seven years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to improve his cattle breeding business. This man is married and has three children.

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

loans.name: Edithrudes

texts.en: Mrs. Edithrudes N. is 59 and married, with three children. When she was still in high school, her parents taught her to be more resourceful, finding ways to address her needs. When she got married, she always intended to venture into business and help her husband earn a living. At first, she cooked foods like pork, vegetables, and fish and sold it to their neighbors. Then she decided to join HSPFI and received PHP 10000 for her third loan. She used the fund to buy five head of pigs that were ready to be slaughtered. The raw products (pork) were delivered to their established customers as per their orders. With her ability to run the meat vending business, both she and her husband are more focused. As the business grows, they are getting more good customers. So she applied for her sixth loan in the amount of PHP17000 to purchase 10 head of pigs to meet the demands of her customers. She dreams of buying her own delivery truck to make her business easier and more convenient.

loans.use: To purchase 10 head of pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 30, sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. Her husband is a photographer and they have one child. There are frequent power outages and she is applying for a loan amount of 70000 Nairas to purchase a fridge and a generator to enable her to sell cold drinks to her customers.
She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and a generator

loans.name: Sokvun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokvun V., 22, and her husband, Mr. Nak Nheb, 24, were married in 2003 and have two sons. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokvun has been a silk weaver since she was thirteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for three years. He is a silk weaver as well. Sokvun is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk-weaving business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora A. is 43 years old and married to Reynaldo A., a 44-year-old farmer. They live in the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. The place is quite remote and mountainous. Over time, they were blessed with four children. The eldest, Hazel, is 22 years old and is a high school graduate. The second, Hemerson, is 19 years old. Jayherson, her third child, is 15 years old and just graduated from primary school. Her youngest child, Kyla, is still in grade school.

Nora is engaged in a piggery (hog raising) business. She has been in business for many years and it has been of big help to her family. Her wish is to expand her business to improve her standard of living. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000, which will be used as her working capital in the expansion of her business. She is planning to buy additional piglets and four sacks of pig feed. She is always dreaming of raising their standard of living, and she knows that she can reach her dream by working continuously. Nora believes that, having patience in work, anything we want in life we will be able to attain some day.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace K. is 32 years old. She is married and has two children – one daughter and one son, both of whom are currently in primary school. Grace lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Grace and her husband both work to provide for the family. Her husband is a teacher by profession and she is a trader. She sells polythene bags of all kinds and sizes. She buys the bags from Accra and hawks them in her community. Grace says she also distributes some to other retailers in her community. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan buy polythene bags in bulk so she can increase her stock. Grace is hopeful to sponsor her children through school.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags in bulk

loans.name: Rogelina

texts.es: Rogelina P. S. de 46 años de edad reside en Soyapango junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una panadería en la cual trabaja arduamente junto a su esposo para darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos desde hace más de nueve años. Rogelina solicita un préstamo, ya que es necesario para ellos reparar los automóviles para repartir el pan, es por esto que desean obtener el préstamo ya que sin los carros repartidores obtienen menos ganancias.
texts.en:
Rogelina P. S. is 46 years old, she lives in Soyapango with her husband and her two children. She owns a bakery where she has worked arduously for more than nine years together with her husband in order to provide for their children. Rogelina requests a loan as she needs to repair the vehicles used to distribute the bread. Therefore she wishes to receive the loan as she obtains less earnings without the vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of vehicles used to distribute bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow peanuts

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es: Roberto Jose de 37 años de edad, es casado, trabaja como contador, ademas es tecnico en reparaciones de computadoras, tiene 2 niños cursando la escuela primaria, su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de ropa, cosmeticos y otros.  Esta solicitando su 8vo credito para invertirlo en un pequeño negocio de video-juegos que tiene en su casa de habitacion donde obtiene ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar, comprando nuevos cd de juegos, cambio de algunos equipos y acondicionar y poco mas el local.  El mayor sueño de Roberto es poder darle a su familia las mejores condiciones de vida para que sus hijos puedan crecer en un ambiente feliz y comodo, ademas desea que estos estudien hasta que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Roberto Jose is 37 years old and married with two children in primary school. He is an accountant and computer repairman. His wife has a small store selling clothing, cosmetics and other products. He is asking for his eighth loan to invest in a small video game business in his home where he earns additional funds to support his family by buying and selling new games cds and upgrading equipment and fixing up his shop. His dream is to be able to give his family the best life possible so that his children can grow in a comfortable and happy way and have the education to find professional work.

Translated from Spanish by Patty Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a video game room.

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi sells utensils and drinks. She gets goods directly from the producers, because she is a big dealer and has been in this business since 2003. Funmi is 42 years old and married with a child. Funmi is hoping for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more utensils and drinks to sell. She thanks you

loans.use: To purchase utensils and drinks to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Elizabeth es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Elizabeth junto a su cuñada se dedican a la compra de ganado en las diferentes ferias y los comercializa en la feria de San Juan. Además Elizabeth tiene un salón de belleza y vende cosméticos por catalogo.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son tener casa propia y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Inti Community Bank. Elizabeth is 38, married, and she has two children. Elizabeth, together with her sister-in-law, buys livestock at different fairs and sells them at the San Juan fair. Also, Elizabeth has a beauty salon, and she sells cosmetics by catalog. Elizabeth needs a loan for 1,600 PEN to buy livestock. Elizabeth’s dreams are to have her own house and that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Chinita

texts.en:
A firm believer that “there’s wealth beneath the garbage”, Chinita G. is a 48-year-old garbage collector in Malibay, Pasay City.  She lives with her husband Eduardo, 54, an equally hardworking garbage collector.

Chinita and her husband have been a garbage collectors for more than twenty years.  She scours the village streets riding on her pedicab (rickshaw), collecting each household’s rubbish.  Her husband does the same routine in other areas.  Before they dump everything at the city’s waste disposal facility, they salvage anything of value, such as paper, bottles, and scrap metals, and sell these to buyers who in turn sell them to foundries and large junk shops.  After her daily garbage collection, she tends her ukay-ukay store (used clothing).  She earns more than P13,000 per month from these activities.

Chinita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006.  This time, she has applied for a new P20,000 loan with CCT to purchase parts for the repair of her pedicab, and for her used clothing business.
 
It has been Chinita’s long sought-after dream to have her own house and business lot, including her own junk shop.  She also hopes that with her and her husband’s combined hard work, their children would be able to finish their studies. 

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Repair of pedicabs used in garbage collection and used clothes sales

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de León, la señora Amparo G. vende los productos de golosinas, galletas y algunas frutas teniendo un local que no presta muy buenas condiciones pero ella ha logrado salir adelante poco a poco por medio de las ventas de estos productos comestibles.

La razón por la que ella solicita el crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de las golosinas, galletas y algunas frutas para continuar ofreciéndolas en su establecimiento y de esta manera contribuir al bienestar de su familia que tanto requieren del apoyo de ella.
texts.en:
Amparo G. sells sweets, cookies, and some fruits in the Central Market in León. She has a place there, which is not in very good condition. But, she has been able to get ahead little by little through her food sales. The reason she is asking for a loan is to buy sweets, cookies, and some fruit to be able to continue selling them in her establishment. This way she can contribute to the well being of her family, which needs her support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food

loans.name: Teleubai

texts.en:
Teleubai H. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a small house. His three older children currently attend a local secondary school and his youngest is in kindergarten. H.'s wife, Juldiz, is also self-employed and operates a clothing business.

H. operates a raw material trading business in his town. His major products are sheep and goat skins. H. started his business in 1999 by purchasing and selling animal skins in his local area. However, to take advantage of higher demand and profit potential, he now transports and sells the skins in Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and the capitol of Mongolia. He continues to make progress with his business and uses his earnings to improve his family's quality of life.

With the continued success of both of their businesses, H. and his wife hope to use their earnings to add on to their home. H. is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials for his animal skins business and coal for his own use.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his animal skins business and coal for his own use

loans.name: Miriam Marlene

texts.es:
Miriam trabaja vendiendo productos de Herbalife, es madre soltera y la única que genera ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares
Vive en la zona Achumani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de batidos, vitaminas y productos de nutrición)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su responsabilidad y la necesidad que tiene le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Miriam works selling Herbalife products. She is a single mother and the sole breadwinner in her household.

She lives in her parents’ house in the Achumani zone of the City of La Paz. This loan will be used as working capital to purchase shakes, vitamins, and other nutritional products.

This is the first time that she requests a loan from Impro. Her responsibility and her necessity give her the opportunity to obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 28-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Firas has owned a barber shop since 2002. Firas requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of his shop. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

Firas is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools for his shop. Firas decided to go into this business because he wanted to have independent work; in addition, he learned the skills in an academy. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en: Mrs. Vitaliana T. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 72 years old, a widow, and is blessed with three adult children. Vitaliana’s income comes primarily from her pension and from her furniture business and amounts to 12,000 monthly. Vitaliana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Vitaliana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her furniture business

loans.name: Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
Tatu S., age 37, is married and has three children ages of 15, 11 and 7 years.  She has a salon and has sold fabrics since 2008 and she is able to earn a monthly profit of around $75.

This will be Tatu’s first loan, called a motisha loan, from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Tatu hopes to obtain a loan to grow her two businesses.
	
Tatu will share this loan with her small loan group, which totals eight members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  In the picture, Tatu is first on the left.

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: 12-Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Lan B. T. (251) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Lan is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 12-Dong Son (10.13.12 Dong Son).
Lan is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a family member's business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lan has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.
In 2009, Lan joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lan is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her third from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Lan plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. P. T. Sau (252) is a 24-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 2. T. K. Dung (255) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. 3. N. T. Phuong (256) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. 4. L. T. Nguyet (254) is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 5. D. T. Chau (253) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 6. L. T. Ha (266) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Lan B. T. (251) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Lan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 12- Dong Son (10.13.12 Dong Son). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương. Lan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Lan kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, Lan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. P. T. Sau (252) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. T. K. Dung (255) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. N. T. Phuong (256) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 4. L. T. Nguyet (254) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 5. D. T. Chau (253) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 6. L. T. Ha (266) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Top Lach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Top L. lives in Thma Sa village in Takeo province. She is a village bank president for a group that consists of fifteen members who receive individual loans but are bound by a group guarantee, located in Kbal Kaoh village, Kandal province.  She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer while other is a student in the local school.

She and her husband, Mr. Tuy Doang, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate both rice and vegetables. They face a problem because their field is infertile, and is located far from an irrigation system. Therefore, Mrs. Top L. has asked for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to support her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline to support farming

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid S. is 52 years old, is married, and has two children.

For more than twenty years Vahid has been selling fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots, apples, bananas, etc. His business begins early in the morning at 5:00 a.m.

Vahid buys vegetables from the local farmers wholesale and sells them in the market. Moreover, he is trading in a market that is known among people because of the attractive prices. All this allows Vahid’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for his family.

Today, Vahid is planning to purchase new, fresh vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh vegetables to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San M. is 56 years old and is a villager who lives in Andoung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Song Miet, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Song Miet is also a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to support his family living. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

In order to support her husband’s business, Mrs. San M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pig to breed for piglets. This loan, she hopes, will increase their income and improve the family’s standard of living.

Mrs. San M. is the mother of three children, one of whom is a vegetable seller, another is a farmer who supports the parents’ farming, while the last one grows vegetables.

loans.use: To buy a pig to breed piglets

loans.name: Wilson Gilberto

texts.es:
Wilson Gilberto Vásconez Martines tiene 40 años, es casado, y  tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Wilson trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, habas  y papas  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como chanchos los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Wilson hacer deporte en la comunidad y leer la Biblia. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
