Wilson Gilberto Vásconez Martines is 40 years old. He lives in the Guaranda district in Bolívar province. Wilson is a member of a rural community Group Enmanuel. This community is located 45 minutes from the Cantón Guaranda capital in Bolívar province. There are 17 members in total, and it is an agricultural and livestock community. The people are indigenous and speak Quechua. Wilson works in agriculture to help his family's economies. The crops that are most successful are maiz, broad beans and potatoes. He also works breeding animals, mainly pigs. He sells these products at home and and what he sows he sells in the principle market in Guaranda every six months. A big part of the culture is the carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. Wilson also does sport in the community and reads the bible. Wilson is seeking a loan to purchase goods for his farm work, mainly fertilisers. His goal is to generate good economic activity for his family. The challenges that he faces are problems with the weather and the diseases that affect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El joven Francisco Javier C. es soltero y vive con sus padres y los apoya económicamente, el labora para un restaurante como mesero y cajero, además cuenta con los ingresos de su mama ya que ella prepara y vende comida rápida,
Ellos como una familia muy unida y responsable están tramitando este crédito para la mejora de los acabados interiores y exteriores de su hogar
texts.en:
This young man, Francisco Javier C., is single and lives with his parents, supporting them financially. He works as waiter and cashier in a restaurant, and also has income from his mother, who prepares and sells fast food. They are a close family, very responsible. They are requesting this loan to improve their home inside and out.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work on their home, internal and external

loans.name: God Gives Group

texts.en:
Annie Z. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Gives. She is married and has 5 children who range from 10 to 20 years old. Annie did not have the opportunity to go school.

For 12 years, Annie has been selling charcoal at the Plank Field in the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She sells good and dry charcoal to customers in order to encourage them to continue patronizing her business. Annie started selling with very little cash, but she has now improved. She has a problem because a lot people sell the same goods that she sells, which sometimes makes business bad. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal to serve customers. Her goal is to expand her business to a better size and to improve the living conditions of her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Annie is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to serve customers.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. CLARA,  ella tiene 51 años de edad es casada y tiene 6 hijos  todos independientes Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades básicas con el comercio minorista, La socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en el barrio de Santiago , nuestra socia trabaja con su tienda desde hace 20 años, ella ayudo a sus hijos con su educación superior con los ingresos de esta tienda, ahora lo hace más por distracción y es muy feliz con su negocio, cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para acomodar y abrir su tienda y atiende con el mayor agrado y carisma. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su tienda y comprar arroz, azúcar, leche al por mayor y otros pequeños productos.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the “COMUZONE” Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cusco, in the Huanchac district in the department of Cusco. Clara is 51 years old, married, and has 6 adult children. She mixes her household activities with retail. Clara has a small grocery store in the neighborhood of Santiago. She has worked at her store for 20 years—she helped her children with their higher education with her income from the store. These days she works more because it provides a distraction, and she is very happy with her business. Every morning Clara gets up very early to set up and open her store, and she attends to her customers with much cheer and charisma. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her store by purchasing rice, sugar, and milk at wholesale prices, and also purchase other small products. Clara is very grateful for the support she is being given through this loan, and she agrees to complete her payments according to the terms of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her store by purchasing rice, sugar, and milk at wholesale prices, and purchasing other small products.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a resident of Borewala, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines.  She is the wife of M. A. and the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son works in a factory on a monthly wage and the younger is in the 5th standard at school. Her daughter has not reached school-going age yet. 

A very caring lady, Mumtaz stays at home and manages the household chores very efficiently while taking care of her family. Her husband is a driver by profession. He drives a local bus and earns income on monthly basis, but now the financial demands are increasing day by day, and the income is becoming insufficient to meet the expenses.  Therefore, Mumtaz is applying for her first loan from Asasah, which she intends to use to purchase an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband.  This will allow him to increase his income and do his work with full dedication and enthusiasm.

loans.use: To purchase an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Madame Rokhaya  D.  est une femme de 60 ans qui habite à Ouakam. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis un an. Elle a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Madame D. s’active depuis huit ans dans le commerce  de thioup, thiouraye, tissus, pate d’arachide et autres produits divers. Elle a démarré  ses activités en en achetant des produits  au marche  Sandaga  pour les commercialiser. Ensuite elle a commence à voyager vers la Mauritanie et autres pays limitrophes en vue de diversifier ses produits et maximiser ses profits.  Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs dans le but de voyager  et d’acheter des produits de Diaobe et aussi  de la pate d’arachide ceci dans l’objectif de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle est veuve et en même  temps soutient de famille et ce   financement  pourra lui permettre de renforcer sa capacité de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rokhaya D. is a 60-year-old woman who lives in Ouakam. She has been a member of the credit union U-IMCEC for a year. She has already received a previous loan. Mrs. D. has been in the retail business of thioup [indigo dyed fabric], thiouraye [incense], fabric, peanut butter and other products. She started her activity by buying supplies at the Sandaga market to resell them. Later she started to travel to Mauritania and other neighboring countries in order to diversify her products and to maximize her income. She is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs with the goal to travel and buy products from Diaobe and also peanut butter in order to meet her customers’ demand. She is a widow and a family provider and this financing will allow her to boost up her ability to take care of her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana A. is from the village of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 74 years old. Susana is widowed and has eight adult children. To make a living, Susana operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes from buying and selling cashew nuts in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2007, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Susana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Beatrice Sirri is married to Mr Lucas C. and they are blessed with seven children one of which is below the age of 15. She has faced so many challenges as a woman, like when the cold hands of death took her sister away and when she finds it difficult to assist her husband in paying for their children’s education and providing for the basic needs of their children.

The inability to get enough investment capital which would give her higher income to meet her children’s and family's needs motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE. She has successfully obtained and repaid loans from GHAPE seven times.

She thinks the business will succeed once she has expanded her farm land and seed trading business. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds and pay for her cultivable land to be cleared. The profit obtained from this investment will assist her husband in paying for their children’s education and basic needs and the rest will be ploughed back into the business.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.

Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and clear cultivable land.

loans.name: Yapuchiri Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “YAPUCHIRI”, (sembrador en idioma aymara) es una asociación que solicita crédito por tercera vez, es parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho personas, tienen como presidenta a la señora Sinforosa A.. 

La presidenta, Sinforosa A., desde hace dos años elabora artesanía en tejido. La venta es realizada en las avenidas céntricas de la ciudad de La Paz, los días sábados y domingos. Le ayudan a tejer tres señoras. Este tipo de negocio le permite a la señora atender su hogar, pues  está casada y tiene seis hijos.

Este primer crédito fue por Bs.1200.-, actualmente la asociación le aprobó Bs.3000.-, ella indica que le servirá para la compra de materia prima, es decir lana.
 
En el caso de las  integrantes de la asociación comunal, tienen diversos negocios, como: venta de ropa, venta de comida, comerciante, sombrerería, venta de cosméticos, venta de víveres, tejido de mantas.
texts.en:
The “YAPUCHIRI” (Planter in Aymara) communal bank is an association that is seeking funds for the third time. It is part of the German Busch Focus Center and it has 8 members; its president is Mrs. Sinforosa A.. Mrs. A. has been a weaver for the last two years. She carries out her sales along La Paz’s downtown streets on Saturdays and Sundays. Three women help her weave. This type of business allows her to tend to her home because she’s married and has six children. The first loan was for Bs.1200 and currently she was approved for a Bs. 3000 loan. She indicates that it will be used to buy raw materials, that is to say, wool. With respect to the rest of the group members, they have a variety of business such as: clothing sales, food sales, some are merchants, hat makers, cosmetics sales, grocery sales and blanket weavers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Nancy Margarita

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre  de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Sagrado Corazón del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir frutas, las cuales se procesan para luego ser exportadas al extranjero. El lugar se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, la zona se encuentra situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio tiene mucha acogida por parte de sus vecinos ya que ellos encuentran al alcance de su mano productos de consumo diario. Asimismo se vale de el para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Nancy trata siempre de mantener su negocio ofreciendo productos de calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes.

Nancy desea adquirir mas productos para ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Nancy es una mujer tranquila y bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, en la zona donde vive es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
24-year old Nancy lives with her husband and two children in the neighbourhood of Sagrado Corazón in the district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural area known for its fruit which is processed there and then exported overseas. The town is located in Piura province, in the region of Piura, some three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. Nancy sells basic necessities and groceries from a store in her home. The business is popular with her neighbours as they can buy items they need on a daily basis close by. As well, Nancy helps her husband with family expenses. She always makes an effort to have quality products to sell and to treat her customers well. Nancy wants to expand her stock so that she can sell more products and earn more money. For this reason she approached Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to ask for a first-time loan of 1500 soles. She is a calm and hardworking woman whose greatest wish is to carry on working so that she can provide her family with a better standard of living. In the community where she lives she is well-known and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Liliana H. y su esposo el señor Sergio Rodriguez tienes dos hijos que desean darles lo mejor. 
La señora Liliana tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada y aparatos eléctricos, le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión del negocio.
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y planea pagarlo con las ganancias que obtendrá del negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liliana H. and her husband, Mr. Sergio Rodriguez, have two children that they want to be able to provide for. Mrs. Liliana has a small business selling used clothing and electronic devices. She is lacking variety in her merchandise but currently hasn't got the necessary amount of money to invest in her business. For that reason, she is seeking out a loan and plans to pay it back with the profits that she would earn.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Srom

texts.en:
Mrs. Srom S. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photograph. Srom S. works sewing clothes in a garment factory to earn a living. Another source of family income is from her husband who works as a construction foreman. He has a few employees who help provide his service. 

Mrs. Srom S. has two young school-aged kids. She still lives in her parents’ house and she hopes to build her own house to live in, but her personal savings is not enough to start building one. To achieve her goal, she decided to take out a loan to be able to afford building a new house.

loans.use: To be able to afford building a new house.

loans.name: Edith Mabel

texts.es:
Edith trabaja administrando la tienda de víveres de su papa en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

La tienda pertenece a su papa pero como el enfermo le pidió a ella que la administre para que no se pierda el negocio porque es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia. Poco a poco ha venido trabajando desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h30am todos los días. Vende arroz, víveres, legumbres etc. 

Para que el negocio siga aumentando sus ingresos necesita surtir mas la tienda por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites, legumbres, carnes etc. En el futuro quiere que sus negocios sea mas grande.
texts.en:
Edith manages her father's grocery store located in the front section of the house. She lives in an urban region known for its many vendors. The store belongs to her father but since he fell ill he asked her to run the business for him, to keep the business alive. It is the only source of income for the family. She has been managing the business, working from 7a.m. to 10:30 pm every day. She sells rice, groceries, vegetables, etc. In order to keep her business growing and improving the profits, she needs to restock the store. She needs to purchase rice, cooking oils, vegetables, meats etc. In the future she would like to have a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, cooking oils, vegetables.

loans.name: El Cruce Hacia El Futuro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro está formado por 9 mujeres de una misma comunidad como es el Cruce que pertenece a la parroquia de Sinincay,  su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura la misma que es para su consumo, también salen a la ciudad en busca de un buen empleo. Nuestras socias son mujeres luchadoras quienes día a día buscan un mejor bienestar para sus familias y con su trabajo mejoran la economía de sus hogares, son mujeres muy alegres y lo demuestran en cada reunión de la banca comunal.

La Señora. Jhoanna J. vive por el sector de las Malvinas en la ciudad de Cuenca. Tiene 19 años, es casada hace poco tiempo y por el momento no tiene hijos, su esposo es carpintero, no tienen casa propia por lo que  viven arrendando. 
La Señora. Jhoanna trabaja administrando su propio taller de carpintería en el que labora hace un año, trabaja en las tardes ya que en la mañana se dedica al arreglo de su hogar. Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y todos los créditos le han beneficiado para la compra de materiales y ahora con este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de madrea y tintes para su carpintería.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.

La Señora María C. vive en la comunidad de El Cruce que  pertenece a la parroquia de Sinincay. Tiene 46 años, es casada y  tiene 4 hijo de 28, 24, 14 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo se dedica a trabajar y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segundo hijo es casado y vive  independientemente  y sus dos últimas hijas  estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión escultor,  trabaja en mármol y tiene  un taller propio en casa, la casa en la que habitan es propia.
Doña María es socia de la banca comunal hace 5 años y tiene una gran amistad con todas las socias de la banca comunal, es un grupo de mujeres unidas con un solo fin, que es seguir creciendo en sus negocios. Nuestra socia hace 3 años se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos, los vende pelados en su comunidad. El nuevo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales.
  
Su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “El Cruce hacia el Futuro” (Crossroad to the Future) communal bank is composed of 9 women from the same, El Cruce, community which is part of Sinincay parish.  Its residents raise farm animals and grow crops for their own consumption; they also go to the city looking for a good job.  Our members are hard working women who seek daily to improve their families’ wellbeing and to improve their home’s income through their hard work. They are women who are cheerful and who exhibit this at each communal bank meeting.

Mrs. Jhoanna J. lives around the Malvinas area of Cuenca.  She is 19 years old, married a short time ago, and with no children for the time being.  Her husband is a carpenter.  They do not own their own home.  They rent.  

Jhoanna runs her own carpentry shop where she has been working for a year.  She works in the afternoon because during the morning she tends to her home. 

This is her third loan cycle and all previous loans have been used to buy materials.  The new loan will be used to buy wood and wood stains for her carpentry.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

Mrs. María C. lives in El Cruce which is part of Sinincay parish.  She is 46 years old, married and has four children who are 28, 24, 14 and 12 years of age.  Her oldest son is employed and helps with household expenses.  Her second son is married and lives independently.  Her youngest two daughters are in school in the city.  Her husband is a sculptor.  He works in marble and has a shop installed in their home.  They own their house.

María has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years.  She is a good friend of all the other members.  It is a group of women united with a single goal: to continue growing in their businesses.

Our member has raised guinea pigs and chickens for three years.  She sells them already dressed in her community. 

She will use the new loan she’s getting in the communal bank to buy feed for her animals.

Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: To buy wood and wood stains and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 36 years old and a member of the Unity group in Faulu Kenya.  He is a married man with four children, aged 10, 7, 4 and 1. For a living, he runs a retail shop.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his finances well. With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he will buy sugar, wheat, maize flour and cooking fat. He hopes to buy a piece of land so as to build his own house and to open another shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Nyabubare Women's Group-Ntungamo

texts.en: Constance T. is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. For the past 15 years she has been selling agricultural products in Bibunye-Ruhara-Ntungamo.  She has mostly been selling bananas, beans and milk. With 400,000 shillings as her monthly profit, it is fair to say her business has been growing steadily. With this loan Constance plans to buy a cow. Constance belongs to the Nyabubare Women's group-Ntungamo.

loans.use: The purchase of a cow.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is married with three children between six and eight. He lives in Kwamuhila, Emali, which is along one of the major highways in Kenya. Simon has operated a Bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business for the last six years. His customers are mainly business people and travelers in the area.

Simon got to know about KADET through other members who were already in KADET and has never borrowed from another financial institution. He has currently applied for a loan to buy another motorcycle to increase his daily operation and income. With the two motorcycles, he can manage to cover a wider area.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth L. is from the town of Banga. She is 52 years old and married with three children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns a business planting and harvesting rice and corn and vegetables to sell.

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Javier; el tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica al negocio de transporte turístico el socio trabaja con turismo hace ya unos años atrás y  trabaja con diferentes agencias que  solicitan su servicios de los diferentes tours que brinda, de esta forma el socio saca a su familia adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su carro y para algunos gastos personales. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, "CHIKON."  It is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Javier.  He is 22, has a live-in girlfriend, and has 1 son.  He is in the business of tourism transportation and has worked in tourism for several years.  He works with various agencies that request the services of different tours he offers.  In this way, he takes good care of his family.

He is requesting a loan to do maintenance on his car and to pay for some personal expenses.  He is happy about the loan and promises to make all of his payments on time.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan to do maintenance on his car and to pay for some personal expenses.

loans.name: One Word-Ii Group

texts.en:
Kadija B. (pictured in the middle, back row) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadija was born in Makeni city twenty-nine years ago. She is married to a motor bike taxi driver.  The couple has two children who are attending primary schools. For many years now, Kadija has been selling breads. 

This is the first loan that Kadija and her group members have applied for from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Kadija will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business.  She will buy flour, sugar, salt, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of breads for sale.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to produce breads for sale

loans.name: Azam

texts.en: Azam is a 33-year-old married man who lives with his wife and 5 children in Gaza. In 2006 Azam opened his own paint shop since there were no shops of this type in the area. He hopes that thanks to this loan he will be able to buy new supplies for his paint shop. And hopefully this will bring in more customers and will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for his paint shop

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita V. is from the village of Villaluz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Lolita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the local community. Lolita is just starting this business.

In 2011, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rose  Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary O. is a 38-year-old lady from Likoni. She is married to George and they have four children.

Rose Mary has been in the clothing business for the last three years.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET Ltd.  She paid her previous loan well and in good time. 

She plans to add more clothes for sale. She will direct the anticipated income into the expansion of her business. 

Her dream is to be a successful business lady in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Josue Manuel

texts.es:
Josué es un joven de 20 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su madre, es soltero, él administra una tienda, negocio que nace hace 3 años, ya que en un inicio fuera de su madre quien lo mantuvo por 15 años, luego de ser  de Josué, este joven se empeña cada día en tener lo mejor en el negocio, atendiéndolo de 5:0am a 7:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería arroz, azúcar, aceite, papel, frijoles, embutidos, entre otros, esta  ayuda fortalecerá el negocio y obtendrá mejores beneficios, ya que contara con la preferencia de los clientes, y estos le darán una mayor rentabilidad.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, realizarse inversiones que lo fortalezcan y les brinde seguridad y solvencia económica para él y su madre.
texts.en:
20 year-old Josué is a young man who lives in San Rafael Oriente, in San Miguel department.  He is single and lives with his mother.  Josué runs a store and started his business three years ago.  His mother supported him for 15 years and then it was his turn to support himself.  This young man strives  every day to put his best into his business.  He works from 5.00am to 7.00pm.

Josué is requesting a loan to buy merchandise: rice, sugar, oil, paper, beans, sausages, and other products.  This help will strengthen his business and he will make better profits since he has loyal customers who will make his business more profitable.

Josué's goals are to keep going in his business, to make investments that strengthen his business and to provide himself and his mother with financial security and solvency.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: rice, sugar, oil, paper, beans, sausages, etc.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en: Nathan is a thirty-two-year-old married man with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has had a retail shop for two years which he started with one million UGX from the sale of pigs, and now his current working capital is 3,000,000 UGX. His hardship is the increase in commodity prices, and his vision is to have a wholesale business, educate his children and build a permanent house. Nathan needs the credit facility to buy sugar, eggs and paraffin for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs and paraffin for resale

loans.name: Los Dos Olivos Group

texts.es:
La señora Edali  M. Vázquez, es integrante del grupo "Los dos olivos", que se ubica en la colonia "Juan Sabines", ella vive en unión libre con el señor Roberclein Hernández López y aun no tienen bebés.
     Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de elotes para venderlos preparados en la misma localidad, se inspiro en esta actividad ya que también quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos, y así juntos comenzar a horrar para progresar.
    Con las ganancias que obtenga invertirá nuevamente en el negocio, y además solventará algunos gastos de la casa.
   Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el crédito otorgado pueda seguir trabando, y así pueda comenzar a comprar algunas cosa para la construcción de su casa.
Los integrantes del grupo son:
María Elizabeth en la venta de antojitos.
Antonia Hernández López: compra y vende horchata de coco natural.
texts.en:
Ms. Edali M. Vázquez is a member of the Los Dos Olivos (The Two Olive Trees) microfinance group in the Juan Sabines housing development. She lives with her partner, Mr. Roberclein Hernández López, and they do not have any children yet.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in purchasing ears of corn to cook and sell in the same locality. She was inspired to start this business because she also wants to help her husband with an extra income, thus they can both start to save money and get ahead.

She will once again invest her profits into the business, plus she will pay for some household expenses.

What she desires most is that with this small business and with the loan she will receive, she will continue working so that she can start buying materials to build a house.

The other group members are: María Elizabeth, who sells street food. Antonia Hernández López, who buys and sells a sweet coconut beverage.

loans.use: to purchase ears of corn which will then be boiled and sold.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 44 years old and married with six children. To earn an income for her family, she works as a farmer in Trento, Agusan del Sur. She has been farming for 11 years now. In addition to this, she also makes baskets for an income. Her loan will be used to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and also raw materials for making baskets. Her main goals are to increase her profit and consistently improve her product and rice yield.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and also raw materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como Chichubamba este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

Maricruz de 23 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene un hijo, vive con su esposo en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua, y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Maricruz se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral como por ejemplo pollos, el corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con dieta balanceada. Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso óptimo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Urubamba, incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo cosas que le hacen falta en su casa. Nos cuenta con mucha  pena que tenía 500 pollos pero una bacteria enfermo a 100 pollos de las cuales le hizo fracasar pero a pesar de las adversidades Maricruz va seguir adelante con el negocio.  
 
El crédito que ha solicitado Maricruz es de 500 nuevos soles a Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para la compra de más aves de corral y su alimento respectivo, con la finalidad de que sus animales engorden y pueda venderlos a un buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Maricruz es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Urubamba of the department of Cusco, there is a place known as Chichubamba and it is known for its beautiful sceneries, the gastronomy, and for the warmth of the people.

Maricruz is 23 years old. She has a partner and their son is the fruit of their relationship. She lives with her husband in a house which they own and it is equipped with water and electricity. It is located in the province of Urubamba and in the department of Cusco. This region's primary business activities are agriculture, farming, and tourism. 

Maricruz raises and sells foul, including poultry. The corral where the animals live is located in the rear section of her property. She feeds them a balanced diet. She sells her livestock when they have reached an optimal size and weight at the different markets in the city of Urubamba. This increases her income and she is able to acquire what she needs for the home. She tells us that she had 500 chickens but a bacteria sickened 100 of them and it caused them to die. But despite the adversities Maricruz will continue moving forward with the business.

The loan that Maricruz requests is in the amount of 500 nuevos soles from Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) and it will be used to purchase more foul and their feed. Her goal is to fatten the livestock to be able to sell them at a good price, to pray for her loan and to help her improve their quality of life.

Maricruz is a hardworking and attentive woman who has always known to keep moving forward to improve in life and to achieve what she wants.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and feed.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 42 years old and operates Nyagah Metal works where he makes window frames and doors.  He has engaged in the business for fifteen years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become hopeful for his business because he can access business loans easily.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Faafili

texts.en:
Faafili is 53 years of age and married with six children. Faafili owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Faafili needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Faafili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faafili's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Bessik

texts.en:
Bessik comes from the village of Tkhilnari in the mountainous Adjara region. He is 25 years old and married. Bessik lives with his wife and parents. He is the only provider of income for the whole family.

Bessik drives a mini bus in the Adjara region. Along with this job, he leads the agricultural activities of the family. They own 0.3 hectare of the land where they grow citrus and other fruits. They sell the harvested products on the local market. 

Also, the family has a small poultry farm. Bessik purchases chickens and after they are grown, he sells them on the local market. His wife and mother always help Bessik on the farm. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,350 GEL, including the health pension for Bessik’s father. 

With the requested credit, Bessik plans to purchase more chickens for the farm. As a result of the credit, he will be able to sell more poultry and increase the income of the family. Bessik plans to use the increased income to purchase new household items to make the house more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for the poultry farm.

loans.name: Basema

texts.en:
Basema is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and one daughter.  Basema lives in Gaza city in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee and a taxi driver in order to secure a better income for his family. As his taxi needs urgent maintenance and Basema's husband can't cover the expenses right now, Basema took out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN so her husband can pay for the necessary repairs for the taxi.

Basema is a conservative woman, therefore her husband is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: To pay for taxi maintenance expenses.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 9 años de edad, lleva muchos años dedicándose al cultivo de maíz, su padre le enseño el trabajo, actualmente tiene la siembra y necesita comprar 5 sacos de abono y también un depósito de pesticidas.
Esta compra le permitirá tener los insumos para tratar a tiempo el cultivo, fortaleciéndolo y previniendo que una plaga le afecte.
El propósito de Julio es tener una buena cosecha, con todos los cuidados necesarios pueda tener la suficiente producción para la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is a farmer. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 5 and 9. He has been growing corn for many years. His father taught him this job. He has done his planting this year and now needs to buy five sacks of fertilizer and some pesticides.
This purchase will provide him with the resources to deliver his crop on time, as it allows him to strengthen his crop and protect it from insects.
He would like to have a good harvest. After taking all the necessary precautions, he should have a sufficient harvest, which will allow him to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Kitembe Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Wisex is a 33-year-old married man with three children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family and his dream is to start  an income generating activity for his wife so as to boost his income. He has been selling medicines for three years but his major hardship has been inadequate capital to invest in the business and his goal is to have a pharmacy in the next four years.

Wisex needs the loan to buy drugs for resale.

loans.use: To buy medicines for resale.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol is 37 years old.  She is a widow with one child living under her  care. She is a hardworking woman. Thol has been generating her income by raising pigs. From this business, she earns approximately $5USD each day. 

Thol would like to expand her business but lacks capital.  She wishes to request some funds to buy concentrated feed for fattening her pigs. She wants to increase her business so that her micro-enterprise will grow more each day through this loan. This will allow her to provide her customers with the best product whenever her pigs are ready to be sold. Thol’s business was started as a new source of revenue so that she could improve the quality of life for her family and provide the best education for her child.  This is the first loan with Kiva and the fourth loan with HKL partner. She said that becoming a member of this micro-finance group was an excellent decision because obtaining a loan is an easier, faster process and has a low interest rate. She is very grateful to all kind lenders that always help her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana, 47, is married and lives with her husband and three children. She intends to use the loan to buy concentrate to fatten up her pigs. She has several pigs and she intends to feed them concentrate to fatten them up more quickly. She wants her animals to be at a better weight to the sell them at her local market or in surrounding areas. She wants to earn the most profit possible for her and her family’s well being, and to grow the pig raising project. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy feeds and vitamins so that her pigs are a better weight when she sells them.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Turwanyubukene Group

texts.fr:
Aboubakar fait partie du groupe Turwanyubukene. Le nom du groupe signifie « Lutter contre la pauvreté ». Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 4 à 7 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. 

Aboubakar est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de champs à cultiver  afin de récolter beaucoup plus. Dans les prochaines années, Aboubakar voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aboubakar is a member of Turwanyubukene Group, whose name means "Fight agains poverty". He's 28 years old, married, and has two children, age 4 and 7. Both attend school.

Aboubakar is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, in order to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growth is to expand his cultivated area, in order to harvest much more. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be among the best rice cultivators in his region. With his profits, he intends to provide education to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hard-working entrepreneur who sells personal products in the Philippines. Daisy has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase items like body lotion and perfumes to sell to customers.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to buy a fishing boat in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items like body lotion and perfumes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Pedro Jr.

texts.en:
Pedro is 47 years old and is married. He has had a business selling hogs for 2 years. He has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional feed for the hogs intended for sale.

Pedro has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for hogs intended for sale

loans.name: Miwononvi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIWONONVI  est formé de deux personnes qui cohabitent au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mariam, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mariam est âgée de 36 ans et est  marié à un frigoriste du nom de Marcel. Mariam a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à sa charge. Mariam vit avec son mari et ses enfants. le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Mariam a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis cinq ans, Mariam exerce comme activité, la fabrication de pure water par le système de livraison à domicile, et de façon secondaire, la  vente de l’eau de pompe. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Mariam désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Mariam sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIWONONVI, un quatrième crédit auprès de  ALIDé.
texts.en: The Miwononvi group is made up of two people who both live in Bénin.  The representative of the group, named Mariam, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the fourth time that this group has requested financial help through ALIDé in order to grow their business.  Mariam is 36 years old and is married to a refrigeration specialist name Marcel.  Mariam has four children. All have been educated and two are still in her care.  Mariam lives with her husband and children.  Together, the couple meets their different needs.  Mariam left school at the primary level. She has been making and delivering pure water to people’s homes for five years.  She also sells water from the pump.  This allows her to meet the needs of her family without too much difficulty.  In order to meet the demands of her customers, Mariam wants to increase her stock of products and to raise the level of her business.  To do this, Mariam is requesting, along with the other member of the Miwononvi group, a fourth loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy containers for pure water.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Adelfa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Adelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van (in the photo) and her husband live in a village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The son is married and lives outside the family home and the daughter is a garment worker. 

Van and her husband operate a business renting a space of their house to garment factory workers. Van is in the business of building two more rooms to rent, but lacks some money to pay for building fees, hence she is asking for her first loan of $500. She will use the loan to pay for her house building fees.

loans.use: to pay for her house building fees.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is 52 years old, and is married with two children. He is from Cavinte, Ozamis City. 

Narciso has been farming for 20 years and he earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month.

In 2011, Narciso joined GDMPC for the ability to engage in business activities and to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation. Narciso is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 35-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for three years.
Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita owns a retail business in the village where she lives. She has been operating this business for ten years. She started selling small quantities of shampoo, coffee and milk, but now she has increased the range of items in her store. She is proud that with the income earned from the business, she has provided for the daily needs of her children. All three of her children have now earned a degree. 
Merlita still aims to make improvements in her sales so she is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy eggs, canned goods, soft drinks and detergents to sell. She hopes to develop the business so that, someday, it will grow into a mini-grocery store.

loans.use: to buy eggs, canned goods, soft drinks and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old and a single mother of three children.  She has been selling cereals for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Esther will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for her stock.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men, 56, is a humble farmer who grows some crops like rice, potatoes and watermelons. She is from the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She manages this business with a great help from her husband who always assists her in the project. Currently, Mrs. Men has been blessed with eight children: five children are married; two among the three single children continue studying and work in Phnom Penh city. Due to the lack of a vehicle, they have some difficulties in traveling to school and workplaces. To solve the problem, Mrs. Men, a loving mother, is applying for a loan from HKL to purchase a motorcycle for the two children who are in need. In the future, Mrs. Men aims to expand her farmland and grows many kinds of crops, which earns her a good income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the two children who are in need.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 38 años de edad es soletero con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 4 y 14 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío las minas.
Antonia para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia  es comerciante desde hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la plaza de su comunidad. Antonia con el afán de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ha decidido  solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una cuerda de terreno para cultivo, ella quiere aprovechar esta gran oportunidad para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de una cuerda de terreno para cultivo.

loans.name: Sayavush

texts.en:
Sayavush is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He likes to busy with this business. 
Having borrowed the loan of $400 he bought the welding apparat. He started his business 4 years ago.
This 46-year-old Sayavush is married, has 4 children,   Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region Nadjafli village, settled with his family in Khirdalan settlement.
He has not the welding shop. He has been engaged in this business  in his own yard .
He always is  enjoying to busy with this business.

loans.use: To build the welding shop

loans.name: No

texts.en: Mrs No is 81 years old. Now she lives with 2 her sons. The oldest son is 38 years old and the other is 31 years old. Both of them are day laborers but are often without work. They don’t have enough money to support their mother so she has to work as well. She has 2,000 square meters of rice land. The income from this small land is not enough for her so she does a small food business. She needs US$ 25 for this business.

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia was born in 1947. She is a widow with five children. What stands out as a challenge for her right now is the poor health of her daughter and grandson. She has also had to overcome the deaths of her son and her son-in-law.

She has received GHAPE Empowerment Credit eight times previously and has repaid each loan. She needs this new loan to repair a house which she rents to tenants. She knows her business will succeed because she already has prospective tenants and the house is at the centre of a very busy town. She will use the money from her business to buy medication for her children and pay school fees for them.

loans.use: For house repairs to prepare the house for tenants

loans.name: Helene

texts.en: O. Helene is a dynamic 52-year-old widow. She has 6 children and lives with her family in Port-Bouët, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. She has been selling used clothes for years and is proud of having been able to pay tuition and school fees for her children. Helene's youngest daughter will enroll in grammar school in September so she needs to increase her income in order to handle the increased household and education expenses. She wants to increase the volume of her business and she would like to be a used clothes wholesaler in order to improve her profit margin. Helene is honest and has reimbursed all her previous loans in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothes

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
Olga is a single woman, very hardworking and a fast learner. She was dismissed from her previous work and had to find a way to continue forward with her costs. She observed that there were not many shops in her area, so with the money from her dismissal, she opened her general store four years ago. She started by selling tinware, and later added everyday groceries, little by little growing the business and incorporating a refrigerator to sell soft drinks, milk, juices, etc. Most recently she has added sweets, fried snacks and bread. She hopes to continue growing her business.

Olga is requesting a loan of $1200 to stock her business with many products not sold in her area, to better serve her customers. She is offering to pay back the loan in 6 months. Olga very much appreciates your support in helping her grow her business.

Olga es una mujer soltera muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella fue despedida de su trabajo anterior y tuvo que ver la manera de salir adelante con sus gastos y manutención por lo que viendo opciones de negocios pudo observar que por su colonia no habían muchas tiendas y con parte de su liquidación empezó su negocio de abarrotes, esto fue ya hace cuatro años atrás y empezó vendiendo latería, y luego le agrego abarrotes principales, y poco a poco fue creciendo incorporándole un refrigerador para la venta de refrescos, leche, jugos, etc. Y últimamente puso los exhibidores de venta de dulces, frituras y pan. Ella desea continuar creciendo con su negocio.

Olga esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 1,200 para surtir su negocio con muchos productos que hacen falta que vendan por su colonia y así poder satisfacer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo para ayudarla a salir adelante con su negocio y crecer aún más con el mismo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Mrs. Kate E. is from Edo state.  She is 40 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns a store where she sells kitchen utensils.  She has been in this business since 2004 and has been a LAPO member for the past 4 years.  She is requesting a loan of $625 to buy more kitchen utensils to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina S., 26, and her husband, Mr. Chhum Keo, 32, have been married since 2001. They have three sons, one of whom is attending the first year of primary school. Sina and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sina has been a silk weaver since she was 13 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband learned to weave silk from her in 2003 and started weaving silk in the same year. Now, he is a good silk weaver.

Sina is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $350. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her husband’s loom.

loans.use: To buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Kabowa 2(D) Group

texts.en:
The group of four women has been together for one year. Nulu is 44 years old and married with seven children. She has a poultry farm, and will use her portion of the loan to buy baby chicks to raise. When they are grown, she will sell them and use the money to buy a piece of land. Christine sells charcoal, Allen is a poultry farmer and Zaina runs a retail shop. They all need new inventory to sell to their customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and other items to sell

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.en:
Patrocinio E. is a 43 year old father of three school age children. He is married to his wife Zulma and together they own a small convenience store. Zulma runs the store while Patrocinio is working at a public institution close by.

Patrocinio"s hope is that they will be able to increase the business in their store and that the savings between he and his wife will be enough to send his children to the university. With this loan, Patrocinio will purchase popular items that are in constant demand in his shop.

loans.use: To buy food goods for his convenience store including oil, milk, cookies, soda and sugar.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 34 years old and is a married woman with four children, ages 12-14 years. Amina owns a small shop, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 6:30 AM to 10 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Giovana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Señora Giovanna del Pilar P. I. is a member of the community bank "Alfonso Ugarte." She lives in the region of San Martín in the province of San Martín in the district of Tarapato. Her home is located at Jr. Jiménez Pimentel Nº 501, where she serves menú (a set meal of the day) every day.

The loans from Manuela have allowed her to improve her business, and now her clients have increased to the point where she needs to improve it further.

With the loan for 500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy pans and pots and plates, so that she can offer a greater variety on her menu due to the demand of her clients.

Señora Giovanna is 24 years old. She doesn't have any kids yet, and her husband works from home at another business, and with the help of her mother-in-law, she attends to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Giovanna del Pilar P. I. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Jiménez Pimentel Nº 501 donde también vende menú todos los días.

Los préstamos de Manuela le han permitido implementar mejor su negocio,ya que sus clientes han aumentado últimamente para lo cual necesitaba implementarse más.

Con el crédito por S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ollas, cubiertos y platos que le permitirán ofertar variedad de menú ante la exigencia de su clientela.

La señora Giovanna tiene 24 años, no tiene hijos aún y su esposo trabaja en forma dependiente fuera del hogar y con la ayuda de su suegra atiende el negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy pots and pans, lids, and plates for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma belongs to Las Orquideas Community Bank, located in Jr. Huaraz 160, in the Calleria District, in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 32 year-old mother of 2. Her husband is a woodworker. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to create a small general store.

Now the store is moving forward, helping with the costs of her family and her small children who depend on her. Norma gets up very early to take care of them and take them to school, and from there, attend to her business.

With this loan of $750, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, milk, canned goods, noodles, bread, vegetables, soap, oil, etc.

Norma is happy to be working with Manuela Ramos because it is a help to enterprising and determined women like her.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr. Huaraz 160, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es estibador de madera. Norma con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad con su bodega esta saliendo adelante, ayudando en la economía de su familia, sus hijos aun son pequeños y necesitan mucho de ella, Norma se levanta muy temprano para atenderlos y llevarlos a su escuela y de ahí atender su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar. Leche, conservas, fideos, panes, verduras, jabón, aceite, etc.

Norma se siente muy contenta trabajando con Manuela Ramos por que es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que son emprendedoras y decididas como ella.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Islombek

texts.ru:
Islombek sells women's clothing. He is 27 years old and he has two children. His wife is helping him with the business. He has been a client of MicroInvest for the last six months. He plans to use the loan to increase the variety of new types of summer clothes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Исломбек занимается продажей женской одежды. Ему 27 лет, у него 2 детей, в бизнесе помогает его жена. С Микроинвест сотрудничает полгода. Новый займ собирается потратить на увеличение ассортимента новых видов летней одежды.

loans.use: To increase merchandise variety

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San S., 44, is vegetable seller in the market and earns about $2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Dan Dun, is a fisherman and earns about $1.50 per day. The couple has five children, one of whom is married. One of her other children is a bricklayer, and the other three are in primary school. They all live Rokar Thom Village, Kampong Cham Province.

Because of her interest in growing her business, Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use to transport her vegetables and for her husband to use as a motorcycle taxi. The motorcycle will allow her to run her business more efficiently, and also allow her husband to make more money with an additional job as a motorcycle-taxi driver. The motorcycle can also be used for family purposes.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use to transport her vegetables and for her husband to use as a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en: Yegana is a mother of one child. She was born in 1984. Yegana is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. She has settled in the town of Khirdalan. She started this business four years ago. Now she needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa, tiene 47 años, es madre soltera, estudió hasta 3er año de secundaria, después estudió corte y confección durante 06 meses en el Instituto Elizabeth Harden en la ciudad de Trujillo, no continuó estudiando porque tenía que cuidar a sus hijas porque eran muy pequeñas, tiene 03 hijos, 02 están casadas y 01 estudia en el colegio, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.

Para ayudarse económicamente empezó hace 15 años, en el negocio de venta de cocinas eléctricas en Tacora, ahora se dedica a vender abarrotes en su casa, en las tardes vende mazamorra, a veces no vende porque tiene que lavar ropa a particulares, además cose sabanas para un hotel. Tiene 01 año trabajando con Manuela Ramos, una amiga la invitó a participar en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO II” ella decidió participar en este Banco porque quería implementar el negocio y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró mantequilla, galletas, arroz, azúcar, 01 vitrina para colocar la mazamorra, etc.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1200 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertirlo en la compra de 01 andamio, 01 balanza, leche, papel higiénico, ace, cocoa, aceite.

La socia sueña con tener un minimarket, ya que toda la ganancia la invierte en el negocio, ayudar a su hija para que termine de estudiar y sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is a 47 year old single mother. She studied through her 3rd year of high school and afterwards studied fashion and clothing production for 6 months in the Elizabeth Harden Institute in Trujillo, Peru. She could not finish studying because she had to take care of her daughters while they were small. She has three children: two are married and one is still in high school. She lives in the city of Trujillo, in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. To improve her economic situation, fifteen years ago she started a business selling electric stoves in Tacora. Now she sells groceries in her home; in the afternoons she sells mazamorra (a local dessert); however, sometimes she does not have time to sell her mazamorra because she has to wash clothing for neighbors. She also works by sewing sheets for a hotel. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos institution for a year after a friend invited her to participate in the Successful Women II village bank. She decided to participate in the bank because she wanted to grow her business, and with her first loan of $175, she purchased butter, cookies, rice, sugar, and one display case where she could show her mazamorra. With this $400 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she would like to invest in the purchase of one display case, one scale, milk, toilet paper, cleaning supplies, cocoa, and vegetable oil. She dreams of having a “minimarket,” since all the money she earns through her business helps her daughter to finish studying so she can become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purhcase of a display case, a scale, and various groceries

loans.name: Israyil

texts.en: Israyil M. is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. Israyil raises and sells cattle. He purchases calves in the central market, feeds and cares for them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Israyil has been in this business for nine years, thanks to his father who was a farmer and taught him a lot. He is an expert in choosing and caring for the animals. He gets up at five o'clock every morning to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful, but his family is still quite poor because of the high prices that they have to pay for everything. He applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase four calves. You could become an important part of his family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: 310400028 Group

texts.es: El Bancomunal Santa Lucia esta ubicado en Huancavelica, en el distrito de Yauli, comunidad de Ambato en este lugar se encuentran abundantes árboles de Pino, de Eucalipto y plantas de quinua, se caracteriza con el sapo de piedra (qampato) con sus mitos y cuentos, desde su fundación es una zona muy acogedora a pesar de ser un pequeño pueblo. Las actividades principales de la comunidad son la ganadería, aquí encontramos vacas, caballos, ovejas existe una zona amplia para la crianza de estos animales, en la agricultura se siembra en parcelas, se produce en forma natural la papa nativa, en el comercio las mujeres se dedican a tejer medias, chullos, gorros, chalinas, etc.n nIsidora Q., esta casada, tiene 8 hijos, se dedica a tejer, compra y vende tejidos ya hechos. Las mayor dificultad que ella ha pasado es que se apropiaron de su terreno y esas personas la apedrearon sufriendo muchos golpes y cayendo enferma. Su vida cambio, en FINCA Perú aprendió a hacer solidaria, ahorradora, puntual en sus pagos, agradece a FINCA por que le prestaron con facilidad 400 nuevos soles y  confiaron en ella, por eso la eligieron Presidenta de su bancomunal. Ella se dedica a comprar mercadería y llevar a otros lugares para hacer trueque, ella da carne por tejidos. El sueño de Isidora es que no le falte comida para cada día, y tener mas ganado ente vaca y ovinosnnSabina B., esta casada con tres hijos de 3 meses, 6 años y 12 años. Su negocio es ser tejedora con lana de alpaca, Sabina hace gorros chalinas, medias, ahora compra mas lanas para pedidos que le realizan las empresas pequeñas  de su pueblo. En su bancomunal se siente en familia, le gusta por que se preocupan por que le vaya bien, ella es muy cumplidora de los reglamentos, ha aprendido ahorrar, tiene muchas amigas. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda llena de mercadería nnSonia C., esta casada, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 9 y 12 años, se dedica a tejer a crochet y a palito, realiza pompones para fajas, fustanes. Ha aprendido a ahorrar, a ser líder participativa quiere muchísimo a su bancomunal. El préstamo que le hizo FINCA lo va invertir en comprar más lanas por fardo, realiza al día 30 pompones y al mes 900 pompones. Su sueño es comprar maquinas de coser y 2  remalladoras y para eso trabajará mucho hasta lograrlo.n
texts.en:
El Bancomunal Santa Lucia is located in Huancavelica, in the district of Yauli, Ambato. In this area, you can find an abundance of pine trees, eucalyptus trees and quinua plants. The region identifies itself with the stone frog, qampato, and its myths and stories. Since its foundation, the area has been very welcoming, despite being a small town. The main activity of the town is cattle farming. Here, you can find cows, horses and sheep living in open spaces suitable for the breeding of such animals. Farmers plant crops in tracts and grow a natural form of a native potato species. Women involved in businesses knit and weave socks, chullos (a type of hat), caps, shawls, etc.

Isidora Q. is married and has 8 children. She is a weaver and buys and sells cloth. The most difficult challenge she has faced is when her land was taken over. The people who took her land threw rocks at her and she was hit many times and became sick. Her life changed. With FINCA Peru, she learned solidarity, to become a saver and be punctual in her payments. She is grateful to FINCA because they lent her 400 nuevos soles without difficulty and trusted her. For this reason, they elected her to be President of the village bank. She purchases merchandise and brings it to other places to barter, exchanging meat for cloth. Isidora's dream is to have enough food to eat everyday and have more livestock, mostly cows and sheep.

Sabina B. is married with three children who are 3 months, 6 years old and 12 years old. She has a business, working as a weaver of alpaca wool. Sabina makes caps, shawls and socks. Now she buys more wool for the orders she receives from small businesses in her town. In the village bank, she feels like she is with family. She likes the bank because they concern themselves about how she is doing. She follows the rules closely, has learned how to save and has many friends. Her dream is to have her own store, full of merchandise.

Sonia C. is married and has 3 children who are 5, 9 and 12 years old. She crochets and knits, making pompom decorations for belts and skirts. She has learned how to save and be a participatory leader. She loves the bank very much. She is going to invest the loan that FINCA gave her in the purchase of more bundles of wool. She plans to make 30 pompoms a day and 900 per month. Her dream is to buy sewing machines and two mending machines. She will work until her dream comes true.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El Bancomunal Santa Lucia requests a loan of $2125 so the 11 partners can invest in their businesses

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La señora Juanita, socia del Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños. Vende de manera ambulatoria, recorre los pueblos cercanos, así como a vecinos, amigos y familiares.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará ropa para damas como polos, blusas, pantalones, ropa para niños y niñas, de esa manera podrá atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes quienes son la razón de su negocio, además quiere aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.

Juanita tiene 35 años de edad, vive con sus 03 hijos aún pequeños y con su esposo quien la apoya en su negocio. Su esposo también sale a recorrer los pueblos en busca de nuevos clientes. Su meta es contar con un puesto en el  mercado para que no tenga que estar viajando seguido y poder cuidar mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Juanita S., a member of the “La Mujer Riojana” (The Woman from Rioja) microfinance institute, lives in the San Martín department of the province and district of Rioja. She sells clothing for men, women and children for a living. She works as a street vendor, traveling to the nearby towns, but she also sells merchandise to her family, friends and neighbors.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase women’s apparel, such as t-shirts, blouses, pants, as well as children’ apparel, that way, she can fill the orders made by her customers, who are the reason why she is in business in the first place. She also wants to take advantage of the year-end festivities.

Juanita is 35 years old and lives with her 3 young children and her husband, who supports her with the business. Her husband also goes to different towns in search of new customers.
