Her goal is to have her own booth in the market so that she will no longer have to keep walking around, and so that she can take better care of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase t-shirts, blouses, pants, and clothing for boys and girls

loans.name: Saleeman Allah Yar Muhammad Group

texts.en:
My name is Saleeman and I am 46 years old and have been married since I was 16. I belong to a city named Vehari, Pakistan. My husband's name is A. Y. M., and he works in a factory. I have one son, Talib. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). I am a housewife and I make embroidered dresses to earn money. It takes 10 days to complete a heavily embroidered dress which I sell in the market for $3. I am requesting a loan to buy auto-rickshaw for my son so he doesn't have to pay for renting one and can increase his income. 

There are 3 other members in my loan group: Zahooran baji requests a loan to buy inventory for her grocery shop. Ramzana baji requests a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Shamshad baji requests a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Mrs. Roeun Saing Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Chreaek village in Kampong Cham province make up this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Roeun S., the 38- year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a fisherman. In her business, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy nets for fishing. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Roeun S. is a widow with six children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Thirteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy nets for fishing

loans.name: Opeyemi

texts.en: Opeyemi O. produces and sells notebooks and he also prints textbooks. He started this business in 1995. He hopes to expand this business and needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more printing materials. Opeyemi is 38 years old and married with 3 children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is a LAPO client and says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for printing and production of notebooks

loans.name: Ehrom

texts.en:
Ehrom M. is 25 years old and married. He lives in Istaravshan and is engaged in commercial service. Ehrom trades in small-wares, like enlargers, pins, and plastic packages. He has been in this business for six years. An increase in business turnover helped him to repay a previous loan and take the next loan step.

Ehrom asks KIVA for the financial support of a business development loan for 1600 STJ for six months. He will use the loan for the trade outlet opening in the crowed local bazaar. The loan will help him increase his business turnover and import more and different wares from China.

loans.use: To use for a trade outlet opening.

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en:
Visiting Chinyere, it was discovered that her place of business is one of the most attractive drinking spot in her locality.

Chinyere prepares pepper soup and cooked food along with drinks in her shop. She was able to distinguish herself from her competitors. Chinyere is 41 years old and married with four children.

Chinyere has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years, and this little loan has tremendously increased her business and her profitability. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuff and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuff and drinks to sell

loans.name: Zarghona Group

texts.en:
Zarghona is the group leader of Zarghona group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for her/his own business.

Zarghona wants to take out a loan to buy necessary materials for her embroidery business. Jawed wants to take out a loan to buy new videos for his video shop business. Dar M. wants to take out a loan to advance and expand his business as a butcher. Mahra gull wants to take out a loan to buy two new machines for her tailoring business.
They are very happy that these loans are available to help poor people in Afghanistan and they thank all those who loan through AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To expand and advance their businesses.

loans.name: Memunat

texts.en: Memunat sells tubers (yams). The demands for her yams is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (US$ 975) to purchase more yams to sell. Memunat is 47 years old, a widow and she has five children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell.

loans.name: An

texts.en: An M., 27, raises pigs in a stall next to her house. She also grows vegetables, such as cabbage, morning glory and cucumbers, and sells them to a market-seller three months after they mature. She is married to Sothea, who is 35 and works as a motorbike taxi driver. The couple is responsible for three young children. An M. recently sold all her pigs to a slaughterer. She hopes to acquire another pig to raise. Therefore, she would like to ask for a $300 loan to buy more piglets to raise and more fertilizers to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno.  Ella tiene 45 años D. edad es casada y es madre D. 06 hijos, tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (2do grado), y vive en el Barrio  Río D. la plata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desD. hace 5 o 6 años.  Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo usó para la compra D. ovejas 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, la comprar y venta ganado para engorD. (ovinos), paralelamente se dedica a la compra-venta D. sogas D. polietileno (plásticos).

Su mayor sueño es continuar trabajando. A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anastacia belongs to the “Vista Alegre” community bank located in the Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chucuito Province, Puno Region. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She has not completed primary school (2nd graD.). She lives in the Río D. la Plata neighborhood.

She has worked with the Manuela R. movement for 5 or 6 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN. She used it to buy sheep.

At this time she needs a loan of 3000.00 PEN to invest in her current business, buying and selling livestock for fattening (sheep). She works in parallel buying and selling polyethylene cords (plastics).

Her biggest dream is to continue working. She likes the savings and the meetings of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep and bags of polyethylene (plastic).

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn G. is from the city of Oroquieta City. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns and operates a dressmaking tailoring business. Her main source of income comes by providing general alteration and tailoring services. Arlyn has been engaged in business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve ther family's general living conditions. ---------------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 52 years old, and she is married with four children. Three are adults and the last born is schooling. She is living with her husband in a family house at Sefwi in the Western region of Ghana. She is supportive, determined and above all very hard-working, despite her age.

She is a petty trader who trades in cereals such as bags of maize, beans, groundnuts etc. She takes delivery of stock from Tamale in the northern region of Ghana and sometimes she takes stock from the surrounding villages.

Her kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling of foodstuffs has enabled her to rent a store in the market place where she distributes to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buys more bags of maize, beans, and groundnuts to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her last child's education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies of maize

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Mrs. Fely T. is a 62-year-old woman and the mother of five children ages 17 to 28 years old. She has been happy with her life since she married Francisco, despite the poor kind of living they had then. Fely and her husband lack the education that is required to be employed. Therefore, they have used their own skills to earn money for their children and to survive. 

Francisco is a farmer who doesn't have his own land to farm. Other people in their village hire him during the rice planting and harvest season. His service fee is not enough to meet the expenses of his five children. In addition to being a mother, Fely had the courage to start her own small business to augment her husband's income. She has the skill to raise livestock in their wide and verdant backyard. However, because her business income was not enough to meet her family's expenses, she could not use it as business capital and there was no microfinance institution in their village that would trust her with a loan.

In 2005, Fely joined a group of poor women who share the same aspiration in life -- to bring their families out of poverty. With other four women, she received a loan from ASHI. From then on, Fely's business had direction and was sustained. After a series of loans from ASHI, she noticed improvements in her family's life. With her previous loan, she bought a calf and two piglets. Those piglets are already sold, and she now wants to buy more piglets to replace them, so she is applying for another loan. 

Fely has never wanted anything else in her life as a mother other than to give her children a better future by sending them to school through college. However, she failed with her four eldest children, because some of them married at an early age and others stopped going to school and worked instead. Fely's last hope is youngest child who is in the third year of high school and will soon be in college, and, also, her grandchildren.

loans.use: Buying piglets to raise in her backyard and sell after four months.

loans.name: Adeshola

texts.en: Adeshola is 30 years old, married with four children and runs a shop where she sells cooked food as well as raw foodstuffs. She opened her own shop after joining LAPO two years ago, prior to which hawked cooked food from place to place but could sell only what she could carry. Adeshola hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lizbeth Jesenia

texts.es:
Lizbeth es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Lizbeth es conviviente y tiene 19 años, Lizbeth junto a su pareja se dedican a la venta de cebiche de manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza todos los días, además su esposo vende filtros de carro en las ciudades de la selva ayacuchana.
Lizbeth necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de filtros de aceite.
Los sueños de Lizbeth son tener un local estable y estudiar contabilidad.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a member of the Comunal Nova Era Bank. She is 19 years old and lives with her partner. They make a living by walking around the streets selling ceviche, an activity that they perform on a daily basis. In the top of that, her partner sells car oil filters in the neighboring cities of Ayacucho, Peru. Lizbeth needs a $1025 loan that she will use to buy oil filters. Lizbeth dreams of having a stable home and to go to school for Accounting.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil filters

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of Brgy. 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Marilou is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living Marilou owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the business’s main income comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Marilou has had her business for over five years and earns approximately PHP3,500 a month.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of PHP5000, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es: Es un grupo  muy responsable en sus pagos, viven en un mismo Barrio, donde se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "BELEN ", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 2º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada por socias que son estrictas en su cobranza, son muy unidas entre ellas,  como presidenta esta  la señora Claudia C. M., ella es lider de su grupo, vende artesania  en las ferias zonales y fiestas Patronales  , vive en casa familiar tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como  cerrajero  de manera independiente. Como tesorera esta la socia Maria del Carmen T. G. , muy responsable y  sociable. Esta casada y tiene 2 hijos.  vende papel higenico ambulando ,  el credito lo utiliza para  aumento de capital . Como secretaria esta la socia Eliana Elvia S. quien es una socia joven, es  soltera , tiene tienda de barrio el cual esta surtida y el crèdito solicito para aumentar mercaderìa, ella ayuda a sus  padres.
texts.en:
It is a group that is very responsible with their payments. They live in the same neighborhood where they know each other well. The group is called “Belen”, and this communal bank is in its second cycle. The board of directors is comprised of members who are strict about their collection. They are very united. Claudia C. M. is the president and leader of the group. She sells handicrafts in the regional fairs and on national holidays. She lives in the family house, and she has two children. Her husband works independently as a locksmith. Maria del Carmen T. G., the treasurer, is very responsible and sociable. She is married and has two children. She is a street vendor, and she sells toilet paper. The loan is to increase capital. Eliana Elvia S., the secretary, is a young, single member. She has a neighborhood store, which has various items. The loan is to increase merchandise. She helps her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia Y. is from the village of NHA, Balulang Cagayan De Oro City. She is 55 years old. Lydia is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "Personal Collection" brand products in the local community. Lydia is just starting her business.

In 2009, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from HSPFI. Lydia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: NHA, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Franz

texts.es:
Franz tiene 33 años, vive con sus padres, su pareja y madre de su hija, en su casa propia. Él tiene un motocarro, del cual es propietario y trabaja con él durante todo el día transportando personas por los diferentes lugares de su ciudad. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 10 años atrás. Por otro lado, también aprovecha las oportunidades de trabajo en compañías petroleras que lo contratan como obrero, y en la mayoría de veces tiene que viajar a otros lugares lejos de su hogar.
Lo que más le gusta a Franz de su actividad como transportista es brindar seguridad a sus clientes y que los mismos se sientan tranquilos cuando él los lleva. Además, este negocio le es rentable porque ya tiene clientes regulares quienes lo contratan para que los transporte a sus centros de trabajo. 
Posteriormente, Franz quiere comprar otro motocarro y así brindar oportunidad de trabajo (como  chofer) a quien lo necesite. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que ha notado que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y confiables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Franz is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his partner, who is the mother of their daughter. His parents also live with them. He owns a motorcycle taxi and works during the day transporting people to different places within the city. Franz has been in this business for the past 10 years. In addition, he also takes advantage of opportunities from petroleum companies who hire him as a laborer. Franz usually has to travel far from home for these jobs.

What Franz enjoys about being a motorcycle taxi driver is providing a safe environment for his customers since they feel relaxed around him. He feels his business is profitable because he has a regular clientele who hire him in order to travel to work each day. In the future, Franz would like to buy another motorcycle taxi so that he can provide employment to another driver in need of work.

This is his first loan with MFP. Franz enjoys working with his Communal Bank because all the members are responsible and reliable. He will use the money he requested to buy spare parts so that he can repair his motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 55-year-old woman who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with her husband and their child. Wafaa has been operating a grocery store since 1998. She sells candies, chips, canned food, home cleaning products, and lots more. Wafaa requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Wafaa has been a microcredit client for nine years now and has always paid on time.

Wafaa is special in her work because she is an active woman; she does three jobs at the same time in order to improve her family’s income. She has to take care of her grocery store, and she also has an olive plantation and works as a housekeeper. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties since she had saved money in order to open her store. In the future, she plans to keep improving her store and consequently her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois sells colorful sarongs at the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. Nigeria is a beautiful country that is endowed with natural vegetation. 

Lois is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Lois is married with four children and she is 37 years old. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. This is the high season for sales, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta L. is from the village of Danao. She is 50 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Modesta owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Modesta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Modesta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Dorcas Adhiambo

texts.en: Dorcas Adhiambo O. is a boutique owner. She started her business back in 1995, having graduated from high school a few years earlier and without funds to go to college. She started the business as a means of self-employment and also as a gesture, back then, that women, too, can do business in a male-dominated environment. She is now a widow and a mother of two children. She would like a loan of 50,000 KES, which will go towards increasing the stock in her boutique.

loans.use: To increase the stock in her boutique

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary M. is 54 years old and she lives in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Ros Sim, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate both rice and vegetables. For rice farming, they own a water machine to support their crop field. They face some problems because their field contains infertile soil and has a lot of insects. Thus, Mrs. Sary M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy gasoline to pump water to support the field. Mrs. Sary M. is a mother of two children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, and the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa L., tiene la edad de 62 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es una mujer muy luchadora desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a su pulpería, ya que esta inicio con sus propios esfuerzos y a la vez a  incrementado su inventario gracias al apoyo de Afodenic, atravez de los fondos Kiva, que apoyan al pequeños negocios con intereses bajos y facilidades de pagos según sus posibilidades, doña Teresa tiene tres hijos ya todos casados e independientes, la mayor dificultad que se  le presenta son alzas de la canasta básicas que poco a poco disminuye su consumo por la crisis que enfrenta el país, los planes futuros para su negocio es poder abastecer todos las necesidades de sus clientes para que compre de una solo vez todo y no vayan a otra pulpería. Agradece a la institución por la aprobación de su onceavo crédito el cual invertirá en diversos productos para el consumo del hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa L., 62, lives in Ticuantepe. She is a tenacious woman who has run a grocery store for some time now. She started off by investing her own savings. With loans from Afodenic and Kiva, that support small businesses with low interest and easy payments, she has managed to increase her inventory. Teresa has three children, all of whom are married and independent. Her greatest difficulty is the rising cost of the canasta basica (basic items needed by a household for a month) which leads to people spending less and less every day due to the crisis the country is facing. Her future plans for her business is to be able to stock all that her customers need so that they can buy everything they need at the same time and not have to go to some other store. She is grateful to the institution for approving her 11th loan, which she will use to buy various products for home use.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Kwesitukira Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Escalanda is a friendly old lady and the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a businesswoman who has managed a bar in her home area for so long. She mostly sells local brew as well as beers and some sodas in order to make the necessary profits from her business. She is also a farmer growing crops both for sale and for home consumption and this enables her to earn more.

All of Escalanda’s children are old and working and she helps to take care of her grandchildren, some of whom are orphans. This is the main reason why she gets loans in order to be able to earn funds for financing her dependents’ education.

Escalanda needs a loan to be able to buy more brew for resale, although some of it she makes herself.

loans.use: To buy more brew for resale and materials for making the brew herself

loans.name: Rosario Maribel

texts.es:
Rosario Rodríguez de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su vivienda es de concreto y solo tiene agua y luz en su casa. Su esposo es maestro constructor ellos tienen 4 hijos de 20, 19, 10, 11 años.  

Rosario ya tiene un año con la papelería la comenzó debido a la falta de ingresos económicos en su casa. Aunque cuando inicio no tenía mucha variedad en la papelería ella continúo con el empuje de sus hijos mayores. 

Ahora ella tiene una pequeña papelería trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00, vende cuadernos, plumas, borradores etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, lápices, papeles para tener mucha mercadería ya que esta por comenzar la temporada escolar en Abril. En el futuro quiere tener una de las papelerías más grandes y así darles mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosario Rodríguez is 38 years old and lives in a peri-urban area in Fortín of Guayaquil. Her home is made of cement and only has water and electricity in her home. Her husband is a master builder and together they have 4 children of 20, 19, 10, and 11 years of age.

Rosario has had the stationery store for a year and started it because she needed more income for her home. When she began, she did not have a lot variety in the store but she continued with the encouragement that she received from her older children.

Now Rosario has a small stationery store and works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. and sells notebooks, pens, erasers, etc.

With the loan she wants to buy notebooks, pencils, and papers to have a lot of merchandize since the school season is about to begin in April. In the future she wants to have one of the biggest stationery stores so that she will be able to give her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pencils, and papers.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene 23 años, es casado y tiene una hija. Vive en un hermoso valle de la región Cuzco, en una localidad llamada “Quimbiri”, donde tienen una casa propia de material noble y madera.

Más importante que sólo ofrecer un servicio Roger tiene el objetivo claro de explotar sus conocimientos y progresar. Actualmente trabaja en la Municipalidad de su comunidad, específicamente en la reparación de maquinaria pesada. A él le fascina su trabajo, ya que se divierte mucho y por ende tiene grandes satisfacciones emocionales y monetarias, es por ello que sus planes a futuro son de abrir su propio taller mecánico y acondicionarlo con los equipos necesarios para la reparación de todo tipo de vehículos. Adicionalmente, junto a su esposa (con quien aparece en la foto) tiene un puesto de comida rápida (frituras) con cuyas ganancias también solventan los gastos familiares.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas de pago en las fechas establecidas, también menciona que se siente conforme con la transparencia y organización de sus banco comunal. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita invertirá en el negocio de venta de comida, comprando los ingredientes necesarios al por mayor, con el objetivo de incrementar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Roger, age 23, is married and has one daughter. He lives in a beautiful valley of the Cuzco region, in an area called “Quimbiri”. He has his own house built of solid material and wood.

Rather than simply offering a service, Roger has the clear goal of using his knowledge and progressing. Currently, he works in his community’s municipality repairing heavy machinery. His work fascinates him and he enjoys it a lot. As a consequence, he gets great emotional, as well as financial, satisfaction from it. That’s why his plans for the future are to open his own mechanical shop and furnish it with the equipment necessary to repair all types of vehicles.

In addition, together with his wife (who appears with him in the photo) he has a fast food stall selling fried snacks. The profits from this also contribute to the family’s upkeep.

This is his third loan with MFP. He promises to pay all his installments on time. He also mentioned that he feels good about the transparency and organization of his communal bank. This time, he will invest the money that he is applying for in the food selling business, buying necessary ingredients at wholesale, with the goal of increasing family income.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine R. is a single mother with three children: Godias Kipsaina and Brian Kiptoo, who are in secondary school, and Kiprono Godwin who is in primary school. She lives in Sarura about 8 km from Kaiboi Centre. She does dairy farming, sheep rearing and maize and bean farming. She sells her produce during market days in various places.  

Valentine was introduced to Kadet during a church forum for single mothers at the Kaiboi Catholic Church where staff members from Kadet were in attendance and marketed themselves. She has applied for a loan that she will use to buy four sheep for rearing, to prepare her five acres of land for maize planting, and improve her dairy farming in order to get high milk yields. She will save the rest for any emergencies.
 
Valentine is determined to open a retail shop selling fast-moving goods to support her children. The profit she anticipates to generate from this business will be channeled to her children’s education account. She is very optimistic that when she educates her children, they will be able to support her and improve their current status.

loans.use: To buy four sheep for rearing and to prepare her five acres of land for maize planting

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es la esposa del señor Alberto R. en ese momento se encontraba en su trabajo.
Esta familia esta agradecida con el apoyo brindado por esta institución ya que ha sido la forma por la que han podido ir extendiendo su casa, pues este crédito será el tercero. Ahora Alberto desea empastar la losa por que cuando la construyo le quedo muy delgada y en temporada de lluvia se trasmina el agua. El teme que todo lo que ha hecho con mucho esfuerzo se le deteriore. Es por ello que quiere un préstamo para poder realizar este proyecto para que su vivienda este en las mejores condiciones para ofrecerle a su familia confort y seguridad.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is Alberto R.’s wife; he was at work at that moment. This family is very grateful for the help they’ve gotten from the institution because they have been able to enlarge their home; this will be their third loan. Alberto would like to re-grout the tile because when he installed it it was too thin and when it rains water seeps in; he fears that everything he’s built with so much effort will deteriorate. He needs funds, therefore, to accomplish this project so that his home will be in the best possible conditions to offer his family comfort and security.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To re-grout tile.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Mr. Cesar Benitez, 30 years old, is single and lives with his parents in a neighborhood called Aguai`y in the city of Carapeguá. 

Coming from a humble family and having the desire to study and become a professional led Cesar to start his own small business.  He started selling clothes and shoes in the urban areas of his city and in no time he was able to earn more money, enabling him to buy more types of products to sell in the capital and to form a steady clientele. Thanks to his job and his efforts, he was able to buy a motorcycle, which he uses to complete his sales and to satisfy his clientele’s needs. 

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy hammocks, blankets, men’s belts (fajas) and sheets.

loans.use: to buy blankets, bedcovers, tablecloths and sheets

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 43 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Esteban de 55 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Lucia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Entre los productos que cultiva son café y sachainchi, productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado, en donde son llevados a vender al por mayor en el mercado de Pichanaki. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus campos agrícolas, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Pichanaki, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, hará limpiar su chacra y para ello contratará peones para que la ayuden a  limpiar y cultivar.
texts.en:
Lucia is 43 years old and a modest hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Esteban (age 55) and their four young children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. With great effort, Lucia strives to work her land so that she can generate productive returns. Among the crops she grows are coffee and “Sacha Inchi” (a plant indigenous to the Amazon which is used for making oil). These products are in high demand in the marketplace. Lucia transports her harvest to the market in Pichanaki to sell wholesale. She has been engaged in this activity for eight years and enjoys most taking care of her fields. However, she considers the most difficult part of her job to be transporting her products to Pichanaki since the sacks she has to carry are extremely heavy and cause her great fatigue. In the future, she wants to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her third loan with MFP. Lucia has been prompt in repaying her previous loans and hopes to do the same now. In her Communal Bank, she is an active participant and is always aware of the agreements that have been reached in her group. With the loan of 1000 PEN that she requested, Lucia will hire workers to help clear her land and prepare it for planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers to clear and prepare her farmland for planting

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora L. is from the town of Aurora. She is 40 years old. Flora is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Flora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Flora from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie M. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: pig-fattening, rice-retailing and farming. She lives in Purok 1, M. H. Del Pilar, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. Rosie has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig-fattening, rice-retailing and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 15,000. Rosie is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can buy more piglets and rice for her businesses. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 27,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rosie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and rice for her businesses

loans.name: Willian Rolando

texts.es:
Willian Rolando C. T. tiene 35 años. El estado civil es unión libre vive con la señora Elizabeth, tiene dos  hijos, Fabricio (9) y Mateo (2), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Willian  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Willian se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y piña. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de un terreno. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Willian Rolando C. T. is 35 years old. He lives with his partner, Elizabeth, and their 2 sons Fabricio, 9, and Mateo, 2. They live in the village of Chillanes, Bolívar province. William is a member of the rural community bank group Rey de Reyes (King of Kings), which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in all, most of whom are farmers. This will be the group's first loan from Cooperativa San José. William farms maize and pineapples. He buys his farming supplies in Bucay every month and also sells his harvest there. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds for the next planting season. This loan will be an opportunity for him to grow. His dream is to have money to buy land. A challenge he faces is the weather. William likes playing sports in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in seeds for next season.

loans.name: Luz Ayde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REAL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Luz Aide; ella tiene 41 años de edad y la socia es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades de la casa con el comercio minorista; La socia  se dedica a la venta de artículos ópticos y multiservicios en su tienda situada en el centro de la ciudad; ella tiene este negocio desde hace 11 años, La socia es padre y madre de sus hijos y los apoya en todo, ella manifiesta de que por mucha suerte el negocio le va muy bien por lo que esto le permite no pedir ayuda a quien fuese su pareja hace algunos años y que es padre de sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de este un pequeño capital de trabajo con esto ella comprará mayor número de artículos ópticos.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz Aide belongs to the “REAL” communal bank. She lives in the district of Santiago in the province and department of Cusco. Luz is 41 years old and is a single mother with 3 children. She alternates her household activities with retail. She makes a living selling eyewear and other services in her store, which is located in the center of the city. She has had this business for 11 years. Luz acts as both father and mother to her children and helps them with everything. She says that she has been very lucky with her business and it is going well. It means that she doesn’t have to ask for help from anyone, since the man who was her husband and father of her children left several years ago. Luz is asking for a loan so that she can have a little working capital, which she will use to purchase more eyewear. Luz values and appreciates the loan that is being offered, since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to complete her payments according to the terms of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for purchasing more eyewear

loans.name: Paulia

texts.en:
Paulia T. is 39 and married with six children (ages 3 - 19).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Paulia has 2 years of experience in this business.  Paulia needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

In 2008, Paulia joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Paulia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Mrs. Thong O. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband works on the field with her. Thong O. requests a loan to buy marble from from a nearby mountain quarry. She will turn the marble into statues to sell, which will allow her to improve her daily income.

loans.use: To buy marble to sell

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a uno de sus hijos en el caserío Rio Hondo del sector Sialupe Baca, una zona rural situada en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de movimiento comercial considerable ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Andrés se dedica a brindar transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte), el suele brindar este servicio dentro de la ciudad de Lambayeque y en el caserío donde reside. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, se dedica a la crianza y comercializacion de animales menores. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar los gastos de su familia.

Andrés desea brindar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil y reparar algunas fallas que se han presentado debido al continuo uso otorgado. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir progresando para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos. El da lo mejor de si para sacar a los suyos adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Andres is a 53 year old head of household who lives with his wife and one of his children in the town of Rio Hondo in the Sialupe Baca region. This is a rural area in the Lambayeque district which has a lot of commercial activity and is just outside the city of Chiclayo. Andres makes a living transporting good and people in his motorcycle taxi. He provides this service in Lambayeque and in his town. He also raises and sells small animals. He uses the income from these activities to help maintain his family. Andres hopes to maintain his motorcycle taxi and repair a few problems created by its constant use. To achieve this he has requested his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Nuevos Soles. His greatest wish is to keep growing to improve his loved ones quality of life. His gives his all to help his family. People who know him describe him as easy going and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina C. is from the village of Natappian West, Solana, Cagayan. She is 29 years old. Lina is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Lina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

Lina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. 

Lina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline O. is 27 years old, married to Wilfred Omollo, and they have two children, Quinter, four years old, and Brian Owino, one year old. They live in the Luanda area in Vihiga.

Caroline is a tailor and has been running her tailoring business for the past 10 years. Her clients mainly consist of people who live in her neighborhood and even school children as she makes school uniforms. She is applying for her 1st loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to us by a friend who is also a client. 

Her desire is to see her business expand and get many clients.

loans.use: Buy materials to add to her stock

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina J. is married to Kenneth Koech and they have eight children, all students below 18 years old. They live in Chemusoi area in the town of Kisumu where Regina has been running a cereals business for the past three years. With a good credit history she is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD in order to buy more maize to add to her stock.

Her family depends on her totally for upkeep and she is working very hard to ensure that there is food on the table each day. Her desire is to be able to raise the living standard of her family by ensuring that her business grows and her profits increase.

loans.use: To buy maize to add to her stock

loans.name: Tout

texts.en: Tout S., 48, a married mother of four children, grows mushrooms, making US$1 each day in Takeo Province.  Her husband works in construction, earning US$3 a day to help support the family. One of the children works in construction, and three are in school. Tout would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport mushrooms to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred S. is married to Violet Kavugwi and they have three children, 16, 13 and 12 years old. Fred has 8 years of experience in the construction industry. He is committed to giving powerful end results, making clients continue to build a lot of trust in his business. Fred is applying for his sixth loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans well and on time. To meet his customers' demand, he intends to buy construction materials for a contract. Fred was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. His future dream is to see his children realize their goals through better education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a contract

loans.name: John Wairitu

texts.en:
John is 47 years old and married to Lucy Njeri who is a farmer. They have two children. He runs a transport business in Thika town. He has been in the business for a period of 10 years with an income of Kshs.30,000  

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and John plans to top-up his savings and buy a new PSV vehicle (Matatu). He hopes to have a fleet of cars and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To top up his savings and buy a new PSV vehicle (Matatu)

loans.name: Raul Cesar

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chincheros.

His name is Raul and he is 33 years old.  Raul is married and has one daughter who is seven years old.   He is requesting the loan to invest in his taxi service.  He currently owns one taxi that he runs in Cusco, and wants the loan to purchase another car.  His business has recently improved because it is the rainy season and more people in Cusco are taking taxis.

Raul commits to making his payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in Taxi Service

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a single mother with two children. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop and also sells spirits and wines to supplement her family’s income. Being a single mother, Dorothy works hard in her business so that she can afford to educate her children. She also sells chicken when the demand is high, especially during the festival season.  

Since Dorothy joined Faulu Kenya, she has expanded her business by adding more stock. She is thankful to Faulu Kenya for funding her businesses. Dorothy is requesting another loan of 70,000 KES to buy stock such as beans, rice, and green grams (a legume crop).

loans.use: to buy beans, green grams, and rice

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single woman with four grown children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. School fees are her greatest monthly expense.

Grace has operated a grocery business for the past 8 years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Grace faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to establish more business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, Grace wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald T. is from the village of Sampaguita. He is 32 years old. Ronald is married. To make a living, Ronald owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ronald has been engaged in his business for over 17 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ronald joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronald has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ronald from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem is a married woman who has three children. Two of them are enrolled in local public school, but the youngest one is too small to work or study. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She sells part of her rice yield and the other part is used to support her family.  In spite of farming activities, she has a lot of free time, so she wants to start a new business. 

Mrs. Some would like to ask for a loan to buy four piglets and pig feed to start a new business. With any remainder of the loan, she is going to buy fertilizer.  Her husband, Mr. Poeun, is a traditional medicine seller. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Yrupe Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de independizarse creando sus propios negocios  y otras para emprender en actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinaron la reunión para comunicar sobre el programa que se ofrece, les pareció muy importante e interesante por los beneficios brindados por la Fundación Paraguaya.
El comité lleva por nombre Yrupe, todas son vecinas y parientes, actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 11 señoras, quienes se esmeran día a día para aumentar sus ingresos y  brindar lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
La Sra. Apolinaria es la presidenta del grupo, se dedica en venta de leche y queso. Desea invertir el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus vacas y el mejoramiento del tambo, ella está muy orgullosa por ser parte de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
In the town of Paraguari, a few women got together in order to obtain economic independence, some by establishing their own activities and others by embarking on profitable activities. They organized a meeting to talk about the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya, and they found the proposed benefits to be very important and interesting.
The group is called Yrupe, all the members are neighbors or relatives, and they are currently working their third cycle with an excellent result. The group is composed of 11 women who day by day do their best to increase their earnings and to offer all the best to their families.
Apolinaria is the president of the group. She engages in selling milk and cheese. She wants to invest the loan amount in the purchase of animal feed for her cows and to improve her dairy farm. She is really proud to be a member of Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her cows and to improve her dairy farm.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He has owned butcher shop since 1995. He offers his clients tasty fresh meat. His work income is vital to be able to take good care of his family. He has obtained two Kiva loans and was a reliable client with payments on time.
 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car for his job. In that way, it will be easier for him to buy meat from wholesalers located in different areas. He estimates that with the coming harvest, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his job.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 34 years old and married with one child.  Arsenia works very hard to provide for them.

Arsenia runs a sari-sari store -- a small variety store where she sells foodstuffs and household goods -- and has requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Kiva field partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell such as canned goods and other instant foods.  She has been in this business for three years.

In the future Arsenia would like to have enough money to be able to repair and renovate her home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as canned goods and other instant foods, to sell in a sari-sari store

loans.name: Jean Louis Robert

texts.fr: Jean Louis Robert M. est travailleur de la construction et elevateur des vaches  dans le secteur de Rubavu.  Il a 31 ans, il est marie, et il a 1 enfant de 2 ans, et aussi une personne en charge.  Il est ne au Rwanda, et il a fini ses « A levels » en école.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter de la toiture, des ciments, planches de rive, et payer la main d’œuvre pour bâtir une maison d’habitation pour sa famille.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de bâtir beaucoup d’autres maisons a louer pour augmenter sa revenu.  Il voudrait bâtir une belle maison pour sa famille alors ils peuvent avoir une meilleure habitation.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait assurer leur bien être.
texts.en: Jean Louis Robert M. is a construction worker and a cattle farmer in the area of Rubavu. He is 31 years old, married, with a 2-year old child and an additional dependent. He was born in Rwanda and has completed his A-levels at school [roughly equivalent to junior college]. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he is going to use his loan to buy roofing, cement, and beam planks as well as to pay the costs of labor  in order to have a house built for his family. His business strategy is to build many other houses and rent them out in order to increase his revenues. He would like to build a nice house for his family so that they can have better living conditions. He would like to ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy roofing, cement, and beam planks as well as to pay the costs of labor to have a house built for his family

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María  D. 52 años D. edad, tiene casa propia que vive con su esposo no tiene hijos, la cual no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito D. TambogranD. 40 minutos a proximadamente del departamento D. Piura.  Zona dedicada a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

María labora vendiendo gasolina en galoneras y botellas D. plástico para el uso D. unidades móviles pequeñas (motos lineales y mototaxis), ya que en estas zonas no existen los grifos,  esta actividad a la que se dedica es un negocio próspero donD. sus ingresos se han incrementado progresivamente, ésto le va permitir solventar todos sus gastos y necesidades D. su casa.  Otra actividad que realiza es la crianza y venta D. aves D. corral,que una vez que están ensu crecimeinto ideal los venD. en el mercado D. su distrito.

Por eso a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo D. Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. gasolina, para abastecer a su clientela que a ido aumentando y también para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales, sus ganacias van ayudar a que pueda pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. ella y la D. su esposo.
texts.en:
María, 52, lives in her own house with her husband.  She has no children.  The house does not have basic utilities and is located in the district of TambogranD., approximately 40 minutes from the department of Piura.  This area is involved in agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

María sells gas in gallon jugs and plastic bottles for small motor vehicles (motorcycles and mototaxis), since there are no pumps in these areas.  Her business is prosperous and income has increased progressively, enabling her to cover household expenses.  She also raises chickens and sells them at the district market.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more volume of gasoline to supply to her customers since demand has increased.  She also wants to buy balanced animal feed.  Her earnings will help pay back the loan and improve her and her husband's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline and balanced animal feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells fish. She is 35 years old and married with four children (three of them go to school). Alice requested a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 43, is a widow woman blessed with one child who has already married.

She is a domestic farmer who lives in the Prey Chor district. She has a plot of farm land that comes from her parents. She can plant crops at least twice a year, and her child helps her in the farming business. 

Heng would like to apply for a loan to purchase potato seeds for planting. Heng trusts that she will add more income after using the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como la subidita al cielo en el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen las socias  del Banco Comunal Subidita Al Cielo, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta las facilidades para conseguir los créditos ya que estos son sin tantos requisitos. Tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes.  Su esposo es taxista.

Es una buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y ayudar a su esposo en la dura tarea del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja todos los días, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene tres años que se dedica a la venta de Yanbal y lo que es ropa recién con el crédito anterior empezó y nos cuenta que ha vendido bastante.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa ya que tiene algunos encargos.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Subidita al Cielo' community bank meet in an area known as 'La Subidita al Cielo', in San Pablo neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely-populated, poor area of the city.

Rosa is a founding member of her community bank.  She is also the bank's president.  She likes the ease with which she can obtain loans since they do not have so many requirements.  Rosa is 48 years old, married, and has two grown-up children who live independently.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

Rosa is a good home maker who, in order to make her own money and help her husband in the hard task of running their household, also sells clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) through catalogs.  She makes her sales door to door and works every day.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every fortnight.  She receives her products in her home and gets her clothes in the city center, from a distributor.  She has been selling Yanbal products for three years and just started selling clothes with her previous loan.  She tells us that she has sold quite a lot.

Rosa will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes since she has some orders to fill.  Her dream is to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Mariatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  Mariatu was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda, a few miles from Makeni city.  She is a 30-year-old.  Mariatu is married and has 4 children who are attending primary school. 

Mariatu has been a businesswoman for 9 years now.  She sells clothes – t-shirts, jeans, bed sheets, towels, etc.  Mariatu and members of her group have applied for a loan of SLL 1,2000,000 for each of them from Kiva lenders in order to further boost their respective businesses.  Mariatu is going to use her share of the loan to buy clothes in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes – t-shirts, jeans, bed sheets, towels, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
Damalie lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Damalie has a business of selling used clothes  She has been in this business for four years, and she works six days out of every week. Damalie sells her products in a shop, by means of retail trade. 

Damalie has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenges for Damalie include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes and also to sell on a wholesale basis only. 

Damalie lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.en: Jose lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras where he operates a small convenience shop out of his home. He is requesting a loan of HNL 8,000 to purchase merchandise for the store. He is a new client and would like to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, juice, milk, eggs, beans, rice, cornmeal, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 55 years old and married to Lucy.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Wanguke Shg Group

texts.en:
Richard is the facilitator for the Wanguke Self Help Group in Cwele District.  He leads a group of 10 small-holder farmers who have been members of the One Acre Fund since Long Rains 2010.  Within the group, there are four women and six men.  Richard notes that his main reasons for seeking a loan from One Acre Fund are to access the best input prices, access quality inputs, access reliable input delivery, to grow enough to feed his family, and to have profits to invest in his childrens' education.  

Before joining One Acre Fund, Richard harvested 3.5 bags of maize on 1 acre of planted land. However, after joining One Acre Fund, Richard has been able to harvest 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land  thanks to the inputs and agricultural training he received as part of the loan program.  Richard and his group will re-enroll for the 2012 planting season.  In all, the Wanguke Self Help Group will receive input loans totaling 6.5 acres worth of inputs, with each farmer planting between 1/2 and 1 acre of land.  Richard and his group plan on spending the profits of their harvests on school fees, home repairs, assisting neighbors through difficult times, home goods, livestock purchases, and possibly further business investments. 
.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Elinor

texts.en:
Elinor, a divorced mother of two grown children, lives in Bnei Brak. For the past several years, she has given group and private exercise training lessons and massage therapy. In the past, Elinor ran her group lessons and private sessions in different studios and gyms. After careful calculation and business consultation, Elinor decided to open a studio in her home. With her eldest child already reaching adulthood and making a home of her own, Elinor had the extra space and converted an area into a studio. This allows her to save transportation and rental costs and precious time she had to allocate to reach the other locations. While a small number of clients will continue to have lessons at an outside studio, the majority of her business is relocating to her home-based studio.

Elinor needed this loan to purchase weights, exercise mats, pilates balls, and lighting fixtures and to create PR flyers.

While a good number of Elinor's clients have moved to her home-based studio, she does still hold classes at outside studios. In the future, she hopes to work almost exclusively out of her studio, providing classes throughout the week.

loans.use: To purchase weights, exercise mats, and pilates balls and create PR flyers.

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es: Martha Esperanza tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 10 años que posee este medio de vida. Ella dio inicio porque no tenía un trabajo estable que le proporcionara ingresos a su hogar, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 está bajo su cargo. El financiamiento es para la compra de hilos, tijeras, telas, bordados, cintas, entre otros. Sueña con pagar en tiempo y forma su crédito pues ha sido beneficioso para ella contribuir para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha Esperanza has a seamstress business, which she has had for over ten years.  She started the business because she did not have stable work that would give her income for her household.  She has three children; only one is under her care.

The loan is to buy thread, scissors, fabric, embroideries, and ribbons, among other things.  She plans on making her payments on time.  The loan has been beneficial to her in the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors, fabric, embroideries, and ribbons, among other things.

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to an electrician. Together with her husband, she brings up three children; the older one studies at school and the other two are preschool age (under seven). 

A year ago, Nazgul sold a harvest and with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, she opened a pavilion, where she sells grocery goods. At the moment a trade in the pavilions runs well. The monthly profit is about 11,000 KGS. With money received from the loan, Nazgul wants to purchase more products in order to increase the variety of goods she sells. She plans to purchase more beverages, cookies, chocolate, detergents, etc.. In the future, she plans to start repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, detergents, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura is 35 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 11. In 2001, she established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buys raw materials for her business. In the future, Nura plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr:
Aïcha est une femme âgée de 23 ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et est mère d‘un enfant de 2 ans.  
Aïcha travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète et revend des bois de chauffe à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne régulièrement dans un village reculé du pays. Elle travaille seule. 
Aïcha a requis son quatrième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bois de chauffe destinés à la vente. Elle pense réinvestir le surplus de profits dans le développement de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Aïcha voudrait voir son activité prospérer. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Aïcha is 23 years old. She is married to a teacher and has two children.
  
Aïcha has run her small business since 2007. She purchases and then resells firewood to people at their homes. She buys her stocks from a remote village. She works alone.
