Aïcha is requesting her fourth loan from WAGES to purchase firewood for resale. She intends to reinvest her profits into the business.
In the next few years, Aïcha would like to see her business grow. She says that with her profits, she intends to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a candle-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy wax, wicks, molds and other materials.

Elvira has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wax, wicks, molds and other materials.

loans.name: Shirlita

texts.en:
Shirlita is widowed with 2 children. Shirlita is 30 years old and lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Shirlita earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, soap, biscuits, candies and etc.
Shirlita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Shirlita hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, soap, biscuits, candies and etc

loans.name: Sosoli

texts.en:
Sosoli is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa Iuopapa. She is single and does not have any children. To make a living, Sosoli owns and operates a business venture, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community. Sosoli has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2011, Sosoli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her business. Sosoli is requesting a first-time loan from SPBD of 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase cooking utensils and an oven for her business. Sosoli plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and an oven.

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta, 56, is a divorced mother of four children, all of whom graduated from school.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past 14 years, she has owned a school.  Her potential customers are children from the neighboring school. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer needs in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her child, who is in college. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child, who is in college.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey, 51, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province where she is a farmer, and her husband sells charcoals. Mey is requesting her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner, for US $1200 to purchase a rice threshing machine for personal use and rental. This will enable her family to generate more income.

In the future, Mey would like to use any additional income to purchase another plot of farmland to produce more rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy a rice threshing machine for personal use and rental.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman who has three children. Teresita is 46 years old and resides in Balili, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Teresita own and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2010, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living conditions. In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupement composé de dix  personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Cica Flora Firmine, la représentante du groupement (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 38 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Cica Flora Firmine est mariée à un Babatoundé. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. En dehors de leur enfant, le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Cica Flora Firmine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Cica Flora Firmine vend des produits cosmétiques à son domicile depuis dix ans. Elle vend aussi des mèches de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer au bien n'être de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Cica Flora Firmine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Cica Flora Firmine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DIEU EST GRAND un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques et des mèches.

loans.name: Sylvia  Philippe

texts.fr: Sylvia, 57 ans, vit en union libre. Elle a neuf enfants. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques et des sous-vêtements féminins.  L’activité est très petite mais très prospère. Elle a besoin de l’agrandir. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use: augmenter son stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is the owner of Adom Ventures and she trades in general goods. She is very hardworking and eager to expand her operations. She however lacks the needed capital and is therefore seeking a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva. She is honest and can pay it back. Her dream is to own a supermarket.

loans.use: Elizabth needs working capital to invest in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Isabella Nyambura intends to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Mrs. Chim S. is 48 years old, and she runs a small business of renting out rooms to garment factory workers.  She earns about $9/day in this business, and her husband contributes $2/day which he earns working as a motor taxi driver.  Chim S. and her husband support 6 children--4 of whom work at a garment factory.  She will use this loan to build a home with four or five new rooms for rent.  Over time, she hopes to save enough money to reinvest in her business and make it much larger.

loans.use: To build a small home for rental

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
I have a grocery business out of my house. I would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise and to have a wider variety of products. Additionally, my wife and I make sausage and we distribute it to other grocers. We work very hard to have a better quality of life. I am asking for $600.00 dollars to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Rebecca Pendleton

“Tengo un negocio de abarrotes en mi vivienda, me gustaría invertir en la compra de más mercancía y tener más variedad de productos, también hacemos chorizo entre mi esposa y yo y lo repartimos a otros negocios de abarrotes, trabajamos muy duro para tener una mejor calidad de vida”. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Luís Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo is single and works in a food factory. Although he is not married he does not like to be an extra burden for his family, and his sister inspired him to sell clothing and shoes from the United States. He started approximately two years ago with a little bit of capital that he obtained when he was let go from is previous employment. Thanks to his effort he has been able to get ahead, and has been able to support himself. In addition to self employment, he wishes to continue with his business and grow into becoming a micro industrialist.

Luis is soliciting a loan of $650 USD, and is offering to pay it back in a period of 6 months. The loan will be used to buy bedding sheets and blankets, and clothing for children so that he can move forward with his business and have a better quality of life. Thank you very much for your help.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Luís Eduardo es soltero trabaja en una fábrica de alimentos, a pesar de que no está casado no le gusta ser una carga para su familia y su hermana lo animó para vender ropa y calzado traídos de Estados Unidos, comenzó hace aproximadamente dos años, con un pequeño capital que obtuvo cuando lo despidieron de su anterior trabajo y gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y poder mantenerse, además de auto emplearse, el desea continuar con su negocio y crecer como microempresario.

Luís esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 650, ofreciendo pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses para poder comprar juegos de sabanas que también vende y algo de ropa para niños, para poder salir adelante con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida, muchísimas gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional products for kitchen/eatery.

loans.name: Suraye

texts.ru:
N. Suraye is 26 years old and has secondary education. Suraye is an entrepreneur, she lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube and sells warm winter clothes. She has own stand in the central market of Qurgan-Tube. She plans to use her loan to purchase a new assortment of children's winter clothes. She brings in the merchandise from Dushanbe. The loan will help Suraye offer a wider variety of goods to the residents of Qurgan-Tube, which will give them more choices to match their tastes at a lower price. They would not have to travel outside of the city and spend extra money for the trip. She plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нахшбандова Сурайе, возраст – 26 лет, образование среднее. Сурайе предприниматель, живет в городе Курган-Тюбе и занимается продажей зимних теплых вещей. Она имеет торговую лавку на центральном рынке города Курган-Тюбе. На полученный кредит Сурайе планирует приобрести новый ассортимент зимних детских теплых вещей. Товар она привозит из города Душанбе. Получив кредит она сможет предложить жителям города Курган-Тюбе большой ассортимент продаваемого товара, чтоб они смогли выбрать его на свой вкус и приобрести по умеренным ценам, при этом не выезжая за пределы городы и не неся дополнительных расходов по проезду. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase new warm winter clothes

loans.name: Djiito 2 Group

texts.fr:
We have already benefitted from one loan which put us on the road to financial independence and we hope to continue our activities with a renewal, adding training of young village girls who are becoming interested in the projects we are leading in our eco-village. This capital will allow us to buy raw materials in necessary quantity which we will dye and put up for sale in reception centers in our Department and other villages in Senegal. The most positive part is that the interest these young girls are taking in this aspect of production, which until now was done abroad, will make our work sustainable. To all the benefits, training will be added, and all thanks to Kiva. Now the young village girls and women know that they can make it with a common project and little good will.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous avions déjà bénéficié d'un premier prêt qui nous a mis sur la bonne voie pour l'indépendance financière et nous espèrons qu'avec ce renouvellement faire la même activité en y ajoutant la formation des jeunes filles du village qui commence à s'intéresser aux activités que nous sommes entrain de mener dans notre écovillage. Les fonds vont nous permettre de pouvoir acheter en quantité suffisante les produits bruts que nous allons teindre et mis en vente dans les structures d'accueuil qui existent dans notre département et dans les autre villes du Sénégal. La partie la plus positive est que les jeunes filles se sont intéressées aux activités et cela va permettre de rendre perenne cet aspect de la production qui jusqu'ici, nous venait de l'etranger. Donc aux bénéfices; s'ajoutera la formation et tout cei grâce à Kiva. Maintenant toutes les filles du village et les femmes savent qu'elles peuvent s'en sortir si elles ont un projet commun et avec un peu de bonne volonté.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for dying and training of young women

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana Q. V. runs a general store in the town of Jepelacio, San Martin. Jepelacio is a rural town that is a one-hour car ride from Moyobamba, the capital of San Martin. At her store, she sells basic commodities and has many loyal customers. They are happy they don’t need to travel to another city or walk across town to buy their goods.

Juana is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. She started the business three years ago because she loves to work and she wanted to help her family. She now has more friends, greater self-esteem, and feels more secure about her family’s future. She is also happy she can work from home where she can take care of her children.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Juana is requesting a loan of $350 (s/1000) to repay over 4 months. With the extra capital she would like to buy chicken, beef, and pork to sell in her store.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy chicken, beef, and pork to sell.

loans.name: Hanzeran's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Hanzeran, age 40, is a single parent of three children (ages 20, 17, and 12). She has a cosmetics business and she also sells clothing door-to-door to make a living. She travels to the island Zanzibar to purchase her goods. She started this work five years ago and now makes a monthly profit of about $90. She works from 2:00 in the afternoon to 8:00 each evening.

In the past, Hanzeran took out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to make trips to Zanzibar, pay school fees for her kids, and expand her line of products. She now hopes for a new loan to travel to Zanzibar once again to buy cosmetics and clothing. She will also use the loan to pay the examination fees for her child who is in Form 2 (second year of secondary school).

Hanzeran will share this loan with her subgroup who have businesses dealing in charcoal, clothing, food, and fabric sales.

In the picture, Hanzeran is in the back row, first on the left.

loans.use: To expand the various businesses of the group members

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mr. Khon T. is a 44-year-old rice farmer and pig breeder in Kork Sandek Village in the Kampong Speu Province. He is married to Mrs. Phal Chem, who works with her husband, and they have three children, all of whom are studying at the local school. They usually work together to meet their family's needs, but Mr. Khon T. also works as a house constructor. Due to the rising price of pigs, Mr. Khon T.’s business has struggled as of late because he has been unable to buy pigs to raise. He was an AMK client previously, and he used the proceeds from the loan he received through AMK to buy a motorbike so that he could work as a taxi driver. Now, Mr. Khon T. is seeking a loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: To purchase food for the pigs he and his wife breed

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos F. is a 40-year-old married father of four who lives in the 14 de febrero neighborhood. His wife works from home making tortillas in order to help cover the family expenses.

Mr. F. is a welder and a bricklayer with 16 years of experience. He started his business with his own funds. He needs this loan so that he can purchase the necessary welding supplies. His plans are to open a business space in which he can set up his workshop, thus increasing his profits and improving his living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos F. habita en el barrio 14 de febrero, tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, su esposa trabaja en la casa, para ayudar con los gastos de la familia ella vende tortilla.

El Sr. Carlos es albañil y soldador, lleva dieciséis años de experiencia, comenzó con dinero propio. El préstamo lo quiere para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de soldadura. Sus planes son tener un local donde pueda instalar su taller, y tener más ganancia para mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase welding supplies

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy works as a vegetable farmer near his home in the Kean Svay district, approximately 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh. He is 37 years old and married with 1 daughter and 5 sons. 

A farmer for over twenty years, Mr. Vuthy grows cucumbers and longbeans, both important vegetables in the Cambodian diet. Each week he drives his cucumbers to the nearby Kean Svay market and sells his longbeans to a middleman, who then resells them at a slightly higher price to nearby villagers and restaurants in Phnom Penh. His expertise and experience have provided a successful farming career, enabling him to support his children. Three of his children work and two are still pursuing their studies in secondary school.

However, the recent worldwide increase in fuel costs have driven up the price of fertilizer, a crucial tool for Mr. Vuthy’s business, as well as the cost of driving his goods to the market. Therefore Mr. Vuthy requests a loan from Kiva and its local field partner Maxima in the amount of $500 to purchase fertilizer and insecticide so he can continue growing his farm as usual. Without the loan, he fears his profit margins will decline significantly and he won’t have the money for his children’s schooling and the necessary costs of repairing the family’s home in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Sinan

texts.en: Mrs. Sinan L. sells second-hand clothes and shoes in Choeung Khnar Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sinan L.'s current business is the product of a previous loan. Mrs. Sinan L. is a 57-year-old widow without any children and she now lives in an old house with a leaking roof. She is now requesting a loan to buy zinc to replace the old roof.

loans.use: to buy zinc to replace the leaking roof.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. D., 31 years old, has 2 school-going children. After marriage, her husband and she mainly focused on farming and raising livestock. In 2003, she joined the TYM Fund. Initially, she borrowed money to invest in raising livestock but the profit was not substantial. As an active and creative woman, she decided to use the subsequent loan to invest in a general store. She was willing to learn and obtain experiences in doing business so her general store has been expanding ever since. Currently, her general store has a wide range of goods, bringing her a stable source of income. Her monthly income of 3,000,000VND (about 200USD) allows her to improve her family's standard of living and take care of her children. This time, she would like to borrow 900USD to continue investing in her general store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị D. năm nay 31 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Sau khi lập gia đình riêng vợ chồng chị chủ yếu chỉ làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Năm 2003 chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng dự án cho thu nhập không cao. Là người phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn, năng động vòng vốn sau chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Nhờ chịu khó học hỏi kinh nghiệm kinh doanh đến nay mô hình kinh doanh của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được mở rộng. Hiện tại vợ chồng chị đã có một cửa hàng tạp hoá với rất nhiều mặt hàng đa dạng. Công việc kinh doanh đã đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập rất ổn định. Với nguồn thu nhập 3000.000đ/ tháng vợ chồng chị đã có điều kiện hơn để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.

loans.use: Invest in her general store

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is 53 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a small village of the West Bekaa. Afif owns a small restaurant and also has a small piece of farmland next to his home that he cultivates. Because of the high cost of the raw materials needed for his business, Afif decided to further develop his farm to raise animals, in particular poultry breeding. He needs a loan of $US1,200 to finalize construction of the chicken farm. This is the first time Afif has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Construct a poultry farm

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Hawa from Dar es Salaam. She is a widow with five children between the ages of 18 and 27 years. Hawa has been running a kuku or poultry business since 2006. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital: you can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! They also require little space; sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. While they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Hawa's business is doing well. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Hawa currently earns about 500 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 675 USD in order to purchase more chicks. In the future, she plans to renovate the kuku house and establish a clothes business where she can sell women clothes. Hawa thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Nisida Aurora

texts.es: La señora Nisida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en la Carretera Antigua de Yarinacocha Nº 290, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como vendedor de libros y productos medicinales. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos naturales medicinales. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo para vender los productos a sus clientes.nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 3 cajas de Vita Maca, 4 Omniplus, 5 cajas de Látex de Plátano y otros productos medicinales.nnNisida está muy contenta porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo y su habilidad, lo cual le permitirá darles una buena educación a sus menores hijos.  nn
texts.en:
Nisida belongs to the Communal Bank, "Perseverant Women", located in the district of Yarinacocha in the city of Coronel Portillo in the Ucayali state. She is 33 years old and is the mother of 3 young children that still depend on her. She is married, and her husband sells medicinal books and products. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling beauty products. She has worked with the communal bank for 2 years. Currently, she is dedicated to selling natural medicinal products. She has her husband's support to sell the products to his clients. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will buy 3 boxes of Vita Maca, 4 boxes of Omniplus, 5 boxes of Látex de Plátano, and other medicinal products. Nisida is very happy because everything she has achieved is thanks to her effort and her capabilities, which will permit her to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of Vita Maca, 4 boxes of Omniplus, and 5 boxes of látex de plátano, etc.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: TODOS LAS SOCIAS DEL GRUPO "LA AMISTAD" ESTÁN REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA NELY LOURDES QUIEN AL IGUAL QUE SUS COMPAÑEROS ES RESIDENTE DEL BARRIO FORTALEZA SON PERSONAS D. DIFERENTES REGIONES QUE VIENEN EN LA ZONA BASTANTES AÑOS. LAS SOCIAS QUE CONFORMAN EL GRUPO SE DEDICAN A DIFERENTES RUBROS COMO SER VENTA D. FRUTAS, VERDURAS, COSTURA, PASTELERÍA, ACCESORIOS D. CELULARES, ABARROTES, COSMÉTICO, COMIDA. EL CRÉDITO SOLICITADO ES UNA GRAN VENTAJA PARA LAS SOCIAS YA QUE PRESENTA UN FINANCIAMIENTO ECONÓMICO Y ACCESIBLE. EL FINANCIAMIENTO ESTA DESTINADO PARA AUMENTAR LOS INSUMOS Y MATERIAL A LA VENTA ASÍ COMO EL MEJORAMIENTO D. SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA. LA MAYORÍA D. LAS SOCIAS YA TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS PORQUE YA TRABAJARON CON LA FUNDACIÓN EN ANTERIORES GRUPOS PERO HAY PERSONAS NUEVAS QUE ACCEDEN POR PRIMERAS VEZ A UN CRÉDITO, PERO SE SIENTEN CAPACES D. ASUMIR ESA RESPONSABILIDAD.
texts.en:
All of the members of the group "La Amistad" (meaning The Friendship) are represented by Nely Lourdes who, like her colleagues, she is a resident of the District of Fortaleza. They are individuals from different regions that have lived in the area for many years. The members that make up the group run various businesses, such as fruit sales, vegetables, tailoring, pastries, cellular phone accessories, convenience stores, cosmetics, and food.

The loan requested will be of great help for the members, providing them with an accessible form of financial support. The funds will be used to purchase more ingredients and articles for resale, as well as improving their stands. The majority of the members have past experience in community groups, having participated in previous groups before. But there are newcomers who will be receiving their first loan, but they feel able to assume that responsibility.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sérgio

texts.pt:
Sérgio M. é natural de Maputo e casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre 16, 13, 8 e 6 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta um sobrinho e uma irmã que vive com eles.

Sérgio estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras da família. Em 1998 iniciou o negocio de venda de tinteiros qual desenvolve até hoje, compra o produto na africa do sul é dono deste negocio. Compra um tinteiro por 100rands( 250,00mt) e vende por 550,00mt. Desta maneira consegue um rendimento mensal de 6000,00mt.

Sérgio vive numa casa própria e solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela terceira vez e segunda no Kiva. Onde os dois primeiros pagou com sucesso e está muito grato pelo apoio do Kiva e dos financiadores.

Sérgio futuramente pretende abrir uma papelaria de forma a vender muito material de escritório de forma fixa já que neste momento vende como ambulante e fornece aos revendi dores.
texts.en:
Sérgio M. is a native of Maputo. He is married and has four children -- 6, 8, 13, and 16 years old. In addition to supporting his children, he takes care of his nephew and sister who live with them. He lives in his own house.

Sérgio studied through sixth grade then stopped because his family could not afford more. In 1998 he started a business selling toner cartridges, which he continues today. He buys the product in South Africa and is the owner of this business. He buys toner for 100 rands (250 Meticais, MZN) and sells it for 500 MZN. In this way he is able to make a monthly salary of 6,000 MZN.

Sérgio is requesting his third loan from Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) and his second with Kiva. He repaid his first two loans successfully, and he is very grateful for the support of Kiva and his investors.

In the future, Sérgio plans to open a stationary store where he can sell many office supplies. It will be a permanent store, whereas currently he is a traveling salesperson and supplies resellers.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell toner

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of thirteen members, is located in Srae Spey Village in Kampong Cham Province. The members plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Ren B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Hun Heang, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, they face problems because their field is infertile and has a lot of insects to damage to their crops. Thus, Mrs. Ren B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her field. She is 56 years old and a mother of two children who are farmers.

Seven members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her field.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира женщина 36 лет , мать троих детей.Муж работает слесарем.Сама Шоира занимается продажей детской одежды и обуви.Для приобретения весеннего ассортимента одежды Шоира хочет получить кредит.Она занимается этим бизнесом уже несколько лет,и поддерживает среднее семейное проживание.За товаром она ездит сама.По перевозке груза ей помогает её муж.
texts.en:
Shoira U., 36, is married. She has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. For several years, Shoira has been in business of selling clothing and shoes for children. She needs this loan to purchase spring clothing inventory. Shoira's business helps her to provide for her family.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spring clothing inventory

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana has been a rice seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She belongs to Benki group loan (Group code 2001).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more rice for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Juliana is 38 years old, married, and has three children: ages 20, 17 and 14. She also cares for one additional dependant.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale.

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru: Холбобоева Анорхол проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 60 лет, замужем и имеет восьмерых детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Занимается растениеводством. Сеет пшеницу, картофель и другие овощи. В данный момент планирует получить кредит и закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Anorhol H. lives in Vahdat. She is 60 years old, is married and has 8 children. She has a high school education and is a homemaker. She grows plants. Anorhol plants wheat, potatoes and other vegetables. It this moment she plans to take out a loan and purchase seeds and fertilizer. She will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and feritilizer.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Suzan sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Yai

texts.en:
Mrs. Yai C., 47, and her husband, Mr. Vin Chan, 52, live in a small village across the Mekong River about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1978 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home.

Yai has been selling fish for 12 years. She buys fish from fishermen for resale in her village and a nearby village. Mr Vin Chan is a mechanic, he also runs a new motorbike and bicycle repairing business. He does his work in the village.

Yai is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase an air compressor for her child’s motorbike cleaning business and to buy motorbike spare parts for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor and motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru: Немат Мирхолов 1962 года рождения , женат имеет  2 детей.  Имеет среднее образования.  Занимается купелей продажей скота. Дома содержит Крупно рогатый скот.  Скот он отправляет  на пастбище вместе с пастухом, которому платит по договоренной цене. Жена  сидит дома, он ни где не работает.  На  прошлой недели он продал корову и на покупки молодых  бычков не хватила некоторая сумма. Для этого он обратился в Мкироинвест для  покупки скота.
texts.en:
Nemat M. was born in 1962, is married and has 2 children. He has a secondary education. He buys and sells livestock. He keeps livestock at home. Nemat sends the livestock to pasture with a shepherd whom he pays the agreed price. His wife stays at home; she does not have a job. Last week he sold a cow and did not have enough money to purchase young bulls. He has turned to MicroInvest in order to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has one son, Alexander. She is a small entrepreneur from Pavlograd. Ludmila sells quality women’s outerwear in the central market of her home town. Her business has flourished, in great degree thanks to timely lending assistance. Ludmila launched her trade about 13 years ago. At that time, she worked with a partner and owned two vending locations. As the business grew, she decided to switch to sole ownership. She now owns three vending kiosks. Ludmila has about 100,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to about 7,000 Grivnyas.

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase her inventory of assorted merchandise for retail sale. Her business boasts stable growth characteristics. Moreover, Ludmila is very reliable and has paid all previous loans promptly.

Although economic forecasts are gloomy in Ukraine, just as they are elsewhere in the world, Ludmila is hoping to continue expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of assorted merchandise for sale

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with two grown children. He is a small entrepreneur from Stryi selling groceries wholesale and retail. Ivan owns a small storage facility in the outskirts of his hometown and a store in one of the villages in the mountains. He has much experience working in this sphere of trade – Ivan launched his business over 14 years ago. His business is known for a reasonable pricing policy and free delivery service. 

Ivan is currently making about 10,000 Grivnyas of income. One of his plans for the near future is to buy a facility for his business that he could own instead of renting a building. Ivan is always on the go. He is very determined and knows how to achieve his goals. Moreover, he tries to keep an active social position and organizes an annual winter festival for kids in the local school, which is something kids always look forward to. This time Ivan is seeking a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase three tons of sugar for his business and expand it more. He is hoping to use the generated profit to finish remodeling his apartment, which he couldn’t complete due to some financial constraints.

loans.use: To purchase three tons of sugar

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 66 years old she is a married mother with eleven children: four are working and her last born is in school but unfortunately, six have died.

Adwoa is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. In selling these products, she says, they move very fast and you can easily recover your money.

She buys her goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With thirty years trading experience she wants to add other stuff like maize, eggs and others items which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc. She is much convinced that the loan will help her increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy food items like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is the mother of four children. It is not easy to provide them with the education they need to have a better future but she is doing her best, with the support of her husband, Eugenio A.. Her family lives simply in the village of Catabban in Burgos, Isabela. She manages a general store in their village to help her husband earn a daily income for their family's needs. Her store still lacks merchandise to sell, so Marilyn is requesting a loan from Kiva of PHP 18,000. She wants her business to grow and become stable in the future. She is thankful that she learned about Kiva loans and hopes that you can help her.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is forty – eight years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Fati lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in food items such as rice, oil, vegetables, beans, etc. Fati buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the local market. She also supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Kossi Bai Edwige

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Totsi à Lomé où elle s’est spécialisée depuis 1999 dans la vente de pagnes de qualité. Elle vend le plus souvent à des fonctionnaires de l’administration publique où elle reçoit beaucoup de demandes. Elle est très connue de beaucoup de personnes. Son stock actuel est en baisse. Pour cette raison elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 12 pièces de pagnes Holland de haute qualité, 17 pièces de pagnes Phoenix de qualité supérieure. Elle est mariée et aide son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants.

loans.use: Achat de pagnes de qualité

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn T., 29 years old is a rice farmer. She has three children, her eldest is just 4 years old and is now ready for preschool. Currently, she owns a 2 -hectare farm and 2 carabaos, a farm animal used in plowing the rice field.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and pay the laborer who helped prepare the soil ready-for-planting.

She said, she likes the CEVI credit program because it has only 2% interest rate which is very low and easy to repay.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe vive solita en su casa, ella labora para un negocio establecido muchos años atrás donde venden de todo tipo de revistas y periódicos, desde hace 17 años, y obtiene un ingresos extra ya que realiza la venta de zapatos y ropa por catalogo y este es el motivo por el cual esta tramitando este crédito, ya que si compra por mayoreo obtendrá un descuento y por lo tanto crecerá su ganancia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Guadalupe lives alone in her house. She works for a business founded some 17 years ago where they sell all types of magazines and newspapers. She earns extra income by selling shoes and clothing by catalog. She needs this loan to buy the merchandize wholesale as she will get a discount which will increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothing by catalog.

loans.name: Toolio

texts.en:
S. and her husband operate a retail store during the day. However, in the evening, S. operates her own clothing business. She makes a variety of deels, or traditional Mongolian coats. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. Her oldest child, age 7, attends a local secondary school, while her youngest child, age 3, stays at home.

S.'s business has been so successful that it allowed her family to build a house of their own. Currently, her net profit is 200,000 tugrugs (~$140 US) per month and she wants to expand her clothing line to include dresses. S. is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~$420 US) loan in order to purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and finishing materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, quienes todavía dependen de ella y están estudiando.Juanita, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de mercería y mercadería de ropas, lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde cordialmente atiende a sus clientes. Juana, es una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día, se esfuerza mas para así cumplir sus demás sueños y darle a sus hijos, una buena educación.En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar y es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes, con el carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará mercería muy variada como juguetes de plástico para niños y niñas, cosméticos como colonias, cremas, lápiz labiales, esmaltes de diferentes marcas, todo esto hará que su clientela aumente y este contenta y por lo tanto sus ganancias serán mayores. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería de ropas y utensilios de cocina.Juanita, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the communal bank "Las Trabajadoras," which is located in the Juanjui district of Mariscal Cáceres province, in the San Martín region. She is 37 years old, married, and is the mother of 3 dependent children who are in school. Juanita, as she is called with affection, is engaged in the business of selling clothing and other items. She has been in this line of work for a number of years. She conducts her business from her house, which is well-equipped and is a place where she can cordially attend to her customers. Juana is a hardworking woman who, day by day, exerts herself more so that she can accomplish her dreams and give her children a good education. She currently has a loyal clientele who come to her place daily to buy, and she personally attends to them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of S/. 1,700.00, she will buy all kinds of items such as plastic toys for children, and cosmetics such as colognes, creams, lipstick, and different brands of nail polish. All of this will make her clientele grow and be satisfied, and accordingly her earnings will improve. Part of the money will also be used to buy merchandise such as clothing and kitchen utensils. Today Juanita feels like a very accomplished woman, who has a strong desire to continue to advance and make her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for helping her to start her business and for helping many women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and other merchandise

loans.name: Constantine

texts.fr: H. Constantine est née en 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AHLONSOU Léopold un maçon, Constantine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble depuis onze ans au quartier Midombo à Cotonou. Constantine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Ayant abandonné très tôt l’école, Constantine vend des tissus de façon ambulante à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est toujours à Dantokpa que Constantine s’approvisionne. Constantine a 8 ans d’expérience dans cette activité et est à son quatrième crédit à ALIDé. Constantine rembourse bien ses crédits à ALIDé. Constantine sollicite ce quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et augmenter la taille de sa marchandise pour satisfaire ses clients en cette période de préparation des fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
H. Constantine was born in 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to AHLONSOU Léopold, a mason, she is the mother of two children who are both in school.  The family has been living together for eleven years in the Midombo district in Cotonou.  Constantine helps her husband to meet family expenses.  Having dropped out of school early on, Constantine sells cloth from place to place at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Dantokpa is where she always stocks up.  She has eight years of experience in this business and is on her fourth loan with ALIDé.  She indeed repays her ALIDé loans.  She's requesting this fourth loan from ALIDé to bolster her working capital and to expand her offering of merchandise in preparation for the year-end holidays.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of fabrics

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir is a 21 year old single man, living in Fuzuli region. He plays the clarinet at weddings, which is a business he started two years ago and continues to enjoy. Zakir now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy a new clarinet to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a clarinet for wedding performances

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira S. P. is from the village of Marabulig 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Elvira is married and has 3 grown-up children. To make a living, Elvira sells home products such as door mats, aprons, and sofa beddings. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2006, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Elvira from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hellen Achieng

texts.en: Hellen Achieng O. is 26 years old, the mother of two children, and a wife. She is the proud owner of a salon in Kanga Town, Rongo District, Kenya. She plans to expand her salon into a boutique so it can be a one-stop attraction for all the women in her town. She would like a loan of Kshs. 50,000 to  kick-start her business expansion.

loans.use: To expand her salon to house a boutique

loans.name: Noélie

texts.fr: Née le 25 décembre 1961 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, F. Noélie est mariée à SAMARI Taïrou avec qui elle vit. En effet, il y a environs 24 ans que Noélie vit à Sègbèya-nord, un quartier de Cotonou. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Noélie et son mari. Pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Noélie exerce comme activité la vente de maïs, de soja et de mil, par le système de distribution. Noélie s’approvisionne à Tchaorou, une ville du nord du Bénin. Noélie exerce son activité depuis environ dix huit ans mais n’a encore jamais bénéficié d’un concours auprès de ALIDé. C’est dans le souci d’augmenter son stock de produit et d’étendre ses activités que Noélie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on December 25, 1961 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. F. Noélie is married to Mr. SAMARI Taïrou, with whom she lives.  She has in fact lived in Sègbèya-Nord, a district of Cotonou, for about 24 years.  The couple has two children who are both in school.  Family expenses are covered by her and her husband.  To help her husband provide for the family, Noélie operates a business selling corn, soybeans, and millet through the distribution system.  She stocks up in Tchaorou, a city in northern Benin.  For about eighteen years, she has been in this business but still has never benefited from assistance from ALIDé.  Concerned about increasing her stock of goods and expanding her business, Noélie is requesting a loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn, soybeans, and millet

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif F. has always distinguished himself as a very hard-working person who is devoted to his wife and three children. Vasif manages his own grocery store, a business he started eight years ago when he found himself needing his own way to support his family.

Thanks to his business, Vasif has been able to help his family, and today he requests a loan of 1600 AZN. He needs you, and through your generosity you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his children's education. Please help them by becoming part of the development of his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Marilou's Group

texts.en:
Marilou D. S. is from the village of Magsaysay. She is 28 years old. Marilou is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marilou D. S..

Marilou is married. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 9,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
ESTE CLIENTE ES UN GANADERO DE LA ZONA DEL AREA DE EL CONGO 
ES UN HOMBRE CASADO PADRE DE 4 HIJOS LOS CUALES TRABAJAN EN FAMILIA Y LOS A MANTENIDO SIMPRE CON ESTA ACTIVIDA
EL CREDITO LO SOLICITA PARA LA COMPRA DE NOVILLOS DE ENGORDE LOS CUALES LOS MANTIENE EN SU PEQUEÑA FINCA
texts.en:
This client is a rancher in the District of El Area del Congo. Juan Elias is married and the father of four children. He works with his family and has always engaged in this activity in order to support them. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy steers for fattening so that he can maintain his small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase steers for fattening

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es: La  Sra. Blanca Nubia H. C.    ella se desempeña como profesora de educación primaria ella tiene de laborar como docente  veinte y dos  años, es madre de tres hijos dos  en edad escolar, ella es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  sietes   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito ella lo quiere para hacer una ampliación en su casa de habitación  y así tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Blanca Nubia H. C. works as an elementary school teacher. She has worked as a teacher for 22 years. She has three school age children, and she is currently married. She has had seven loans with Ceprodel, and she has used each one to improve her house. She wants to use this loan to enlarge her house and have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials like sand and cement

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old, married, and the father of one daughter who is six years old. He sells second hand clothes at Githurai trading center. This is his primary business, and he has been doing it for a number of years now. Githurai is relatively busy in terms of business and has a high population. This is favorable for his business.

He got to know about KADET through a friend. This is his third loan with KADET. He had no previous credit history. With this loan, John plans to buy more bales of second hand clothes so that he can add to his stock and get better returns. 

He hopes and desires to venture into photography in the long run. He plans to open a photo studio of his own.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Kauswagan in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years old. Conchita is separated from spouse and has 2 adult children. Conchita's picture was taken at the the center during their center meeting -- this is not her business site. 

To make a living, Conchita sells used ("ukay-ukay") clothing and shoes in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Conchita's fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María de 63 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene 6 hijos, por la falta de oportunidades y la idea de tener su propio negocio decidió vender productos alimenticios como Quaker, aliños, granos etc. Pero por el sector donde vive ya habían muchas tiendas, y tuvo que terminar con las ventas. Pero María no se rindió y compro carne de chancho para hacer un plato típico del Ecuador es la “Fritada” ( el plato tiene carne de chancho, mote, cebollas).

Ahora María vende de lunes a sábado “Fritada” desde las 13h00 hasta las 20h00, en ocasiones su esposo le ayuda. Tiene un pequeño puesto afuera de su casa para vender la “Fritada”. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques para arreglar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old and lives in urban part of a suburb of Guayaquil. She has six children. Because of a lack of other opportunities, she decided to start a business selling Quaker brand food, grains, etc. Even though there were already many other stores in her area, and she had to terminate this venture, María did not give up. She bought some pork in order to cook “fritada,” a typical Ecuadorean dish. Now María has a small stand outside her home where she sells fritada Monday through Saturday from 1:00 pm to 8:00 pm. Her husband also helps her. She will use the money from this loan to buy cement and cinder blocks to fix up her home. Someday she would like to open a restaurant and make more improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. produces a body cream called shea butter for sale in Abura. Nana has received junior high education and she is married to a carpenter. Together with her husband, they take care of their three children. Her loan is going to serve as additional capital to buy other cosmetics which she is going to add to her shea butter to sell. She anticipates reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: To buy other cosmetics to add to her shea butter to sell

loans.name: Soninbayar

texts.en:
Soninbayar L. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife operates a food and consumer goods small-business in Uyanga sub-province of Uvurhangai while Soninbayar operates public transport between Uyanga sub-province and Arvaiheer, the center of Uvurhangai province.

Soninbayar began his business in 2003 and has gained a lot of experience since then. Because of the trip and routine, his car is in constant need of upkeep and repair. He is planning on purchasing a new car when he can afford it but, for now, he is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his business in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi for his business

loans.name: Kagabi Multi-Purpose-Mpigi Group

texts.en: K. Twaha, 43 years old, has for the last 8 years diligently operated his lucrative timber sales business in Kasubi-Mpigi. With 200,000 UGX as weekly profits, he has come a long way in establishing himself. He has improved both his business and his family's welfare. Being a family oriented man, he has gone out of his way to ensure that he gives his children a worthwhile education. He began as a lumberjack and bakery worker before he ventured into timber sales. He also ekes out profits from a small farming business. He is married with 6 children. With this loan, he wants to purchase more timber for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more timber

loans.name: Kabweeza Intergrated Development A, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Second-hand clothes are in high favour with many people in Uganda. Not one to be left out of this lucrative opportunity presenting itself in his home area of Kyakato, Mubende, Emmanuel B., a hardworking, dependable and lively 52-year-old, made a decision to capitalize on it. With the money he saved conducting his other businesses, he bought his first consignment bales of used clothing.

Despite fluctuations in his business fortunes, Emmanuel's resilience has enabled him to make enormous headway, reflected by the fact that he earns 150,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. A man who likes taking a long view, he has drawn up a plan to expand his second-hand clothing business into a big franchise. With this loan, Emmanuel is optimistic he will be empowered financially to realize his dream as he anticipates fully educating all of his children and building a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes for his business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila H. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Mila is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Mila owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling wood products ("palwa") to local businesses and community members. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Mila is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Mila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business.

loans.name: Vivena

texts.en:
Vivena D. is a married woman who lives in Paliya, Busogon, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  fishing and general store businesses. Her husband Lalonde D., who is 41 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  They have 4 children who are 15 to  22 years old. 

Vivena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vivena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5200,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase a new fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for future education for her children. Vivena D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase new fishing boat

loans.name: Busada

texts.en:
Busada M. lives in the Bakai-Ata village, in the heart of Kyrgyzstan. She is 56, married, and has four grown children; her youngest son, in accordance with Kyrgyz national tradition, lives with her and helps in the household. She works as a masseur in a local hospital and is known as a physician who can soon fix a patient up. 

Unfortunately, salaries of medical personnel in rural areas are very low. That s why in 1993, Busada began to engage in stock-breeding by buying milk cows. Also, she started to cultivate a plot of land with kidney-beans and perennial herbs, which serve as concentration of forage for her cattle and ensure a high quality of milk. 

Busada plans to use this loan of 80,000 KGS to buy four milk cows, which will lead to an increase of milk sales, and to purchase mineral fertilizers for her plot of land. With the revenues, Busada plans to renovate her cattle barn to improve her cows' living conditions.

Busada believes that these activities will allow her to achieve prosperity and well-being for her family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: purchasing cattle and fertilizer

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María Esperanza es una madre de familia de 59 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y uno de sus hijos en el sector Remigio Silva, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La ciudad es considerada como una ciudad eje del comercio en el norte del Perú debido al gran movimiento comercial y de transporte que existe en la zona, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la venta de pescado fresco en un puesto ubicado en los exteriores del mercado modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo (el mercado con mayor afluencia de clientes y con mayor variedad de productos de la ciudad). Ella adquiere su mercadería todos los dias en el terminal pesquero de la región, hacia donde suele dirigirse muy temprano por la mañana, y vende sus productos durante todo el dia. Su esposo se dedica a la misma actividad y juntos trabajan para mantenerse y salir adelante.

Su negocio siempre cuenta con una clientela fija que le otorgan su preferencia gracias a la buena calidad de atención que les brinda. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pescado fresco para poder aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María Esperanza is a 59-year-old mother and lives with her husband and one of her children in Remigio Silva, an urban zone in the area outlying the city of Chiclayo. The city is considered to be the main city for business in northern Peru due to the business and transportation in the area. It is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has been working for more than 10 years selling fresh fish at a stand located outside of the Mercado Modelo in the city of Chiclayo. It is the market with the most customers and with the most variety of products in the city. Every day, she gets her merchandise from the regional fish market, where she goes early in the morning and then sells her products throughout the day. Her husband works in the same business and they work together to support themselves and to get ahead.

Her business always has regular customers who prefer her thanks to the good quality of service that she provides to them. She currently wants to expand her business with the purchase of more fresh fish. This way, she can increase her sales and have more income. To achieve her goal, she considered it to be necessary to request a loan of 1000 PEN for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and who always watches out for their well being and development. The people that know her consider her to be a calm and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell at her stand.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz L. is from the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. She is 50 years old. Beatriz is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Beatriz owns and operates a business venture in the services sector offering beauty services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Beatriz has been engaged in this business for over 39 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Beatriz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Luchando Contra La Pobreza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group 'Luchando contra la pobreza' 1 & 2 (Women Fighting Against Poverty). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children (both adults). She said her most difficult challenge was to be raised without her parents in a family home. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying working and cooking. She is part of the micro-finance program because she had the need to invest in her business when she found out about Esperanza and took it into her community almost 3 years ago.

Lucia is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza, and to lead the program structure in her community. She has had her business for around 10 years, starting after she sold some pigs she had raised. With the profits she started running her "colmado" (convenience store). She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rice, flour and other foods. Her business is a "Colmado", a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally those "colmado"s are in the neighborhood, a short walking distance from any home. Lucia will use the profits to have a better life, after she can finish building her house, and could have a successful business and good savings.

This Esperanza associate's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy depends on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of rice, sugar, beans, and  3 gallons of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy men's wear

loans.name: Mrs. Him Em Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has ten people who live in the Ta Sou village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Him E., 35, has been selected by the other members to be the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Him E. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She is also a recycled goods seller who is able to earn some income to support her family. Though she tries to work hard, she earns a little money. So to improve her family's lives, Mrs. Him E. is seeking a loan to add more money to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a widow with four children, three of whom are enrolled in local school while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy drugs to sell in pharmacy

loans.name: Damaris Njeri

texts.en:
Damaris, 39, is married to Stephen who contributes to the family income. They have three children. She has been in this business for about two years now with an income of about Kshs. 7,900  per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan to buy textile material for making clothes and to buy thread.She hopes to build her own house after buying a piece of land and give her children quality education.

loans.use: To buy textile material for making clothes and to buy thread.

loans.name: Chasariz Marielo

texts.es: Chasariz Maria tiene 27 años, su actividad económica es una panadería. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, inicio desde muy joven pues su familia era quien anteriormente se hacía cargo pero con el paso del tiempo le enseñaron este medio de vida, para que ella obtuviera su propio medio de ingreso. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan los encargos días antes, pues así ella tendrá tiempo de elaborar la variedad de pan que ofrece. El crédito es para la compra de harina, huevo, mantequilla, queso entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Chasariz Maria is 27 years old.  Her business is running a bakery.  She has had this business for more than 7 years.  She started in the business when she was very young.  Her family used to run the bakery but, over time, they taught her this way of life so that she could make her own income.  Most of her customers make orders with her days in advance which means that she has time to make the variety of bread that she offers.  She will use her loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luz  Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Carlota; ella tiene 56 años de edad, viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de compra y venta de ropa ella vende polos, blusas, jeans, chompas, casacas entre otros mas de forma ambulatoria ofreciendo a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, la socia es profesora cesante y se dedica a esta actividad hace ya un tiempo atrás, la socia es una persona bien optimista y alegre.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería de ropa para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Carlota belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Luz Carlota, age 56, is a widow with five children.  She has a business buying and selling clothes.  She sells polo type shirts, blouses, jeans, sweaters, and jackets among others.  She sells in an itinerant manner to her friends, neighbors, and relatives.  She is a retired teacher, and she has been doing this business activity for some time.  She is a very optimistic and happy person.

She is requesting the loan to buy more clothing merchandise for her business.  That way she will have a greater variety to offer her customers.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more clothing merchandise for her business in order to be able to have a greater variety to offer her customers

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.es:
El señor Anacleto tiene 60 años de edad, tiene una gomería y desde hace 6 años está casado, tiene 3 hijos  mayores de edad y una clientela formada.
Solicita el crédito para compra de cubiertas de vehículos de distintas marcas para su gomería.
El cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 1995 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito.
texts.en: Anacleto is 60 years old and he has had an automotive centre for the past 6 years. He is married and he has 3 grown children. He enjoys an stablished clientele. He requests a loan to purchase vehicle coverings of various brand names for his automotive centre. He has worked with Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) since 1995 and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle coverings

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very supportive woman. In order to financially assist her family, she has operated a milk sales business for the past 10 years. She keeps a buffalo at her home, milking it and selling its milk to her community clients at reasonable rates. Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her milk sales business. She will use the loan money to buy another buffalo, which will help her produce more milk and serve more clients.
