Nasreen is hopeful that her business will grow and that she will be able to make more profits after investing the loan.

Nasreen's husband, M. ahmed, works in the fields and grows different crops. Nasreen has 7 sons and a daughter. Her two eldest sons work with their father in the fields. The third son works in a factory while two others are bus conductors. Her remaining children are too young to work. Nasreen and her family have lived in Jaranwala for the past 25 years in a 2-room brick house. Jaranwala is a small city in the Punjab region of Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. Nasreen is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.

Note: In the photo, Nasreen is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy another buffalo

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Mrs. Loem is a 51-year-old widow with two children, both of whom are employed in garment factories. At the present, she is a pig breeder and a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare plot of land where she plants rice on some parts to sell, and on other parts to feed her family.  

In the rice field, Mrs. Loem faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. To improve her rice production, she would like to seek a loan to buy fertilizer to do farming this dry season.  That will let her farm and harvest twice a year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Sugey

texts.es:
Anna Sugey de 29  años de edad trabaja como conserje desde hace  4 años en la Financiera FAMA, ella vive con sus padres  ya que aun no ha formado su propia familia, es muy responsable con sus obligaciones de pago ademas muy trabajadora ha luchado para obtener lo que tiene y darles lo mejor a su familia, los gastos son compartidos en conjunto con sus padres.  

Solicita  su tercer crèdito para repellar y arenillar una habitaciòn ya que con el crèdito anterior logro  construir  la habitaciòn, agradece al Fondo Kiva por este apoyo y espera ser beneficiada nuevamente.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida  es que sus padre gocen de salud y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Anna Sugey is 29 years old and has worked as a concierge at FAMA financial entity for four years.  She lives with her parents since she has not formed her own family yet.  She is very responsible with her payment commitments and is a hard worker.  She has struggled to get ahead and provide the best to her family with whom she shares expenses.

She is requesting her third loan to plaster and grout a room.  With a previous loan she was able to build the room.  She is grateful to Kiva for this support and hopes to receive their help once again.

Her dream is for her parents to remain healthy and for her to have stability in her job.

loans.use: To plaster the walls of a room

loans.name: Ayudemonos Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento ayudémonos esta en su segundo ciclo del zona del plan tres mil, esta integrado por siete mujeres y un hombre las señora Mary  es la presidenta y su actividad principal es un salón de belleza que ella atiende, esta casada y tiene tres hijos menores que están estudiando su marido es albañil toda su familia es muy unida, ella trabaja mucho para ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro mejor, con el dinero del crédito comprara tintes para cabello, champo, lavadores, y todo lo que necesita para utilizar en su salón de belleza,  la señora mercedes es la tesorera del banco de emprendimiento su actividad principal es la venta de ropa americana no tiene puesto fijo va de feria en feria vendiendo su producto tiene su esposo que trabaja de maestro albañil dos niñas menores de edad que están estudiando en primaria con el crédito que ofrecemos aumenta su capital para la compra de ropa americana, todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “Ayudémonos” (Let Us Help Ourselves) communal bank is in its second cycle in the Plan 3000 zone.  Its members are seven women and one man.  Mary is group President.

Her main activity is operating a Beauty Salon.  She’s married and has three minor children who are in school.  Her husband is a Bricklayer.  All of the family is very united.  She works a lot to offer a better future to her children.  She will use the loan money to buy beauty supplies like hair coloring, shampoo, washers and everything she needs to use in her beauty salon.

Mercedes is Treasurer.  Her main activity is selling American clothes.  She does not have a fixed stand but rather goes from market to market selling her wares.  Her husband is a Master Bricklayer and they have two minor daughters who are in elementary school. She will use the loan we offered to increase capital buying American clothes.

All the members are responsible, hard working people who are grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia P. is from the village of Cogon, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a flower shop. Alicia has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In June 2010, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to buy more flowers to sell. 

Alicia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used for additional inventory and working capital for her flower shop. This will be the third loan taken out by Alicia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her flower shop and for working capital

loans.name: Auma

texts.en:
Auma R. O. is a woman of forty nine years, married and a mother of five, and lives in Tuwan in Kitale. 

For two years now, R. has been operating a shop where she sells cereals like maize, beans etc., she gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings from her business. 

This will be R.'s fifth loan from KADET Ltd., she plans to use the entire loan to buy cereals for resale. With the income that she will get she plans to open another shop elsewhere so that she can increase her monthly income. 

In the future she wants to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy cereals like maize, beans etc. for resale

loans.name: Marcia Rosaana

texts.es:
Marcia Rosaana tiene 30 años, es divorciada vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

Marcia se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, cebada, a demás tiene chanchos ganado, ovejas y pollos además se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un vehículo, compra de terreno para seguir produciendo.

Le gusta tejer, dedicarse a los hijos, salir de paseo con la familia, año viejo, las del 15 de agosto de María Auxiliadora.
texts.en:
Marcia Rosaana, 30, is divorced and lives with her children in Canton Guaranda, province of Bolivar. She has 3 children. 

The communal bank GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA (CHINIPAMBA COAL WOMEN'S GROUP) is based in the Chinipamba coal community, Canton Guaranda, about 20 minutes from the cooperative office. Most of the partners work in agriculture, livestock and trade, producing rice, barley, beans, quinoa, potatoes and raising dairy cows and poultry. 

Marcia works in agriculture. She grows potatoes and barley and she also keeps pigs, sheep and chickens. She also looks after the housework. She does her shopping in the market of Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market of the same city.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies and animal feed. The loan will help her meet her financial needs. She has to face challenges such as pests and diseases, as well as changes in the weather. Her dream is to buy a vehicle and more farming lands. 

She enjoys knitting, looking after her children, going for walks with her family, New Year's Eve celebrations and the Maria Auxiliadora festivities on 15 August.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.en: Jeanine is 28 years old and she has three children who are aged between six and ten years old. They are all in school. Her husband is a farmer. Jeanine sells clothes and she has done this business for five years. She also sells goats. This business has enabled her to build her own house and she also bought a garden. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Bernadeth raises and sells goats. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy another kind of animal to raise and sell in the future.

Bernadeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bernadeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy another kind of animal to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De San Ramón Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Los Emprendedores de San Ramón” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la comuna de La Cisterna, ciudad de Santiago. Sus principales negocios son de peluquería, artesanía en madera, venta de joyas, perfumería, chocolates y comida rápida.
Debbie integrante de éste grupo, en la foto se encuentra de pie, en el costado derecho, además viste de color negro y su cabello está tomado. 
Su negocio consiste en la venta de perfumes por catalogo y también compra directamente para abastecerse de mercadería. Sus clientes son frecuentes y van a su propio domicilio a comprar, ya que además ofrece su mercadería por internet. Su horario laboral es muy flexible. 
Con el crédito compró perfumes y estos además llevaban otros productos como cremas y shampoos.
Sus metas en su negocio, son tener un local establecido, específicamente un centro de belleza y estética. 
Debbie vive junto a su hijo de 2 años y sus sueños son obtener su casa propia y brindarle una educación de calidad a su hijo. 
Debbie agradecida del crédito de Fondo esperanza, ya que ha significado un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que con éste podrá invertir en él. Ella además está muy contenta con las reuniones y demás socios del grupo, ya que son muy unidos y organizados. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
The “Los Emprendedores de San Ramón” community bank consists of 19 entrepreneurs who live in La Cisterna, in the city of Santiago.  Their main businesses are hairdressing, making handicrafts from wood, selling jewelry, selling perfume, selling chocolate and selling fast food.

Debbie is a member of this group.  She is standing on the right-hand side of the photo wearing black and has her hair up.  Debbie's business is selling perfumes through a catalog and she also buys direct so that she can stock up with merchandise.  She has frequent customers and they come to her home to make their purchases.  She also offers her merchandise on the Internet.  Her working hours are very flexible.

Debbie used her loan to buy perfume and other products such as creams and shampoos.

Debbie's goal for her business is to own established premises, specifically a beauty and aesthetics salon.

Debbie lives together with her 2 year-old son and her dreams are to acquire her own home and provide her son with a good-quality education.

Debbie is grateful for the loan from Fondo Esperanza.  It is a great support for her business as she will be able to use it to invest in her business.  Debbie is also very happy with her community bank meetings and with the other members of her group as they are very united and organized.

La Cisterna is a community which is located in the central-south district of the Metropolitana region.  It is an essentially residential and commercial area.  It was originally a rural sector, consisting of large plots of land.  However, owing to its population growth and the subsequent arrival of services, it became a 100% urban sector.

loans.use: to buy perfume

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 40 years old, married and has a nine-year-old child. For five years he has been operating a butchery. He also has a dairy to supplement his income.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business, thus raising his standard of living. He is requesting 30,000 KES to buy two cows for slaughter.

Solomon hopes to become financially stable in the future. His dream is to own a slaughterhouse in five years.

loans.use: To buy two cows for slaughter.

loans.name: Aishabubu's Group

texts.en:
Aishabubu, 66, is the leader of this group.  She is the resident of Tokmok, a small town near to Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). Unfortunately she is a widow. All her daughters have grown up and have their own families. Fifteen years ago, In order earn money,  Aishabubu  started to provide sewing services. She sews Kyrgyz national clothes, pillows and blankets. With the profits gained from this activity Aishabubu was able to give a good education to her daughters. She has applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase a multifunctional sewing machine. She hopes it will help her to improve the business. In the future, with the profits gained, Aishabubu plans to repair her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita vive con su esposo y con sus 3 hijos en las edades D. 29 a 34 años, en la ciudad D. Cartagena, donD. es la propietaria D. un negocio D. variedades, y simultáneamente  ofrece servicios D. telecomunicaciones. Su experiencia D. negocios data desD. hace 15 años, cuando vendió ropa informal que le fabricaba una amiga, gradualmente consiguió construir una clientela, cada vez más exigente y con sus ahorros decidió traer desD. las ciudades D.  Medellín (departamento D. Antioquia)  y Bucaramanga ( Departamento D. Santander),  un surtido D. ropa y calzado, con el cual le fue muy bien ;  con ello ahorró y adecuó un local en su propia casa, para estabilizar su negocio, así mismo agregó poco a poco una nueva oferta D. servicios: el D. telecomunicaciones;  negocios con los cuales ha generado ingresos importantes para el desempeño D. sus hogar. Su mayor desafío es tener el capital D. trabajo suficiente para responder a su clientela y esta es la razón por la cual acuD. a un credikiva, con  el cual comprará productos D. papelería y accesorios para surtir sus vitrinas con mercancías D. mayor rotación. Esta compra en un mayor volumen, que con el que usualmente trabaja, le ayudará a adquirir descuentos especiales y oportunidades D. aumentar su volumen D. ventas y en su experiencia en el manejo D. su inversión, está su mayor potencial D. éxito. Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe D. esta organización, a la cual ha estado vinculada desD. hace  un poco menos D. dos años, con este apoyo ha logrado integrar a su hija en el negocio y esto le representa a esta última, además D. un aprendizaje un ingreso por empleo.
texts.en: Margarita lives with her husband and with their 3 children between the ages of 29 and 34 years. They live in the city of Cartagena where she is the owner of a general store. She also provides telecommunications services. Her experience small business dates back 15 years when she started out selling casual clothing crafted by a friend. She gradually built a clientele that was increasingly demanding. With her saving she decided to import a variety of clothing and shoes from the cities of Medellin (department of Antioquia) and Bucaramanga (department of Santander), and it has done very well. With those savings she stabilized her business by installing a store in her house and later she gradually included a new service to her business, telecommunications. These businesses have been important in the maintenance of their home. Her greatest challenge is an insufficient working capital to meet client demand and this is the reason why she requests a Kiva loan. With her loan she will purchase office supplies and accessories to stock her display cases with high selling merchandise. A purchase in larger volumes compared to what she usually works with will help her attain special discounts and opportunities to increase her sales volumes. It will also give her experience in managing her investment which increases her potential for success. This is the second loan that she receives from this organization, one in which she has been a member for just under two years. With this support she has managed to integrate her daughter into the business and to her, this means not only a learning opportunity but also an employment income.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies and accessories to stock her display cases with merchandise.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
At age 51, Pedro still needs to be patient, and he works hard. He is married with six children. His wife is a housekeeper who also manages a retail business in which she sells vegetables like cabbage, carrots, beans, and potatoes.

Five of his children have finished their high school education, but he does not have enough money to send them to college. At present, his youngest child is in high school. Pedro's biggest dream is to send his child to college and for him to finish his studies and become a professional someday.

Pedro manages a corn farming business and a backyard hog raising business as well. He wanted to maintain and develop his hog raising business for additional income in order to support his child's education. He wanted to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is a 32-year-old married man with one child. He is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. Rey grows rice and corn crops to sell. He earns about 10,000 PHP per month doing this farming business.

Rey has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy (pictured here) is a weaver and raises pigs at home. Her husband, Heng, is a farmer. He does fishing and construction work when he is free from farming. The couple has four sons and four daughters. They live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophy is asking for a loan of $700 to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a water pumping machine and pig feed.

loans.use: To buy a water pumping machine and pig feed.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La clienta, ELSA, vive sola no tiene  hijos, es soltera, la clienta se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción, y 1 cabezas de ganado lechero preñada. El destino del crédito es para comprar un tanque de enfriamiento, donde un grupo de personas está haciendo un gran esfuerzo para comprar un tanque de enfriamiento, ya que la producción que sacan les queda muy lejos para ir a entregar, en ese sentido, será de mayor beneficio para la clienta y sus demás compañeras.   Actualmente la clienta vive en la localidad de Esquilan Chico que se encuentra en la Provincia de Quillacollo del Departamento de  Cochabamba.
texts.en: Our client, Elsa, lives alone.  She is single and does not have any children.  Her business is producing raw milk.  Elsa currently has three head of dairy cattle which are producing milk and one head of dairy cattle which is pregnant.  Her loan will be used to buy a milk cooling tank.  A group of people are making a big effort to buy a cooling tank as the milk that their cows produce travels a long way to be delivered.  This purchase will be a great benefit for our client and also for her fellow dairy farmers.  Our client currently lives in the village of Esquilan Chico which is located in Quillacollo province, in Cochabamba department.

loans.use: to (jointly) buy a milk cooling tank

loans.name: Ma. Eva

texts.en:
Ma.Eva is married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma.Eva is 53 years old and has three of her children in school.

Ma.Eva has a videoke rentals business in the Philippines. Ma.Eva requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase chairs and other materials for her videoke business.

Ma.Eva has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma.Eva would like to save enough, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and other materials for her videoke business.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Oliva, 63, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Fidel, a vendor. She is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Oliva operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells Balut (Duck egg) and fish balls for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Oliva hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 29-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. After finding it hard to satisfy the family needs, he decided to open his own business in 2000. So he got involved in the construction field. In parallel, he  has been working as an employee in one of the local companies since 2002. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new construction equipment in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects.

loans.use: to buy new construction equipment.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is single businessman . He is an electrician by profession and he earns a living from it. Most of his customers are local residents. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. 

Stephen is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more bulbs and sockets.

loans.use: to buy bulbs and sockets.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally (photographed) is 51 years old. Her husband, Kheing, is 60 years old. They have been married since 1979 and have two married children: one son and one daughter. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phally sells porridge in the market, while her husband is a mechanic. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to repair the walls of her house because the old ones are broken.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Adelaida has a shop that sells bananas. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy yellow and green bananas to resell.
Adelaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy yellow and green bananas

loans.name: Rolyn

texts.en:
Rolyn is 35 years old and married with four children. For the past five years Rolyn has had a sari-sari store (a food shop) where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rolyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Rolyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 40 years old and lives in Jimenez. She is married and has two children.

Arlyn has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 25 years. Arlyn has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, and beverages, etc. to stock her store. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Arlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es:
Arlen comerciante de ropas y mas, casada. Anteriormente trabajaba como profesora a la actualidad atiende su negocio pudiendo establecer nuevos clientes  y mayor control de su producto. Con el préstamo anterior compro mercadería logrando aumentar su ingreso. Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo invertirá en productos para dama, varones y niños ya que se acerca la temporada escolar y el verano siendo tiempo de ventas. Comprara mercaderías como: pantalones escolares, pantalones de dama y caballero, zapatos, blusas, camisolas, camisetas, faldas, calcetines, short, sandalia, reloj, entre otros productos para aumentar su inventario, cumplir con los pedidos que ya tiene y lo que vendrán. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante al desarrollo de su negocio y el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Arlen sells clothing and other items and is married. She previously worked as a teacher, but currently tends to her business in order to gain new customers and better manage her sales. She used her previous loan to buy merchandise and thereby increase her income. She will invest this new loan in items for women, men and children as the school year is approaching and sales are high during the summer. She will buy merchandise such as pants for school, men’s and women’s pants, shoes, blouses, camisoles, shirts, skirts, socks, shorts, sandals, watches, and other items in order to expand her inventory and fill her current and future orders.

She is grateful to the lending institution for the constant support in developing her business and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Doan

texts.en: Doan is taking out a loan for her son, Dang. When he was a child, Dang wished to become a pharmacist. Currently he is a first year student of chemistry at Hanoi University.  After graduation in 2016, he will work for a phamaceutical company. Therefore, he is studying hard to receive good results. All the expenditure is too high for him to afford. His mother wants to have a loan partly to pay tuition fees and for other costs.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees and other costs.

loans.name: Noudjiou-Mahuton Group

texts.fr: NOUDJIOU-MAHUTON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Georgette(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 44 ans a très peu fréquenté l'école mais appris la couture par la suite, activité qu'elle exerce depuis vingt deux ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Georgette est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Georgette et son mari. Pour cette raison, Georgette vend divers articles de mercerie de façon secondaire. Georgette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Georgette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe NOUDJIOU-MAHUTON, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter divers articles de mercerie .

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Miss Maria del Rosario lives with her husband and four children in the community of Monclova, in the state of Coahuila. Her husband is a labourer and he earns very little, for which is not enough to cover all of their expenses. Three years ago she, through a friend, learned that she would be able to earn an extra income through the sale of cosmetics through catalogue. Thanks to this business she and her family has been able to come through and without this business they would not have been able to afford their childrens’ education. Miss Maria del Rosario requires a loan in the amount of $250 to be able to keep up the business and pay for a large shipment and, in this manner, have the merchandise available for her clients.

You can help her and her family. Become part of their efforts. Miss Maria del Rosario has worked hard with the love she has for her family. The decision is in your hands, your generosity would be a great help for them. Make your decision, they will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña María del Rosario vive con su esposo y 4 hijos en la comunidad de Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila. Su marido es obrero y gana muy poco, por lo que no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos. Hace 3 años ella, por medio de una amiga, se enteró que podía ganar algunos ingresos extras por medio de la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Gracias a esta actividad ha logrado, junto con el apoyo de su familia, salir adelante, ya que sin esto no podrían costear los estudios de sus hijos. Doña María del Rosario requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS para poder continuar y pagar un pedido grande y de ésta forma tener mercancía en existencia para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Tú puedes apoyarla a ella y su familia y ser parte importante de sus logros. Doña María del Rosario ha luchado mucho por el amor que le tiene a su familia. La decisión esta en tus manos, tu generosidad será de gran ayuda para ellos, decídete, ellos te lo van a agradecer sinceramente

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Miss Vinh has 2 children, 13 and 11. She must support them going to school. Toan, her daughter, has chronic bronchitis.

Miss Vinh has a small hut and 2000 m2 of agriculture land. The land is poor and she has no capital to buy fertilizer, so she only can plant cassavas. Last crop she borrowed a loan from a neighbor with no interest. Now she repaid a loan of $32 and her income increased about $3.5/person/month. Her average income is now $13/person/month. She wants a loan of $50 for her planting.

loans.use: Growing rice and plant cassava

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Mrs. Phen C. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  C. has a small shop selling second-hand clothes at the local market.  This business generates about $24 per day in revenue.  Her husband, meanwhile, is a police officer who can make about $4 per day.  The couple's three children are still students, but help their mother sell clothes when not at school.  They hope to use this loan to purchase more clothes for C. to sell at her store.  In the future, they hope that they can purchase their own stand at the market, which will significantly reduce their costs.  Eventually, they hope that their children will be able to attend university.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in order to expand her business

loans.name: Terisa

texts.en:
Terisa is a 36 year old fisherwoman with three children. Apart from fishing, she also makes traditional Samoan necklaces. After selling her products, she makes $300 weekly, which helps provide for her family’s basic necessities and her children’s education. Terisa is happy to have SPBD assist her financially with her work especially as she is so fond of her work and the good money that it brings her family.

Terisa is requesting an $800 loan to buy paint, fishing nets, cement, timber, sand and an iron roof.

loans.use: To buy paint, fishing nets, cement, timber, sand and an iron roof.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. Hing S., 40, lives with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her household, Mrs. Hing S. runs a small grocery booth in her area, where she is able to generate around $3 each day. In addition, three of her children are employed at a garment factory. Mrs. Hing S. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to meet her clients’ demand.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to meet her clients’ demand.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Business Description

Beatriz has been working in this job for 18 years. She began by purchasing piglets with a small amount of capital, which she would raise and sell. She has recently began selling food as well. She works from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. Her daughters help her with the food sales, and she sells pork in the areas near her home.

Loan Use

This loan will be invested in the purchase of more piglets for later sale. She will also use the money to modify her tricycle which she uses to distribute the food that she sells.

Personal Information

Beatriz is a a single mother. She has 4 adult children who help her in her business. She is currently adding to her home. Through her earning she has been able to begin construction using cement. She would like to finish it, and to set up a place to sell food.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Beatriz tiene una experiencia de 18 años en su actividad. Se inicio con un capital pequeño comprando chanchitos para criarlos y después venderlos. Hace poco tiempo también se esta dedicando a la venta de comida. Mantiene un horario de trabajo de 8 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. Sus hijas le ayudan en la venta de comida. Y en la venta de carne de chancho recorriendo los sectores de su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de más chanchitos para su posterior venta. Además de adecuar su triciclo en le cual realiza el recorrido de la venta de comida.

Información Personal

Beatriz es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos los que son adultos y le ayudan en los negocios que ella posee. Actualmente ella esta adecuando su casita. Ha logrado gracias a sus ganancias comenzar la construcción de cemento. Su deseo es poder terminarla y montar ahí un local de venta de comida.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of piglets

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a single mother with one son. She lives in Vasilyevka and works in the local food market, selling baked goods and sweets. Victoria’s stall is well-known for having a wide assortment of inventory and low prices. Being a smart manager of her resources and educated with a degree in pedagogy, she has been able to start and sustain her small business over the last 5 years. Today, Victoria has about $3000 in inventory.

Victoria is very energetic. She balances her business activities, teaching in a local middle school, and her family responsibilities. Victoria is very serious about every single thing she takes on. She is very determined to further her entrepreneurial goals and dreams, which is why she is now requesting a loan of $500. She is hoping to open a new vending location and widen the assortment of goods for sale in her vending kiosks.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha R. V. has a general store in the town of Jepelacio, San Martin, where she sells basic consumer goods as well as a lot of beer. She started the store in 2005 in a space in her home. Her customers in the rural town of Jepelacio are happy they can save time purchasing their goods from Martha instead of making the long trip to the main market.

Martha is 36 years old, has two children, and is single because her husband abandoned her for another woman many years ago. Now she fights to raise her two children alone and give them more opportunities than she had. The business has given her the opportunity to take charge of her life. She loves building relationships and giving customers the best possible care.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Martha is requesting a loan of $875 (s/2500) to repay over 6 months. With the loan, she would like to restock her shelves with goods and beer. In the future, she would like to be able to send her children to university.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to restock her shelves and buy beer to sell in her store

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica D. is married with two children. To help support her family, she works as a fishmonger. She buys fish from the local fishermen, smokes them, and then travels to villages to sell the fish.

She is asking for $525.00 to have enough capital to buy fish in bulk. Monica is also a member of a lending group called “Mawunyo Traders” that consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Tojinisso

texts.ru:
Tojinisso J. lives in Rudaki district. She is 53. She has a large family: a husband and four children. Tojinisso works as an elementary school teacher in Rudaki district. At home she also has a small livestock business raising animals. She has been doing this for about 20 years. This winter, the nation's poor economic conditions also rubbed off on Tojinisso's business and several of her sheep died. Tojinisso would like to rebuild her business. To do this, she needs a loan of 450 US dollars to buy more sheep. She can repay her loan within eight months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Джобирова Тоджиниссо проживает в районе Рудаки . Ей 53 года. У нее большая семья:муж и четверо детей. Работает учителем начальных классов в средней школе , района Рудаки. У себя дома имеет небольшое хозяйство, где разводит мелко-рогатый скот. Занимается этим бизнесом уже около 20 лет.Зимой неблагоприятные условия отразились на ее хозяйстве. Несколько из ее овец померзли. Поэтому Тоджиниссо хочет восстановить свое дело. Для этого ей нужно получить кредит в размере 450 долларов США и закупить нескольких овец. А погасить кредит сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana lives with her husband and their three children who range in age from five to thirteen years old. Her husband's eldest son recently moved in with them while he studies at the university.

Juana has been running a small grocery store for seven years in the small rural community of San Cristobal. This entrepreneur humbly explains that her stock is still limited, but she plans to use her loan to buy a greater variety of products, especially drinks, which she is not selling yet. She wants to add to her inventory in order to meet the needs of her customers.

Juana dreams of owning a big market with plenty of products to offer to people of her neighborhood, and becoming the most well established supplier of these goods in her community.

loans.use: To improve a small grocery store by adding new items, especially drinks, to the inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Juramurod.

texts.ru:
Juramurod D. is a citizen of the Shahrinav area. He lives with his family, is married and has 4 children. He works as a veterinarian, but also is engaged in a small business. In his home he has opened a small shop where he trades food and economic goods. He has been engaged in this kind of business for 14 years. Currently he wishes to increase his assortment by increasing his commodity circulation. However this can only be achieved by receiving a loan, and that is why he has asked Kiva for help. He wants to receive a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni and plans to repay the loan within 15 months. He lives in a secluded area, therefore by increasing his business he can help the people of his region.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатов Джурамурод житель района Шахринау. Живет со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет четверых детей.Работает ветеринаром . Кроме того занимается мелким бизнесом. У себя дома открыл небольшой магазин , где торгует продуктами питания , а так же хозяйственными товарами. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 14 лет. Сейчас в данный момент хочет увеличить ассортимет путем увеличения товарооборота. А это возможно лишь путем получения кредита. Поэтому он обратился к нам за помощью. Хочет получить кредит в размере 2500 сомони сроком на 15 месяцев. Он живет в отдаленном месте , поэтому развитие бизнеса может помочь и населению его кишлака.

loans.use: Increase commodity-circulation

loans.name: Irshaad

texts.en: Irshaad Baji is the wife of M. N. who has been in the army for the last 25 years. She is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has been living in an area called "Jani Pura chowk" near Shalimar, Lahore, for the last 15 years. She owns a three-room brick house. She is the owner of two grocery shops which are situated near her house. She is the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. One of her sons is a driver, another son runs a grocery shop, and the last son is studying. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Paksitan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more material (lentils, cooking oil, rice) for her son's grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy material for a grocery shop

loans.name: Ni Made Riniasih

texts.id:
Bu Made Riniasih seorang isteri yang mengerti akan pentingnya peranannya sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang wajib membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga terutama dalam masa-masa krisis aeperti sekarang. Memelihara babi adalah bukti dari ketulusannya membantu suaminya. Saat ini Made Riniasih memelihara 2 ekor penggemukan dan memiliki rencana memelihara penginduk untuk bisa mendapat hasil yang lebih baik. Usaha beternak ini sudah dijalaninya cukup lama yaitu sejak menikah sehingga hasil dari usaha ini sebagian besar dipergunakan tambahan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Karena sebelumnya usaha yang ditekuninya ini dikelola dengan cara sederhana sehingga hasilnya belum maksimal, tetapi cukup bisa dibanggakan karena mampu menunjang pendapatan keluarga. Keuntungan  yang biasa diperolehnya dari 2 ekor penggemukan berkisar  Rp 500.000,- sampai Rp 6.00.000 dalam waktu 5 bulan. 
Ibu Made Riniasih berharap usahanya bisa lebih dikembangkan lagi mengingat biaya hidup semakin meningkat, sedangkan pendapatan keluarga tidak mengalami banyak peningkatan. Itulah sebabnya Ibu Made Riniasih berencana memelihara penginduk  dari pinjaman modal yang diperolehnya dari DINARI. Ibu Riniasih mengikuti program ternak babi dari Yaysan DINARI dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayarannya dilakukan setelah akhir periode.
texts.en:
Made Riniasih is a dutiful wife who understands her responsibility in helping her husband to ease the family's economic burden. In doing this, she is raising 2 piglets and she is planning to buy a breeding pig to get a better result.

She has been doing this pig farming business for quite a while. All of the proceeds are used to help the family. She can earn IDR 500 thousand to IDR 600 thousand (around USD 55-65) by raising 2 piglets for 5 months.

She wants to further improve her family welfare and therefore she is participating in the DINARI's foundation's pig farming program where she can get a loan and repay it after 6 months period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy breeding pig (Membeli induk babi)

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Desde hace más de 25 años, Sixto se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, los cuales vende sobre todo en las festividades de los poblados aledaños al suyo. Además cría vacas, a las cuales les tiene gran aprecio, ya que gracias a ellas puede de una u otra forma solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar, por la leche que vende temprano en la mañana.Sixto nos mostró a sus animalitos con mucha alegría, sus grandes vacas estaban a punto de ser vacunadas contra las diversas enfermedades que puede atacar a este tipo de animal. Para él es muy importante trabajar en la chacra y en la crianza de sus animales, por eso solicita un préstamo, para la compra de una vaca, con la cual su esposa pueda elaborar queso y venderlo en los mercados, y así tener un ingreso adicional en el hogar.Contamos con su apoyo para los proyectos de don Sixto.
texts.en:
For the past 25 years, Sixto has worked in agriculture and the raising of animals, which he sells mostly in festivals in villages close to his own. He also raises cows which he cares for greatly since thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses through the milk which he sells in the mornings. Sixto showed us his animals with great happiness as his cows were about to be vaccinated against the various sickness that affect that type of livestock. For Sixto, it is very important to work his land and raise his animals which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase another cow so that his wife can make cheese and sell it in the local markets. That will help his family to generate additional income. We appreciate your support for Don Sixto's projects.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase one more cow in order to make cheese

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol K. was born in 1978 and now she lives in Ang Tanuo village in Takeo Province. She is a hen and pig breeder. In her business, she faces some problems because she does not have enough money to continue her business and she is out of animals.

In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Chanthol K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy eight pigs and a hundred chickens to raise. She hopes to improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Nang Soka, is a construction worker. Mrs. Chanthol K. is the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy eight pigs and a hundred chickens

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
La señora Marlith, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de almidón de yuca y sus derivados como el afrecho que es muy utilizado en la elaboración de dulces. Vende de manera ambulatoria, sale a los pueblos llevando su productos.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,500, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará  yuca en grandes cantidades, calamina para el secado de la harina, también pagará a sus trabajadores, también quiere comprar materiales de construcción para construir cuartos y luego alquilarlos.

Marlith tiene 41 años de edad, vive con 02 de sus 03  hijos y con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marlith, member of the Doradinas en Accion (Women of Dorado in Action) Village Bank lives in Dorado in San Jose de Sisa, San Martin, Peru. She works producing and selling yuca starch and its derivatives like yuca bran which is used to make candy and other sweets. She sells her goods walking from village to village. With this $825 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase large quantities of yuca, thin metal laminates where she can dry the flour, and will pay her workers; she will also use some of the money to buy materials to construct rooms that she can rent out. Marlith is 41 years old and lives with two of her three children and with her husband who works in agriculture. She is grateful for the support she will receive that will help her to grow her business. Her goal is to grow her business and purchase a home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yuca, metal laminates, and pay her workforce

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Rigoberta

texts.en:
Rigoberta is a member of the Glorioso Village Bank, one of FINCA Peru’s oldest village banks. She is a cheerful, lively woman who likes to joke around and always brings a smile to the face of those around her. She is 36-year-old and married with two children. Rigoberta has a market stand where she sells dry goods (like flour, sugar, rice and pasta), a business she has had for the past three years. She works alone from 5 am to 2 pm each day. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Rigoberta is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy rice, sugar and oil. Her goal for the future is to build her own home.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is raising her four children while her husband is in Russia seeking a job. Since she is alone, she decided to start her own business breeding cattle. Because she has worked in this field before, business is good. Today she has three cows and two sheep. She also has lots of hay and forage--enough for more cattle than she currently owns. So she decided to take out a loan to buy more cattle. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets  such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Iyenda

texts.en: A. Iyenda is 65 years old and married with 7 children. He sells groundnut oil and he hopes to increase his sales. He is requesting for this loan to purchase more groundnut oil to sell. He says thanks to Kiva and everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnut oil to sell

loans.name: Vuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vuy T., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sophy An, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1982 and have six children: one son and five daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a silk weaver, and the other children are in school. 
 
Vuy has been a weaver since she was 17 years old. She learned the skill from her mother. Vuy buys raw silk from Phnom Penh and sells her finished products to the middleman in her village. Her husband has built wooden houses since 1979. He works in his village and in a nearby village. Vuy is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase cotton thread materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase cotton thread for her weaving business

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Sara  has been selling potatoes in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more potatoes for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Sara  is 32 years old, married, and has five children: ages 11, 9, 7, 3 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Bahati, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Abduahad

texts.en:
A. Abduahad is 31 years old and married with two children.

For six years Abduahad has been involved in the business of repairing vehicles. He started as a mechanic and gradually managed to open his own repair shop. Abduahad is well-known in his neighborhood as an excellent mechanic. He tries to fix any problem and the prices for his services are quite fair which attract lots of clients. All this allows Abduahad to generate a stable income for his family and to educate his children.

Today Abduahad requests $1000 to purchase spare parts for repairing cars. He plans to repay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for support.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing vehicles

loans.name: Younos

texts.en:
Mr. Younos S., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Aisas Tres, 44, live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1985 and have four children: one son who raises cows at home and three daughters. Their eldest daughter assists her mother in sewing hammocks to sell.

For ten years Younos has been selling cloth hammocks sewn by his wife and daughter. Besides selling hammocks he also runs a new business selling cows. Younos is requesting his second loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase cows for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for re-sale

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 37 years old and married with four children. She sells kitchen utensils like plates, spoons, pots, etc. and has been in this business for a long time.

She hopes for the loan N100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Francisco Pedro

texts.es: El señor Francisco tiene la actividad de sastre desde hace 15 años vive en la zona de las delicias  en Villa Fatima, esta casado tiene 5 hijos de diferentes edades todos en edad de estudiantes el cliente se dedica tiempo completo a su actividad; su esposa le colabora aportando a la familia con la venta de dulces y refrescos en la Avenida Las Americas de Villa Fatima donde parten los buses a la localidad de Caranavi, ahí tiene su puesto propio y vende todos los días; el señor Francisco tiene su casa propia la cual fue construyendo poco a poco con su trabajo y el de su esposa, las actividades principales del señor son la confección de trajes completos nuevos, el señor pide la tela a sus clientes los que la adquieren de acuerdo a sus gustos y preferencia posteriormente el señor Francisco saca su revista de moda y hace que el cliente se escoja el modelo una vez escogido, toma las medidas de su cliente, posteriormente comienza con el trazado y confección del traje, además de este tipo de trabajos, realiza el arreglo de trajes desgastados o descocidos o que necesitan algún tipo de reparación esta actividad la realiza en su taller - sastrería.
texts.en:
Francisco has been in the tailoring business for fifteen years. He lives in Las Delicias zone in Villa Fatima. He is married and has five school aged children. He works full time as a tailor. His wife contributes to the support of the family by selling sweets and soft drinks on the Avenida Las Americas in Villa Fatima at the bus stop in the Caranavi area. She has her own stand there, and she sells every day. Francisco has his own house, which he and his wife built little by little. He primarily makes complete new suits. He asks his customers for the fabric, which they get according to their likes and preferences. Then, Franciso takes out his fashion magazine and has the customer look for the style they want. Once selected, he takes the customers measurements. He later starts with the tracing and sewing of the suit. Besides this type of work, he also fixes worn or torn suits. He does all types of mending. He does this in his shop – the tailor shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refund the "anticredico" (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over) on the house

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. is happy working in the rice field, voluntarily helping his parents earn a family income. He has been supporting his siblings to finish their studies. He dreams of having his own rice farm someday. Though he is still young, Daniel is starting to worry about his future.

The farm that he tills now is owned by his parents. He wants to make it productive to help them. He is looking for additional funds to buy the farm needs. He is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI to purchase complete fertilizer, Urea, Crude oil, herbicides and to pay the other laborer on his farm.

Joining in The CEVI program develops more than business skills. He has an opportunity to meet other businessmen talking about their small enterprises. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizer, Urea, Crude oil, herbicide and to pay the laborer.

loans.name: El Buen Soldado (The Good Soldier) Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario el buen soldado esta integrado por 5 personas las cuales se conocen desde hace muchos años atras y han hecho una muy buena amistad, la sra. Macaria I. tiene 59 años de edad, viven en union libre y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen de ella, otros de los hijos de ella son personas mayores y casadas, le ayudan economicamente. 
ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, chicharrones, tocino, costillas de cerdo, tajo. tiene 20 año de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y con las ganancias que obtiene puede sacar adelante su hogar.

el sr. Petronilo C. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 14 hijos de los cuales solo 4 dependen de el. el se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular como ser frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe, pastas, especias, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Langue.

la Sra. Maria Santos M. tiene 61 años de edad, es soltera y tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales todos ya estan casados, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular como ser aroz maiz, frijoles, manteca, jabones.

El Sr. Angel Z. tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 6 hijos, el se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular como ser maiz, frijoles, arroz, azucar, lacteos, manteca, aceite, jabones, y otros productos de la canasta basica.

la sra. Balbina G. tiene 54 años de edad, viven en union libre y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales solo 4 dependen de ella, 
Balbina se dedica a la venta de baleadas, panqueques, cafe con leche, galletas, rosquillas, cereal, tamales, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. su mejor deseo es que sus hijos sean personas honorables.
texts.en:
El Buen Soldado (The Good Soldier) Solidarity Group consists of 5 members who have known each other for many years and have formed a very good friendship. Macaria I. is 59 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has 8 children, 2 of which are dependent upon her. Her other children are adults and are married, and they help her economically. Macaria sells pork, chicharrones, bacon, ribs, and slices of meat. She has been selling for the past 20 years and has gotten her family ahead with her earnings.

Petronilo C. is 65 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has 14 children, 4 of which depend on him. He sells popular consumer products such as beans, rice, sugar, coffee, pastas, and spices. His business is located in the municipal market in the city of Langue.

Maria Santos M. is 61 years old, single, and had 6 children, all of which are already married. She sells popular consumer products such as rice, corn, beans, butter, and soaps.

Angel Z. is 64 years old, is married, and has 6 children. He sells popular consumer products such as corn, beans, rice, sugar, dairy products, butter, oil, soaps, and other staples.

Balbina G. is 54 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has 7 children, 4 of which depend on her. Balbina sells baleadas, pancakes, coffee with milk, cookies, rosquillas, cereal, and tamales. She has been selling for many years. Her biggest dream is that her children become honorable people.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pork, avocados, beans, rice, coffee, corn, soap, bread, household cleaning products, toilet paper, lard, butter, salt, water, soda, flour, cheese, curd, churros, juice, tortillas, and candy.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en: Dominador operates a general store and raises livestock, where some of the daily income from his store is invested. He is already 58 years old and is doing his best despite his retiring age to become successful in his business endeavor. He married Remedios who used to help him most of the time in their store. Luckily, the couple is blessed with three children: Remelyn, Marlon, and Jinky. His dream is to continue to maintain his business to sustain their family's daily needs. To earn further income, Dominador used to wake up very early in the morning to open his store for early customers to buy and not close till 9:00 in the evening. He sacrifices a lot in the business just to sustain his family's important necessities. This is the main reason why he is asking for financial support from Kiva amounting to PHP14,000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Ayichetou

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et est mère d’un enfant. Pour aider financièrement son mari soudeur à couvrir les besoins de son foyer, elle a démarré en 2006 la vente de sacs de charbon de bois dans son quartier Agoè Cacavéli à Lomé. Elle a besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 15 petits sacs et 09 sacs moyens. Elle a une clientèle qui lui est fidèle.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is married and the mother of one child. To help her husband, a welder, to cover the costs of household needs, she started off by selling sacks of charcoal in 2006 in her district, Agoè Cacavéli, in Lomé. She needs to renew her stock; this is the reason she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 13 small sacks of charcoal and 9 mid-size sacks. She has a customer base which is very loyal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Toefuataina

texts.en:
"Toefuataina C. (0) is a 35 years-year-old woman living in the town of Nonoa.  She is married and has 5 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Toefuataina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Toefuataina has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 200 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Toefuataina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Toefuataina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 tala WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Toefuataina is now requesting a new loan of 2000 tala WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Toefuataina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly O. is from the village of Cebulin. She is 62 years old. Shirly is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Shirly owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Shirly has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Shirly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Shirly is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Shirly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: El

texts.en: El I S. is a humble mother who has been blessed with three children. One of her children is married and has started a new home. The other two children are still living in the family home. Her husband is a local merchandise trader. She is a sacrificing and determined woman who has tried to earn money to feed all her children since they were very young. To earn a living, she sells fresh fish to people who are passers-by in the village. El I S. will be using half of the loan as extra capital to sustain her business growth. With the remainder of the loan she will buy candles, in bulk, to re-sell for profit.

loans.use: To sustain her business growth and to buy candles to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita P. owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling goods in her community. She is 54 years old, married and has four grown children. She is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. Amelita has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Amelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Amelita is requesting a loan of 5000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roeuk

texts.en: Roeuk S., 30, lives in Battambang province, Cambodia where she owns a piece of farmland. She grows rice, which she plants twice a year. Besides her farm work, Roeuk S. and her husband always sell sugar cane juice in front of her home to her neighbors. They are the good parents of four children. Three of them are students and other one is still young. The family also finds it hard traveling anywhere, because they don’t have their own vehicle. Roeuk S. would like a loan from Kiva through HKL in order to purchase a motorbike. The new motorbike saves the family from hiring a taxi. Note: Roeuk S. was not available at the time, so her husband is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Nazrullo

texts.en: Nazrullo is married and has six children but only three live with him. These three children are still in school and help him with his store. Nazrullo has thirteen years experience with his business selling groceries. With his small savings and on his own initiative, he decided to set up the store nine years ago. He thought about it because there wasn’t this type of business in his neighborhood. Thanks to the store, Nazrullo was able to buy a small used car which he uses to do deliveries in the mornings from time to time. His wife doesn’t work and when Nazrullo needs to go out she is in charge of selling the groceries. Nazrullo works everyday of the week from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. This hardworking father is motivated by his great love for his family. This is the third time Nazrullo has requested a loan from IMON International and he has proven to be responsible with his repayments in the past. He wants to use the loan to invest in his store. He is sincerely grateful for your support.
