Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos D. is from the village of Ramos East, San Isidro. He is 46 years old. Marcos is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcos owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marcos earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marcos joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcos is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marcos from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en: D. Banzragch is 61 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. His son is 21 years old and currently attends university in the city. His wife helps out with managing the family business. Banzragch operates a small grocery shop in his town. He started his business in 2004 with capital of 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD) after receving a loan from Xacbank, Kiva's Mongolian partner MFI. He took advantage of this loan and used it to successfully grow his business into a stable operation. Today, his working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD). Banzragch hopes further his business again with a new loan. He says, “I want to expand my product variety to attract new customers and I one day hope to own my own trading center." He is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan to purchase groceries for his business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 39-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife. Jihad has been working as a furniture painter since 2004. Jihad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his business. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time.
 
Jihad's work is special because he is skilled and always does nice and precise work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided to start his business because he wanted to work independently and had experience in the field. However, when he first started his business, he had some financial issues. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.en:
Kodirjon is a farmer, not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of a family. He works hard to raise cattle, which he takes out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt it is not an easy task, but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. In the photo you can see Kodirjon’s mother who also helps in this business. Currently, Kodirjon wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle which in the long run will provide better financial income. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Mr. Chay C., 49, and his wife Mrs. Chanthy Hong, 36, live along National Road No.1, about 35kms from Phnom Penh. They are pictured together. They were married in 1993 and have five daughters. One is married and does not live in the family home; three attend school and the other one is still young.  

Chay and his wife have been farming for 17 years. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village. Some parts of his house are in need of repair and it is difficult for his family to live there. Therefore, he is applying for his first loan of 800USD to repair his house and also to purchase a water pump for his rice and vegetable farm.

loans.use: To repair his house and purchase a water pump for his rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam S. sells dried fish, earning approximately US $5 per day. She is 31 years old, married and lives with her three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband is employed at a local referral hospital, earning US $3 per day. With her business, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in the business since 2007. Their standard of living has improved since S. started, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. 

S. is requesting a loan of US $1200 to purchase more dried fish to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish for resale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Silvia G. le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora.
Doña Silvia G. es viuda y tiene dos hijos adolescentes baja su responsabilidad y desea lo mejor para ellos.
La señora Silvia trabaja en una casa particular como niñera, este ingreso una parte de esté ingreso será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia García does not have enough money to finish her home's exterior walls. She is a widow and supports her two teenage children, for whom she strives to provide a good quality of life. Mrs. Silvia works as a nanny in a private home. She will use a portion of her earnings to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home exterior finish (Paint).

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sareth C. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Yorn Chak, is a silk weaver who earns a small income to support the family. Since his wife's business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Sareth C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk. This couple has a child who is a student in the local school. 

Mr. Sareth C. is 32 years old and he is the leader of this group, selected by all the members consisting of four people located in Prey Phdau Tboung village in Takeo province. They are accessing a group loan offered by AMK.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 44 años, es casada, de los cuales tiene 3 hijos, siendo los 2 últimos que se encuentra en etapa escolar, y juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en un centro poblado de Ayacucho. Para Irene su naturaleza fue más fuerte, no en vano desde niña ha vendido todo lo que producían sus padres. Desde entonces ha continuado con esta actividad, que es la agricultura, especialmente la producción y comercialización de Plátano y Cacao. Durante la etapa de siembra y cosecha necesita de peones para ayudarla en su labor, abarcando entonces casi toda la semana, de Lunes a Sábado, desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, trabajando en sus campos con esmero y dedicación. Al final los productos que cosecha son vendidos en su comunidad a un precio accesible para el consumidor. En el futuro espera cumplir su sueño de construir su casa a base de material noble, para que así mejO. la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y asegura cumplir fielmente con todas sus cuotas establecidas, además agradece la transparencia y veracidad de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de verduras, para aumentar y variar la mercadería que vende, de esa manera mejorará sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Irene, 44, is married and has three children; the youngest two are still school-age. They live together in their own home located in a populous section of Ayacucho. Irene has always been of strong character and has always sold everything her parents produced. Since then, she has continued with farming, especially bananas and cocoa. During planting and harvest seasons she requires farmhands to help her with chores taking almost the entire week, from Monday through Saturday, from 7am to 6pm, to work the fields with dedication and great care. At the end, her products are sold in her community at an accessible price for the consumer. In the future she wants to reach her dream of having her house built with substantial materials so that her family’s quality of life will improve. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she assures that she will continue to repay in a timely fashion. She is also grateful for the transparency and honesty of her communal group. She will use the requested funds to buy vegetables so that her stock will be mO. varied thereby improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok M. is a 44-year-old widowed mother who resides in a small house located in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Sok M. works on the massage staff of a small club and is able to earn a small salary of $90 per month to meet her family’s daily expenses. She also relies on the income from her three single children (two are garment workers and one is a waiter in a restaurant), while another four of her children are married and have already started new homes.

Sok M.’s children complain that they face a problem with traveling to work because they have no vehicle. Since Sok M. doesn’t have the money to buy one, she has asked for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her children to use for driving to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her childen to use for commuting

loans.name: Ever Ronal

texts.es:
Ever es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en casa de unos familiares ubicada en el sector San Antonio, una zona urbano marginal que queda próxima a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el brinda su servicio en la periferia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que es por donde suelen circular estos vehículos, debido a que es el único ingreso con el que cuenta para solventar los gastos de su joven familia el siempre trata de brindar un buen servicio.

Debido al constante uso de su vehículo, este ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, es por ello que ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que también piensa utilizar en la compra de nuevas llantas y demás accesorios que le ayuden a brindar su servicio de una mejor manera.

Ever es un joven bastante trabajador y que siempre da todo de si para sacar adelante a su familia, en la zona donde vive el es bastante estimado y conocido por sus vecinos quienes lo consideran alguien honrado y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Ever, 29, lives with his wife and son in the house of a relative in San Antonio, an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo. For three years, Ever has operated a mototaxi business, carrying cargo and passengers on a mototaxi, a motorized vehicle common in these parts. He offers mototaxi services on the outskirts of Chiclayo where these kinds of vehicles are very common. It's the only source of income that Ever has been able to count on and he needs it to support his young family. He works hard to provide a good service. Because Ever's vehicle has been in constant use for the business, it's suffered from various mechanical problems that now require a fix. He's applying to Edpyme Alternativa for his first loan, a request for 1200 new soles that he will use to buy new tires and the other parts that will help him to properly service the vehicle. Ever is a hard-working young man, always concerned about the well-being of his family. He's well regarded in his neighborhood and known by his neighbors who consider him honest and always willing to help others.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mototaxi parts and repairs for taxi business.
